बाद अगर उसको अपनी भोग अपनी विलासिता में अगर वह खर्च कर देता है तो वह तमोगुण हो जाता है एकदम सूक्ष्म बात लेकिन अगर वही पैसा अगर वह चैरिटी में खर्च करता है लोगों की सेवा में खर्च करता है और अपना जीवन को सादगी से बिताता है तो वह व्यक्ति इस धरती पर भगवान ही है विष्णु ही है याद रखना विष्णु कोई स्वर्ग में नहीं बसता रतन टाटा जैसे लोग ही विष्णु है संसार के जो भी लोग कमाया इतना कि जिसकी कोई सीमा नहीं है लेकिन देते समय भी उतने ही बड़े हाथों से दिया तो यह सब लोग जो है यह सत्व गुण के कैरेक्टर में आते हैं और रतन टाटा जैसे लोग इस जन्म में जो उन्होंने यह काम किए हैं अगला जन्म में उनका अध्यात्म को कोई नहीं रोक पाएगा अगला स्टेज अध्यात्म ही है और वो भी कोई साधारण अध्यात्म नहीं होगा बाबा के कोटि तक पहुंचेंगे वो तो यह खासियत है तो मैं पैसे के खिलाफ नहीं हूं क्योंकि मैं बार-बार यह बात बोलता हूं तो कई बार लोगों को ऐसा लगता है कि इंसान पैसा क्यों कमाता है तो फैमिली का भरण पोषण करना यह अनिवार्य है लेकिन कितना कितने में आप अपने आप को सिमट सकते हो वह ज्यादा जरूरी है मैं अगर 500 कमाता हूं लेकिन अगर मेरा 5000 में अगर गुजर बसर मैं कर लूं उतना सादगी का जिंदगी अगर मैं बसर करू और मैं अगर 45000 र अगर मैं विराट की सेवा में लगा दूं तो इससे बढ़कर जीवन नहीं हो सकता तो बात यह है कि आप कमाते कितना है यह नहीं क्योंकि नॉर्मली क्या होता है 99.99% लोग जो पैसा कमाते हैं अपनी खुशी अपने भोग अपने वैभव के लिए कमाते हैं अपनी अयाशी के लिए कमाते हैं मैं अ यह वर्ड इस्तेमाल करूंगा अयाशी तो पैसा कमाना गलत नहीं है लेकिन पैसे का इस्तेमाल कहां करते हैं कैसा करते हैं सवा उसका है तो यह हो गया तमोगुण व्यक्ति अब रजोगुण व्यक्ति जो है वह पैसा कमाता है भोग भोगता है वह भी लेकिन फिर भी वक्त पड़े तो अपना वेतन का बड़े से बड़ा हिस्सा किसी नेक काज के लिए देते समय एक पल के लिए भी सोचता नहीं है वह है रजोगुण और रजोगुण व्यक्ति का जीवन जो है वह डाइनिंग टेबल तक सीमित नहीं रहता वह बेडरूम तक सीमित नहीं रहता बेडरूम का मतलब है वह वासना तक सीमित नहीं रहता तमोगुण जो है बेडरूम वासना और डाइनिंग टेबल यहीं पर यह पूरी जीवन जो है वह घिस जाती है पिस जाती है लेकिन जो रजोगुण व्यक्ति है इसका मतलब यह नहीं है कि वोह वासना उसमें नहीं होती है लेकिन होती है लेकिन उस परे कंट्रोल होता है वो व्यक्ति के जीवन में केवल भोग जो स्थूल भोग है स्थूल भोग नहीं होता जैसे कि तमोगुण में होता है वोह व्यक्ति के जीवन में उससे भी थोड़ा ऊपर उठने की क्षमता होती है उसको म्यूजिक में दिलचस्पी आता है उसको कविताओं में दिलचस्पी आता है उसको किसी आट में अपना रुझान होता है उसका तो उसकी गहराई उसके हृदय को छूने लगती है और चूंकि आठ जो फॉर्म है कला जिसको कहते हैं सरस्वती जिसे कहते हैं सारी कलाओं की जननी है और अगर कोई भी किसी भी कला का प्रेमी हो किसी को म्यूजिक भा सकता है तो किसी को कविता भा सकती है और फिल्मों में ना मुझे फिल्म क्यों पसंद है मैं आपको बताता हूं फिल्मों में यह सारी चीजें कूटकूट के भरी होती है बस नजरिया चाहिए अगर फिल्म का एक बेहतरीन सीन अगर आपके हृदय को छू ले फिल्म का या कोई भी एक गीत उसका म्यूजिक उसकी लिखावट उसकी बनावट अगर आपके हृदय को छू ले तो आप तमोगुण से थोड़ा ऊपर उठ गए आप रजोगुण पर आ गए क्योंकि जिसके जीवन में यह सूक्ष्म कला के प्रति आकर्षण है वह स्थूल भोग में ज्यादा नहीं फस सकता व डेफिनेटली व ऊपर उठेगा जिसकी कला में रुचि है डाइनिंग टेबल के बारे में नहीं सोचेगा ज्यादा नहीं सोचेगा मेरा कहने का मतलब है इसका मतलब यह भी नहीं है कि हर कला प्रेमी मतलब फूड से नफरत करता है ऐसा नहीं है लेकिन फिर भी उसका रुझान ज्यादा नहीं होगा अगर दो चीजें अगर चुनने का समय आ जाए तो सीधा कला के तरफ जाएगा फूड को गिरा देगा इतनी ताकत वह व्यक्ति में होती है तो वह व्यक्ति है रजोगुण और है सत्व गुण सत्व गुण याने जिसको सिर्फ धर्म और नीति भाती है उसको तो ना यह संसार का नश्वर भोग पसंद आता है ना ही यह कला कला के प्रति उसको रेस्पेक्ट जरूर होता है लेकिन कला से भी ऊपर उठकर के जो धर्म है जो नीति है जो श्रेय है उसके प्रति उसकी रुन इतनी होती है कि वक्त पड़े तो कला को भी गिरा देगा और भोग तो उसको छू ही नहीं सकता वह है सत्व गुणी व्यक्ति तो यह जो डायमेंशन है यह हर व्यक्ति में मौजूद है लेकिन किसका रुझान किसमें ज्यादा है और कभी भी देखना जिसका जीवन डाइनिंग टेबल पर शुरू होता है और बेडरूम में खत्म होता है वह व्यक्ति जब भी जीवन में जब कोई विकट प्रसंग आ जाए अनबन हो जाए तो आदमी गाली गलोज पर उतरेगा हाता पाई पर उतरेगा यह तमोगुण का लक्षण है और अगर रजोगुण व्यक्ति है पत्थर डाल कर के आपने शरवानी पर छीट नहीं उड़ाए वह हाथ जोड़ेगा बोलेगा यहां पर यह गलत लोग है अपना रास्ता नापेगा भले वक्त पड़े तो माफी मांग लेगा लेकिन निकल जाएगा लेकिन वो गाली गलोज तक नहीं पहुंचेगा इस रजोगुण व्यक्ति का ये ये है और अगर सत्व गुनी है जो लाख गाली दे कोई व्यक्ति एक जबान से शब्द नहीं निकलेगा उसके उसको बड़े दिल से माफ कर देगा और आगे बढ़ेगा मेरे को जीसस का एक प्रसंग याद आ रहा है सत्व गुण इससे बढ़कर क्या हो सकता है जीसस को एक गलत कारण के वजह से उन्होंने सिर्फ अधर्म का विरोध किया एक चर्च था चर्च में अभी जैसा फॉर एग्जांपल य मंदिर है यहां पर क्या होना चाहिए भजन कीर्तन नामस्मरण सत्संग यही होना चाहिए ना लेकिन अगर कल यहां पर आकर के कोई बंदा मच्छी का बाजार लगा मास काट के बेचने के लिए रख दे यहां पर तो यह मंदिर का अपमान है या नहीं वैसा ही चर्च में हो रहा था एक चर्च को बिजनेस का मरकज बना दिया था बहुत लोगों ने तो जीसस ने उसका विरोध किया जो भी ठेले लगाकर बैठे थे वह जा जा कर के उठा उठा के फेंक देता है बोला तुमने इस देवालय को इस चर्च को तुमने बिजनेस बना दिया बस वह एक गुनाह के चलते और जो वह प्रीच करते थे मैं वह ईश्वर का बेटा हूं वगैरह जो बोलते थे वह लोगों को नहीं अच्छा लगा और उनका यह कारनामा तो लोगों के सर पर चला गया और लोग उनके विरोध में आ गए उनको क्रूसिफिकेशन अगर हो सका तो मैं चाहूंगा कि आप जरूर देखे द पैशन ऑफ क्राइस्ट इंग्लिश में मूवी है एक एक शब्द ठहर के समझ के देखने का प्रयास कीजिएगा मैं ऐसा कहता हूं कि संसार के 10 बेहतरीन मूवीज में से एक है द पैशन ऑफ क्राइस्ट तो अभी उनको क्रूसिफिकेशन मंदिर में यह गलत काम नहीं होने चाहिए उसका विरोध किया उसके चलते उनको क्रूसिफिकेशन देना कहीं इनका कृति देख कर के आपको गुस्सा ना आ जाए तो यह नादान है यह अनजान है कि यह क्या कर रहे हैं यह नहीं जानते हैं तो आप प्लीज इनका कृति देख कर के कहीं आप नाराज ना होना और आप इनको कहीं बददुआ ना देना तो इनको माफ कर देना इससे बढ़कर सत्व गुण क्या हो सकता है इससे बढ़कर सत्व गुण क्या हो सकता है देखिए मैं यहां बाबा का सत्संग करने के लिए बैठा हुआ जो चीजें अच्छी होंगी वह मैं आपके सामने रखूंगा क्योंकि वह चीजें मेरे हृदय को भा गई है और बाबा ने मुझे यह सिखाया है कि हर धर्म में बहुत अच्छाइयां है उसे स्वीकार ले कृष्णा और वही बात आपके सामने रख रहा हूं जो कट्टरवादी लोग है शायद उसको मेरी यह बातें अच्छा ना लगे और मुझे फर्क नहीं पड़ता तो खीले ठोके जा रहे हैं हाथ में लहू बह रहा है और उनके बारे में विषमता नहीं है हृदय में बल्कि ऊपर मालिक के तरफ देख कर के प्रार्थना निकलती है कि हे मालिक इनका यह कृति देख कर के इनका यह कारनामा देख कर के कहीं आप इन पर क्रोधित ना हो जाना इन्हें माफ करना यह नहीं जानते हैं यह क्या कर रहे हैं इसीलिए जीसस भगवान है तो यह है तमोगुण रजोगुण और सत्व गुण और यह तीनों गुण हम में विद्यमान है यह नहीं बोलना चाहिए किसी में सत्व गुण ज्यादा है तो किसी में रजोगुण ज्यादा है तो किसी में तमोगुण ज्यादा है अभी देखिए मैं है ना एक कहानी बताता हूं तो यह गुण जो है और ज्यादा साफ हो जाएगा एक राजा के दरबार में तीन गुनहगारों को लाया गया तीन लोगों ने तीन अलग-अलग तरह के गुनाह किए थे उसमें से एक रजोगुण था उनमें से एक तमोगुण था और एक सत्व गुणी था तीनों का गुना अलग था एक बंदे ने बहुत छोटा सा कोई तो मिस्टेक किया था और एक बंदे ने थोड़ा सा बड़ा गुनाह किया था और तीसरे ने इतनी बड़ा गुनाह किया था कि जिसकी कोई माफी नहीं हो सकती है ऐसे तीन गुनहगारों को एक राजा की सभा में लाया गया एक बंदा जो एकदम छोटा सा मामूली सा कोई मिस्टेक हुआ था और उसको लाया गया राजा के सामने खड़ा किया राजा ने सिर्फ एक ही बात कहा हे बंदे मुझे तो से यह उम्मीद नहीं थी कि तुम ऐसा कर सकते हो सिर्फ इतना बात बोला डाटा नहीं प्रेम से क्या कहा कि हे बंदे तुम एक गलती कर सकते हो सच में मैं मैं उम्मीद नहीं कर सकता ऐसा मैं कल्पना ही नहीं कर सकता ऐसा प्लीज दोबारा मत करना इतनी सी बात सुना वोह बंदा जिससे वो छोटी सी मिस्टेक हुई थी और और उसको इतना बुरा लगा वह बात का कि वह गांव छोड़कर चला गया गांव ही छोड़ दिया और दूसरा बंदा जिसका गुनाह इससे बहुत ज्यादा था राजा ने शासन दिया कि इसको हंटर से 100 हंटर मारा जाए इसको और फिर उसको छोड़ा जाए 100 हंटर मारा जाता है वह दूसरे भक्त को वो दूसरे गुना ार को 100 हंटर खाने के बाद वह घर जाते हैं और घर बंद करके तीन महीने तक घर से बाहर नहीं निकलते हैं लोगों को फेस नहीं कर पाते हैं और एक तीसरा होता है जिसका गुनाह जिसका अपराध इतना बड़ा है अक्षम्य अपराध है उसने बहुत बड़ी गलती की है तो राजा शासन देता है कि इसका आधा सर मुंडवा देना मुंह को काला करना गधे पर उल्टा बिटा करके गांव में इसका जुलूस निकालना सबके सामने तो बिठाया जाता है उसको उल्टा और गांव में सब लोग देख रहे हैं हर आदमी अपना अपना दरवाजा खोल के व बंदे को देख रहा है कि गांव में चौराहे से मतलब जब जाता है गधे पर बिठा कर के उसका जुलूस निकालता है तो जुलूस निकालते समय वह घुमा घुमा के घुमा घुमा के पूरा गाव पर घुमाते हैं उसको जैसे व अपने घर के सामने आता है उसका घर भी पड़ता है बीच में गांव में तो बीवी से कहता है कि अरे बस अब थोड़ा ही देर बाकी है य जुलूस खत्म हो जाएगा मैं घर पर आता हूं पानी गर्म करके रखना स्नान कर लेता हूं यह है तमोगुण व्यक्ति इसको तमोगुण कहते हैं और जो सबसे पहला व्यक्ति था जिसको यह बोला गया कि मुझे तुमसे यह उम्मीद नहीं थी प्लीज यह दोबारा मत करना इतना बोलने की देरी थी वह भी हृदय को ऐसा लग गया कि गांव छोड़ के चला गया और दूसरे बंदे को हंटर पड़ती है 100 कोड़े गिरते हैं और वह तीन महीनों तक घर से बाहर नहीं निकलता है और यह बंदे को आधा सर मुंडवा के मुंह काला करके गधे पर उल्टा बिठा के जुलूस निकाला जा रहा है और अपना घर जब पड़ता है तो बीवी से कहता है कि बस थोड़ा ही बचा है उतना करके मैं वापस आता हूं पानी गर्म करके रखना मुझे स्नान करना है तो यह है तीन गुण कि अगर यह जीवन है अगर तमोगुण ही अगर जीवन हमारे जीवन में अगर प्रधान है इसीलिए आहार आहार में भी सबसे ज्यादा तमोगुण आहार को नॉनवेज को बोला है मांसाहार को बोला है मांसाहार के प्रति अगर किसी का रुझान हद से ज्यादा है तो वह लाख साधनाएं कर ले मन में निश्चल नहीं आएगी ठहराव नहीं आएगा शांति नहीं मिलेगी और जीवन का जो उस से ऊपर का डायमेंशन है वह कभी नहीं खुलेगा कभी नहीं खुलेगा आप लाख कोशिश कर लो और दूसरी बात जो लोग हद से ज्यादा मांसाहार करते हैं मच्छी खाते हैं अब देखिए मांसाहार खाने के बाद तमोगुण बढ़ता है इस पर तो कोई डाउट ही नहीं है कभी भी देखना जो लोग हस से ज्यादा गाली गलोज करते हैं जो लोग हाता पाई तक जाते हैं समझो ऐसे 50 लोगों को आप खड़ा कीजिए इनमें य गुण है कि यह लोग गाली देते हैं बहुत जल्दी गुस्सा करते हैं और बहुत जल्दी इनका हाथ चलता है ऐसे 50 लोगों को खड़ा कीजिए और आप 50 लोगों को से यह पूछिए कि आप आहार में ज्यादा क्या पसंद करते हैं सबका आंसर होगा नॉनवेज सबका आंसर होगा नॉनवेज मतलब नॉनवेज कॉमन होगा उनमें तो नॉनवेज में यह चीज है और मैं यह बात गोवा में कह रहा हूं यह मैं अच्छी तरह से जानता हूं जो आप सबके लिए बहुत मुश्किल है लेकिन अगर बाबा से सच्ची मोहब्बत करते हो ना तो यह त्यागने की ताकत रखोगे और अगर जीवन में सुकून चाहते हो शांति चाहते हो और यह भोग विलासिता से ऊपर उठना चाहते हो जीवन का हायर डायमेंशन तक पहुंचना चाहते हो तो फिर य निचली चीजों को गिराना पड़ेगा तमोगुण से रजोगुण रजोगुण से सगुण तक की यात्रा है लेकिन सत्व गुण का भी अहंकार खतरनाक होता है ऐसा शास्त्र कहता है कि मैं सत्व गुणी मैं बहुत नर इंसान हूं मैं बाकी लोगों से बहुत ज्यादा साफ सुथरा इंसान हूं तो यह भी बड़ा घातक है एक सत्व गुणी व्यक्ति की विचारधारा कितनी शुद्ध होती है मैंने रतन टाटा जी का एग्जांपल देकर के वह बात बताया लेकिन है ना सत्व गुण में भी नहीं फसना है निर्गुण में प्रवेश करना है क्योंकि कई बार ऐसा होता है कि अगर निर्गुण में आपको जगह ना मिली निर्गुण तक अगर आप यात्रा ना कर सके तो वह सत्व गुण से कभी कभार यह माया इतनी खतरनाक है कि कभी-कभी वापस नीचे की तरफ ले आती है अगर गलत संगत मिल गया सत्व गुण का अहंकार आ गया कि मैं इतना अच्छा व्यक्ति हूं वह अहंकार भी कभी-कभी इंसान को गिरा देता है इसीलिए अहंकार का जहां नामो निशान मिट जाता है जहां तीनों गुणों का नामों निशान मिट जाता है उस परम अवस्था का नाम है निर्गुण निर्गुण निराकार वहां पहुंचने के बाद आदमी नीचे आने की संभावना नहीं रहती है इसीलिए कहते हैं कि सत्व गुण से भी ऊपर निर्गुण है तो जब निर्गुण तक पहुंच जाते हो तो नीचे आने की संभावना नहीं है लेकिन अगर रजोगुण से ऊपर उठे हो सत्व गुण तक भी गए हो तो भी वहां से नीचे गिरने की संभावना बहुत ज्यादा है मैंने कल या परसों शायद किसी के सामने ये एग्जांपल रखा था मैं अपनी जीवन की बात बताता हूं बचपन से ही आध्यात्मिक माहौल रहा तो बहुत छोटी उम्र से अध्यात्म के प्रति रुझान था लेकिन कोई भी सवाल कोई पूछता था तो आंसर ऐसे ही निकल जाता था तो डेफिनेटली पिछले जन्म में कमाया हुआ ज्ञान होगा ये ऐसा अदर वाइज पॉसिबल नहीं है या फिर कोई कुछ पढ़ रहा हूं तो ऐसा लगता था कि मैं पहले से जानता हूं तो मेरी उम्र की एक 21 22 साल या 23 साल के दरमियान मतलब जब ऐसा लगा कि मैं हर चीज जानता हूं हर चीज जानता हूं कोई किताब पढ़ रहा हूं तो ऐसा लग रहा है कि मैं जानता हूं किसी से कोई बात कर रहा हूं कुछ अच्छी बातें मैं सुन रहा हूं तो मेरा हृदय कहता है कि मैं जानता हूं मैं जानता हूं मैं जानता हूं यह मुझे ऐसा लगा कि यह कहीं मुझे सात्विक अहंकार की तरफ तो नहीं ले जाएगा यह क्योंकि मैं जानता हूं यह बहुत गंदी चीज है यह भी सात्विक अहंकार है इससे भी परे जाना है तो हर बार यह चीज सताती थी तो बाबा से जुड़ने के बाद ऐसा लगा कि इसको गिराने का एक ही तरीका है कि जो बंदा दिख रहा है वह बाबा का विराट रूप है बाबा के सामने झुकना बहुत आसान है लेकिन बाबा के विराट के सामने अगर झुक जाऊं हर व्यक्ति के आगे अगर जुक जाऊ हर प्राणी के आगे अगर जुक जाऊं हर प्राणी में अगर बाबा को देख सकूं तो वह है सच्ची भक्ति वहां पर अहंकार के लिए जगह नहीं बचेगी देखिए मैं 5 हज करोड़ कोरोना में लोगों की सेवा के लिए दे दी अगर भावना यह होगा कि मैंने 5 हज करोड़ आज लोगों को दिया है आज इतने लोग मेरे यह मेडिकल असिस्टेंसिया बाद अगर आख से बाबा के सामने आंसू निकल रहे हैं कि मालिक तेरी यह करुणा है कि तूने मुझे वैसी बुद्धि दी कि मैं लोगों को मदद कर सकूं तो आज यह जो कार्य मेरे हाथों हुआ है इसका पूरा श्रेय मैं आपको देता हूं अगर आपकी करुणा ना होती तो मैं यह कार्य कर ही ना पाता तो वह है सत्व गुण से यह व्यक्ति आज नहीं तो कल बाहर निकलेगा यह निर्गुण के जाएगा नहीं तो अगर वह अहंकार है सत्व गुण तो किया सत्कर्म तो किया लेकिन अहंकार रखा तो वहां से नीचे उतरने का पूरी संभावना है इसीलिए ही सत्व गुण को भी उनको अर्पण करना है कि तेरे करुणा से हुआ मैं एक बात बताता हूं कोई भी सत्कर्म जो होता है अपने से कौन करता है वो हम लोगों को लगता है कि मैंने किया नहीं हम कर ही नहीं सकते हैं माया का प्रभाव इतना खतरनाक है ना कि एक सत्कर्म हमसे नहीं हो सकता यह कड़वी सच्चाई है प्लीज इस बात को स्वीकार एगा एक भी सत्कर्म हम अपने आप से नहीं कर सकते हैं दुष्कर्म हम अपने आप से कर सकते हैं क्योंकि इंसान की ढ हमेशा दुष्कर्म की तरफ है सत्कर्म की तरफ नहीं है तो अगर एक सत्कर्म होता है एक एग्जांपल देता हूं मैं रास्ते से जा रहा हूं एक एक्सीडेंट देखा मैंने तो मेरा दिल में सबसे पहले वह व्यक्ति को देखने के बाद करुणा जगना चाहिए कि बाप रे यह खून से लथपथ पड़ा है यहां पे अगर इसको समय पर मेडिकल असिस्टेंट मिल जाएगा तो शायद यह बच जाएगा तो मैं चार लोगों को या दो लोगों को इस्तेमाल में ले आऊं उनका सपोर्ट लू और उसको गाड़ी में बिठा करके हॉस्पिटल ले जाऊं और उसका इलाज हो और वहां पर मैंने 5 हज 6 हजार 7 हजार रप जो मेरे पास था मैंने गल पे कर दिया वह बंदा तीन दिन के बाद ठीक हो गया अभी देखिए यह एक नेक काम हो गया मुझसे या आपसे आप ही थे समझो उस जगह पर आपने यह नेक काम को अंजाम दिया लेकिन वह नेक काम को अंजाम देने में भगवान के कितना बड़ा आथ है मैं आपको बताता हूं सबसे पहला आप घर से जब बाहर निकले वह इंसिडेंट होने से पहले वह एक्सीडेंट होने से पहले आपका घर का माहौल बहुत अच्छा होना चाहिए आप बीवी से झगड़ा करके बाहर निकले हुए नहीं होनी चाहिए अच्छे से समझना आप अपने घर में बीवी से झगड़ा करके बहुत ही एक विचित्र मानसिक दशा में हाइपर टेंशन में अगर आप बाहर निकले हैं तो वह एक्सीडेंट देख कर के भी आप नहीं देखेंगे क्यों क्योंकि आप खुद स्थिर नहीं हो तो घर में ऐसा कोई गंदा माहौल नहीं रखा मालिक ने उस समय में यह उनका पहला करुणा अच्छा ठीक है अब एक्सीडेंट देखा उस समय में मन में जो करुणा जागे कि नहीं इसे बचाना चाहिए यह मालिक ने आपके हृदय में भरा यह उनकी दूसरी करुणा और तीसरा आपके हाथ शरीर में इतनी ताकत है कि आप उसको उठा सको आप गाड़ी में डाल सको यह जो शरीर में ताकत दिया मालिक ने यह उनकी तीसरी करुणा और जो हॉस्पिटल ले गए और 70000 का बिल पे करना पड़ा उस समय आपके बैंक अकाउंट में 70 मौजूद थे यह चौथी करुणा मतलब इतने सारे फेसेस से गुजरने के बाद आप वह काम को अंजाम दे पाए और किसी में भी आपका हाथ नहीं है अगर समझो घर में आप झगड़ा करके निकलते बीवी से तो आप यह सेवा कर पाते आपके जेब में अगर पैसा ना होता तो आप य सेवा कर पाते अगर मालिक ने वह करुणा आपके हृदय में ना भरा होता व क्षण में तो आप यह सेवा कर पाते मतलब एक सत्कर्म के पीछे कितने फैक्टर्स मौजूद रहते हैं तब जाकर के आपके हाथों एक सत्कर्म होता है तो उसका श्रेय कभी भी अपने आप मत लेना उसका श्रेय जाता है बाबा को उनके करुणा के बगैर आप एक सत्कर्म नहीं कर सकते संसार में एक सत्कर्म बाहर वालों के लिए तो छोड़ो आप अपने गरवा के लिए कर सकते हैं तो एक सत्कर्म के लिए इतनी चीजें जब सपोर्टिव रही तब जाकर के एक सत्कर्म आपसे हुआ तो फिर यह कहना कि यह सत्कर्म मैंने किया vegetarians veg food and for those who ate non veg food like muslims or some of our own people who are accustomed to eating non-vegetarian, Babab would serve them according to their needs At beginning, Baba would descend to their level and feed them according to their desires The idea was that \"If I will take care of their desires willingly, then for sure one day they will also take care of my wishes and desires too\" So why shouldn't I consider their wishes first This was Baba's greatness But, if we accept their greatness and don't reciprocate it, then their could not be any great dishonesty than this When Baba would bring all the ingredients to cook food in a large pot(handi) then there's a specific ovi in chapter 38, Ovi 37 \"To make the fire in the fireplace burn slow or it cooks nicely that's why it is said as \"Chulli majal vaishvanar\" meaning the fire in the stove \"Indaney he swaye khalvar\" meaning baba would himself control the intensity of the flame \"Karit varchevar Baba\" meaning moving the faggots up and down Now this is a simple leela When at the start we add pulses or raw meat, we add the wood fuel to increase the flame so that it cooks properly But as soon as it is cooked we remove the wood so that the intensity of the flame decreases Similarly this human body also becomes handi(clay pot), after it is undertaken by Baba and this need to be cooked when the Tamas increases more the tamogun(tamas), more the intensity of the flame So Baba gives more taap(pain), with increase in flame intensity so this tamogun gets removed as soon as possible and as soon as the tamogun is cooked and it leaves the body and satvagun enters, the flame intensity is decreased just like we decrease the flame at the end time of cooking Baba also used to decrease the flame as soon as the rajvagun, tamogun leaves hence no need to cook on high intensity anymore So automatically the wood fuel used to be decreased Even if the leela is talking about handi(clay pot), but way more deeper mystry is hidden in it It is telling us our state, that Baba cooks us, just llike he cooks the handi(clay pot) The intensity of the flame is based on the level of tamogun in you, More tamogun, more pain of the flame and as soon as I think tamogun has left and you have entered rajogun then the flame intensity is decreased further and if rajogun is also finished then again the flame intensity is decreased Then the nectar of dhyan, dharana, and samadhi is obtained even such a small thing as handi is filled with immense depth To clear this further I'll take the story of laxmibai shinde, Adhyaya 42 Few days are only left for Baba to take samadhi, and one day he asks laxmibai shinde to bring him a piece of bread and some dry condiment so she thinks Baba is hungry therefore she hurrily goes back home and brings what she is asked to and give's it to Baba But Baba picks up the bread as it is and feed's the dog nearby. Laxmibai stood stunned there and she asks Baba, I ran with such eagerness to get you bread because you were hungry. You didn't even put a single bite in your mouth, and you fed it to the dog. At that time, Baba says, \"Oh Lakshmi if I am hungry, I can speak with my tongue. But these creatures (animals) don't have a tongue, so who will understand their hunger? This one was hungry, so I fed it in my name. So Baba is saying, \"You fed me your whole life, Lakshmi.\" Baba would not touch anyone else's food until Lakshmi's bread arrives , it is written. And what is the reason for that? How sincerely must she have fed him? Baba would never have seen what she fed him in his life. Remember this He saw how sincerely she fed him. That's why even if delicious food with five courses was brought, Baba would not touch it until Lakshmi's food came. He would wait, he would wait for hours even though five-course meals were brought, he could be fed in a golden plate But Baba would still wait. Do you know why? Just imagine how much goodwill Lakshmi must have had to feed Baba food throughout her life. And through this leela, Baba wanted to tell Lakshmi, \"Oh Lakshmi, you have fed me till today, there is no doubt in your faith towards me. But in just a few days, I am going to bid farewell to this world. I am going to leave this body. So I deliberately fed this bread to the dog today, because after I leave, will you stop this service? No, now that service should increase on a larger scale. Until today, you have served this manifest form of mine. From today onwards,you have to serve this whole universe, my cosmic form. That's why I made you accustomed to it beforehand, by feeding it to the dog This is one depth of this leela. And then after a few days, Baba says, \"My teeth are not strong enough now. So, crumble the chapati into warm milk, break it into small pieces and put it in. And then soak it and bring that milk-mixed bread to feed me.\" And it is said that Baba kept eating that for a few days. Then after some more time, Baba says, Lakshmi, now even that cannot be eaten. So, bring kheer (rice pudding).\" Kheer doesn't even need to be chewed; you can swallow it as soon as you put it in your mouth. So, understand this sequence well first dry bread, then bread soaked in milk, and then finally kheer. And the first dry bread was fed to an animal When we have animal-like Tamogun within us, at that time Baba gives us dry bread to eat, meaning the penance is equally rigorous. How many such leelas can I tell you? First, he makes us eat dry bread so that the Tamogun within us is destroyed. As soon as Tamogun is destroyed, Baba says, \"Now that much dry bread is not needed. Now it has come to Rajogun. Now, to destroy its Rajogun, bread soaked in milk can be chewed easily But when Rajogun is also destroyed, and only Satvagun remains, Baba says, \"Now give kheer to this person.\" Kheer doesn't even need to be chewed; you can swallow it as soon as you put it in your mouth. And here, kheer means initially, in penance, selfless service, all kinds of physical labor, everything came. But as soon as Tamogun and Rajogun are gone, and Satvagun is also gone then kheer is attained. Kheer means a person becomes engrossed in meditation, contemplation, and samadhi. They attain meditation, contemplation, samadhi. That is kheer. So these leelas are so deep. So we have to reach from dry bread to kheer. Every human being's journey will start with dry bread. That's why the first few years are very tough. I am saying this from experience. So be prepared for that. But only those who eat that dry bread will later attain the nectar of kheer. So these are very small leelas. Does anyone have any doubt about this? Please Annaji, you initially explained the importance of the three Gunas. Rajogun, Tamogun, and Satvagun. You also gave an example of Ratan Tata. Right! And you said that whatever money we earn, if we invest it in service, there is nothing wrong with it And finally, you said that whatever you do, in the next birth, there will be no deficiency in your sadhana at Sai Baba's feet. Absolutely. My question is, I have read in Sai Satcharitra that when you do this, you attain salvation while living in the world. So how will a second birth be received? Because there is more Satvagun in it, right? Why should we understand that a second birth is needed to attain salvation? If a person whose Satvagun is at such a level, okay, then salvation should be attained, right? It should be done, okay, okay. Why a second birth? Because after passing through 8.4 million species, we get human birth. It is written in Chapter 8 that we attain salvation in this very birth. So what about the second birth? On this, a little... Okay, okay, understood. It's a journey from Tamogun to Rajogun, and from Rajogun to Satvagun. But even the ego of Satvagun is dangerous, so the scriptures say. That \"I am Satvaguni. I am a very noble person. I am much cleaner than others.\" So this is also very fatal. How pure is the ideology of a Satvaguni person? I explained that by giving the example of Ratan Tata. But one should not get stuck even in Satvagun. One must enter Nirgun (beyond attributes). Because many times it happens that if you don't find a place in Nirgun, if you cannot travel to Nirgun, then sometimes this Maya (illusion) is so dangerous that it sometimes brings you back down. If you get bad company, if the ego of Satvagun comes, that \"I am such a good person,\" that ego also sometimes brings a person down. That's why where the ego's trace is completely erased, where the trace of all three Gunas is erased, that supreme state is called Nirgun (attributeless), Nirgun nirakar After reaching Nirgun Nirakar (formless), there is no possibility of coming down. That's why it is said that above Satvagun is Nirgun So when you reach Nirgun, there is no possibility of coming down. But if you have risen above Rajogun and even gone to Satvagun, there is still a very high possibility of falling down from there. I think I gave this example to someone yesterday or the day before. I will tell you about my own life. From childhood, there was a spiritual environment. So, from a very young age, there was an inclination towards spirituality But if anyone asked any question, the answer would just come out So, it must definitely be knowledge earned in a past life, otherwise it's not possible. Or if someone is reading something, it feelt like I already knew it. So, around 21, 22, or 23 years old, I felt like I knew everything, If I was reading a book it felt like I knew it. If I was talking to someone, if I was hearing good things, my heart would say, \"I know, I know, I know.\" This made me feel like, \"Is this not leading me towards sattvic ego?\" Because \"I know\" is a very bad thing. This is also sattvic ego. One has to go beyond this too So, after connecting with Baba, I felt that the only way to bring this down is that the person who is visible is Baba's cosmic form. It's very easy to bow down to Baba, but if I bow down before Baba's cosmic form if I bow down before every person, if I bow down before every creature, if I can see Baba in every creature, that is true devotion. There will be no room for ego there. See, Ratan Tata spent thousands of crores of rupees during Corona for medical assistance. If Ratan Tata's feeling was that, \"I have given 500 crores to people today. Today, so many people are alive because of my medical assistance.\" If this is the feeling, then it is the ego of Satvagun. That is dangerous. But if after that same 5000 crores, tears are rolling down his eyes in front of Baba, saying, \"Lord, this is your compassion that you gave me such wisdom that I could help people.\" \"So, today, for this work that has happened through my hands, I give all the credit to you. If your compassion had not been there I would not have been able to do this work.\" So, that person will come out of Satvagun today or tomorrow. This will go towards Nirgun. Otherwise, if there is ego, even if good deeds are done, but ego is kept, hen there is a full possibility of falling down from there. That's why even Satvagun should be offered to Him, that \"it happened because of your compassion.\" I'll tell you one thing. Any good deed that happens, who does it on their own? We think that \"I did it.\" No, we cannot do it. The effect of Maya is so dangerous that we cannot do a single good deed ourselves. This is a bitter truth, please accept this. We cannot do a single good deed on our own. We can do bad deeds on our own. Because a human being's inclination is always towards bad deeds, not towards good deeds. I'll give you an example. I'm walking on the road, I saw an accident. So, my heart should first feel compassion after seeing that person, \"Oh my God, he is covered in blood here. If he gets medical assistance on time,he might survive.\" So, I involve four people or two people, take their support, put him in a car and take him to the hospital, and he should get the treatment there. And there, I paid 50,000 or 70,000 rupees, or whatever I had, through Google Pay. That person recovered after three days Now look, this is a good deed accomplished by me or let's say from you. You only accomplished the good deed But how big a hand God has in accomplishing that good deed, I will tell you. First, when you left your house, before that incident, your home environment should be very good, you should not have left after fighting with your wife. Understand this well. If you have left your house after fighting with your wife, in a very strange mental state, in hypertension, then even after seeing that accident, you won't see it. Why? Because you yourself are not stable. So, the Lord did not keep any bad environment in the house at that time. This is his first compassion. Okay, now you saw the accident. At that moment, the compassion that arises in your mind, that \"no, he should be saved,\" the Lord filled this in your heart. This is his second compassion And third, you have enough strength in your body to lift him, to put him in the car The strength given by the Lord to your body, this is his third compassion And when you took him to the hospital and had to pay a bill of 70,000 at that time, 70,000 was available in your bank account. This is the fourth compassion. Meaning, after going through so many phases, you were able to accomplish that work, and you had no hand in any of it. If, suppose, you had left after fighting with your wife, would you have been able to do this service? If you didn't have money in your pocket, would you have been able to do this service? If the Lord had not filled that compassion in your heart at that moment, would you have been able to do this service? Meaning, how many factors are present behind a good deed, only then does a good deed happen through your hands. So, never take the credit for it yourself. The credit goes to Baba. Without his compassion, you cannot do a single good deed in the world. Leaving aside doing a good deed for outsiders, can you do it for your own family? So, for one good deed, so many things were supportive, only then did a good deed happen through you. So then, to say that \"I did this good deed,\" what could be greater ignorance than that? How easily a person falls into ego, thinking, \"I did this.\" Meaning, if the Lord's compassion is not there, you cannot do a single small thing on your own in this world. This is why, whenever a good deed happens through you, there should be tears in your eyes to thank Baba, saying, \"Lord, it was your compassion that this good deed happened through my hands, otherwise a wretch like me could never do this good deed.\" So, the more minutely you observe life, the more intricacies will open up So, this was about reducing and increasing the fire in the stove, increasing or decreasing the degree of penance. Baba knows best what is more in whom, how much to give to whom, how much to reduce the troubles. That's why, even if there are more troubles, one should assume that there is more Tamogun within me, that's why Baba is giving me more trouble. In that phase, avoiding more sins, enduring that phase somehow while continuously remembering Baba. After that, there are only good days. So, this was about reducing and increasing the fire in the stove. It was a very small leela, but its depth has no limit.     "Title": "भक्ती जितनी बड़ती है उतनी ही मन की गंदगी भी बड़ती है ऐसा क्यों ?",
    "URL": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d56d5xBKqi0",
    "Transcript": "Om Sai Ram Countless salutations at the feet of all Sai devotees. Today’s topic has emerged from many sources - Satsangs, Zoom sessions, written messages, and regular comments from devotees. One question which is frequently asked, and I thought, let’s address that question today. Many devotees say: “The more we engage in devotion, the more we practice spiritual discipline and worship, the more impure thoughts arise in our minds. Why is it so? This is a very common question. Those who are sincerely devoted to Baba - or any deity, who are immersed in worship and devotion, inevitably go through this phase. As their devotion deepens, the more negative, impure thoughts seem to arise, with greater force. This is not mere imagination. Every devotee walking this path expresses this experience. Before I share my thoughts, let’s first see what Baba says about this. in Sai Satcharitra The answer is given by Baba Himself, Chapter 13, verses 23 to 30 In just seven verses, He offers profound insight. I will take each verse one by one. First, I’ll read it in Marathi, and then I’ll translate it into Hindi. I’m reading in Marathi because that’s how the text is structured, and since Baba Himself authored this scripture, Baba’s words are in Marathi and might be a bit difficult for some to understand, but when I translate it into Hindi afterward, everything will become clear. Since this is written by Baba, we’ll take it as it is. Even though I am a South Indian, my heartfelt intention is to present Baba’s words in Marathi as they were written. Verse 23, Chapter 13: 'Jeev mhanti sattādhīsh, karīl je je yeil ichchhesh' 'aise jayache vāṭe mānas, kathānakas ya parisave' The soul (jiva) says to itself, “I am powerful, I can do whatever I wish.” Those who believe, “I am independent, I am powerful, I can do whatever I want,” should listen carefully to Baba’s words that follow. Further Baba says in, verse 24 'Jeev jarī kharā swatantra, sukhā lāgī kashtatā ahorātra,' 'padarī padate mātra duhkha, he to charitra satteche' Baba says, if the soul is truly independent and can do whatever it desires, If there were even a speck of truth in this. then it would engage into actions only for happiness, 24 hours a day. Yet, despite this, a chain of sorrows follows it. Why is this so? Because, if it were truly independent, it would be tirelessly engaged in actions for happiness, yet sorrow relentlessly pursues it, tracking it down as if seeking its address. Baba says, “This is your so-called power, this is your so-called independence.” 'Dukhe taalavaya laagi, asta savdhaan jaago jaagi,' 'ti tya dhundit laagvegi, tyachich maagi ghetat' And to avoid sorrows, a person remains ever-cautious, every moment, he stays alert, ensuring no sorrow touches him, no calamity befalls him. Yet, despite this, sorrow finds him, seeks him out, and inevitably befalls him. And further says, 'Varu jaata gala padati, jhaaduni takita adhik lipadati.' 'vaugi jivachi dhadpad ti, ahoraati to sheen' Baba says, if you try to push sorrows away, they cling to you. If you try to shrug them off, they cling even more tightly. This is the soul’s futile effort and struggle. In this endeavor to escape sorrow, day and night, it remains engrossed, yet sorrow never leaves its side. Baba further says, 'Jeev jari khara swavash, tari to asta purna sukhvash,' 'dukhacha ek lavalesh, resbharhi natalta.' If the soul were truly powerful, truly independent in its actions, if it had such power, it would always remain in a state of happiness, You would be immersed solely in joy, and not even a speck of sorrow would enter your life. And then Baba goes on to say, 'Paapa na aacharita kadhi, punyachich karita samruddhi,' 'sukhachich sampaditi vruddhi, swatantra buddhi mhanoni.' You would never engage in sinful actions. You would cultivate only virtuous deeds, accumulating merit in your life, and thus, experience only happiness. Since you are independent, So, first of all to experience happiness, you would not commit any sinful actions, You would bring only virtuous deeds into your life, And thus, in life, experience nothing but joy alone. But Baba further says, 'Pari jeev nahi swatantra, paathi laagle karmatantra,' 'tayacha khelachi vichitra, haati kalsutra karmaache.' But Baba says, “O soul, you are not independent. You are not powerful.” 'Pari jeev nahi swatantra, paathi laagle karmatantra,' Which means, the deep-rooted impressions from many lifetimes follows you. The tendencies from countless births trail you. Their shadow looms over your existence. You remain entangled in the habits of many lifetimes. As the saying goes, “Old habits die hard.” So, the tendencies, habits, and impressions from past lives force you to commit sinful actions. Knowingly or unknowingly, sinful deeds are committed through you. Baba clearly states this. 'Pari jeev nahi swatantra, paathi laagle karmatantra,' In this way, the desires, impressions, sinful actions and bad habits from many lifetimes are following you and hover over you like a shadow. You are caught in their grip. Even if you wish, you cannot perform those virtuous deeds, because the web of karmas from past lives trail you. 'tayacha khelachi vichitra, haati kalsutra karmaache.' And remember, this thread of karma is strange and mysterious, pulling you toward sinful actions even against your will. And compels you to perform those wrong deeds. This is Karma Tantra (Karmic Law) It is no simple matter Next comes a very important verse, Baba says, 'Punyakade laksh jaay, paapakade odhiti paay,' 'Satkarmacha shodhita thaay, kukarma ka aatude.' All the wisdom you have attained in life, all the discrimination with which you have enriched your intellect, has instilled in you the realization that one must abstain from unrighteous deeds, and pursue only virtuous actions. This intellect perpetually inclines toward meritorious deeds, seeking to amass only virtue, yearning to embody noble actions in your life. 'Punyakade laksh jaay' Meaning, your aim is directed toward righteousness. 'Paapakade odhiti paay,' Yet, your steps, against your will, are drawn towards sin. Your vision is fixed on righteousness, but your feet tread the path of transgression. This inner conflict, this struggle, is an inevitable part of every soul’s journey. For the desires and impressions from countless lifetimes compel you, even unwillingly. Just as a moth is irresistibly drawn to a flame and perishes in its radiance, so too is a person helplessly driven to commit wrong deeds. Baba clearly explains this: 'Punyakade laksh jaay'- Though your aim is to pursue virtuous actions, 'Paapakade odhiti paay,'- your steps veer toward sin. 'Satkarmacha shodhita thaay, kukarma ka aatude.' Despite your resolve to seek righteousness, why do these sinful acts occur? Baba has elucidated this clearly. That is why, the more we engage in worship, the more we immerse ourselves in devotion, the more we dedicate ourselves to spiritual practice, our mind, against our wishes, prompts us to commit unrighteous acts. This is because we carry an immense burden, a legacy of impressions, desires, and harmful habits from past lives. These sinful acts accumulate over time, forming an enormous heap of tendencies, a crushing weight under which we are entirely subdued. Despite our reluctance, wrong deeds manifest through us. This is precisely why, the more we engage in spiritual practice, the more impure thoughts arise in our minds, and at times, sinful actions occur as well. Baba Himself declares that this path is arduous, far from ease. Back then, Perhaps today’s generation is unfamiliar with this, but those who have listened to songs from the 1970s may recall a famous film song that says: 'Shama kahe parwane se pare chala ja' 'Shama kahe parwane se pare chala ja, Meri tarah jal jayega yahan nahi aa' 'Wo nahi sunta usko jal jana hota hai' This is a very famous song, If you have heard it, the lyrics carry a deeper meaning. The flame warns the moth, “Go far away,\" 'Shama kahe parwane se pare chala ja' Which means, go far away. 'Meri tarah jal jayega yahan nahi aa' \"lest you burn as I do. You see how I am consumed - do not come here,\" Yet the moth does not heed the warning: it is destined to burn. Similarly, despite our reluctance, a person is compelled to commit unrighteous acts, driven to actions that lead to their own destruction. So, Baba has explained this with utmost clarity. But, why does this happen? This is one of the reasons, and the other is, Sometimes, Baba Himself places the burden of such actions on certain devotees, But for those of a lower spiritual level, it is their Karma Tantra (Karmic Law), because of which these sinful deeds take place through them. However, when it comes to a truly virtuous devotee, one who is pure and sattvic but perhaps tinged with subtle ego of righteousness. Baba sometimes introduces such trials into their life as a test. Let us examine Chapter 33, verse 132. Here, Baba speaks of such a virtuous devotee - pure, sattvic, and exemplary. At times, Baba orchestrates such divine play in their life. But why? He clarifies this as well. 'Ekda jo preme dekhila, tayacha aajanm ankit jhala,' 'Kelval ananya premacha bhukela, tayachya haakela o deyi.' If such a virtuous devotee, with complete body, mind, and wealth, casts even a single glance of love towards Baba, Baba becomes eternally bound to them - marked for all lifetimes. Baba surrenders to such a devotee. 'Kelval ananya premacha bhukela, tayachya haakela o deyi.' Baba longs only for such unalloyed devotion, and when such a devotee calls out, Baba responds with affirmation. 'Nalage tayasi sthal va kaal, ubha nirantar sarvakaal,' 'kaisi kothun dabeel kal, karani akal tayachi.' Very important verse, Baba says: 'Nalage tayasi sthal va kaal' There are no boundaries of place or time. Baba can manifest His divine play as per His will. 'ubha nirantar sarvakaal' He stands ever-present, every moment, before us. 'kaisi kothun dabeel kal, karani akal tayachi.' When and how He turns the key, when and how He stirs upheaval in their life - only Baba knows. His actions are unfathomable, beyond comprehension. In the next verse, Verse 134, Baba says: 'Aisi kahi kareel rachana, manat yetil kutark nana,' 'to to drishti thevita charana, dhyan dharana vadhel.' Baba clarifies it in this verse, that, 'Aisi kahi kareel rachana' Baba Himself creates such circumstances in the devotee’s life, stirring up a tumult of impure thoughts, a deluge of wrong inclinations in their mind. First of all, why does He do this? And that too in virtuous devotee's Life? The answer lies in the next line of the verse: 'to to drishti thevita charana, dhyan dharana vadhel.' When a virtuous devotee is overwhelmed by such trials, for him, this is the greatest affliction - not the sorrows of life, but the arising of a single impure thought. He cannot bear it. Baba deliberately plants these wrong thoughts in his mind, and the sole purpose is to elevate his devotion from a lower level to the highest pinnacle. Because, the more Baba sows such impure thoughts, the more the devotee pleads before Him, chanting of His name intensifies, his devotion deepens. In truth, this is what Baba seeks from such a devotee, profound spiritual practice, deep worship. Thus, Baba intentionally plants the seed of an impure thought in his mind. 'to to drishti thevita charana' As and as he surrenders before Baba, his devotion intensifies. In this way, the devotee’s focus and contemplation intensify. Consider this: the 'Sai Satcharitra' is a divine scripture. I say this time and again, please do not compare it with any other text. The answers found here are unparalleled; no other scripture of Sai, in the world can offer such insights. It is impossible. Please do not waste your life collecting dry, barren knowledge. Our time is limited, and in that precious time, embrace the 'Sai Satcharitra', authored by Baba Himself. People have made a marketplace of information - please, do not fall into their trap. Such answers, such mysteries, are found only in the 'Sai Satcharitra'. Baba has poured His heart into it, laid bare His very soul in this scripture. So, instead of wasting time on other texts, even if you don’t understand the 'Sai Satcharitra' at first, read it repeatedly. One day, the entire 'Sai Satcharitra' will descend into your being, and you will become Sai Baba Himself. I go so far as to say this. So, Baba plants an impure thought in the mind of a virtuous devotee to deepen his devotion, to intensify his focus and contemplation. And one day, true samadhi (spiritual absorption) will dawn in his life. Baba further says: 'Aise jhaliya ekagra man, ghadel atyanta Sai chintan.' Even if driven by fear of his mind’s impurities, the devotee strives to expel this filth. Through this effort, his devotion and contemplation grows, his mind becomes focused, and through this, an unceasing devotion of Sai arises. 'Hech ha Sai ghei karavun, karyahi nirvighna paar pade.' This is what Baba makes happen, And this is how Baba transforms a virtuous devotee into an unalloyed devotee, In this way, Baba ensures that His work is accomplished. What is Baba’s work? To transform a virtuous devotee into an unalloyed devotee, to establish them in the non-dual principle (Advaita), that “I and Thou are not separate; we are one.” Baba says, “I accomplish this work with ease.” But this applies to a virtuous devotee. If a devotee is not virtuous, if they are steeped in worldly desires and impurities, they are already immersed in that filth. Why would Baba plant impure thoughts in such a person? So, this must be clear, Baba handles a virtuous devotee in this way, elevating their devotion to celestial heights. his devotion was grounded, yet Baba elevated it to the skies. This is a profound mystery. Baba further says: 'Vyavahar na lage sodavayas, sutel aapo aap havyaas,' 'aisa ha mana lagata abhyas, karyahi aprayas ghadel.' There is no need to abandon worldly duties, family, or society. 'sutel aapo aap havyaas,' As your contemplation and focus deepen, attachment to the body, family, and world automatically begins to wane. 'aisa ha mana lagata abhyas, karyahi aprayas ghadel.' By engaging the mind in the practice of contemplation, Baba says, the devotee’s liberation is assured, and His work of transforming an ordinary devotee into Sai Himself is fulfilled. So, Baba has answered this clearly: The more we engage in spiritual practice, worship, and deep devotion, the more impure thoughts afflict us. When such thoughts assail a virtuous devotee, their worship intensifies. In truth, even if they stand in the midst of a marketplace, at that time an impure thought arises in their mind, they connect with Baba in that very moment. They need not go to a temple for that, in that instant, a temple arises where they stand. Tears stream from their eyes, and they enter a state of prayer, pleading, “Lord, grant me release from these thoughts.” This is how a true devotee reacts in such situations, Baba has conveyed it through these verses. Now, on this very topic, I shall unfold yet another depth before you. There is a Leela of Lord Krishna - Gopika Vastraharan (disrobing). We all know this story, and much nonsense is often spoken about Lord Krishna in context to this Leela. Because its depth is not understood. This Leela aligns closely with our topic, So, I thought to include it here. When the 'gopis' go to bathe at the riverbank, Lord Krishna steals their clothes and sits on a tree. As the 'gopis' realize their clothes are missing, they know with certainty that this is Krishna’s doing, no one else’s. So, they call out to Krishna. From among the branches and leaves of the tree, Krishna reveals one of His divine feet, showing them, “Today, I have stripped you bare.” This “stripping bare” does not refer to the physical body, If an impure thought is planted in the mind, if wrong inclinations are sown, and if we are made to perform an act we shouldn’t, in that moment, a person surrenders to God in a way they may never have before. In truth, “stripping bare” is in this way, God plants an impure thought in our mind first, and elevates that thought to such a peak that it leads us to commit a wrong act. And when that wrong act occurs, the devotee who stands before God, pleading, is truly pleading. In that state, they are passing through a realization: “Lord, protect my honor. Let the mistake I’ve made never be revealed before anyone. I fall at Your feet.” They plead in countless ways, and in that moment, Lord Krishna extends His divine foot, showing the 'gopis', \"Now you are finally been brought down a peg, This is what I wanted - for your surrender to become so complete. That is why I stripped you bare.\" In reality, from my perspective, this is truly known as \"stripping bare\". Let me add one thing: Lord Krishna did this only with the 'Gopis'. The 'gopis' devotion was of such a high order. Similarly, in the life of a true devotee, if God causes them to mistakenly commit a wrong act, their devotion becomes even deeper, more unwavering. Their surrender becomes complete. Their prostrating gains true authenticity. There is a world of difference between how he once prostrated himself and how he prostrates himself now. Just as Lord Krishna performed the Leela of stealing the 'gopis’ clothes, Similarly, in the life of a true devotee, Baba causes a wrong act to occur, “stealing their clothes” in this way. And honestly, even if someone’s physical clothes were taken, it wouldn’t be as significant. But when a true devotee is compelled to commit a mistake, this “stealing of clothes” is something only that devotee can truly describe. Because this Leela of 'Disrobing the Gopis', is connected to the question that always arises in people’s minds: “Why, as my devotion deepens, do these impure thoughts arise?” This is the entire mystery. Another leela comes to mind. Gondavalekar Maharaj, a great contemporary saint of Baba from Satara, Maharashtra, His samadhi is located in Gondawale. One of His devotee visits Him and stands before Him with folded hands, pleading, “Maharaj, you told me to chant the name of 'Rama' constantly, and I do so 24 hours a day. But, so many impure thoughts have begun to plague my mind. When I didn’t chant His name, these thoughts didn’t arise. But the more I chant, the more these impure thoughts torment me. Why is this, Maharaj?” He is crying and pleading before Maharaj. Gondavalekar Maharaj says, “Consider this: There is a burrow where six or seven venomous snakes reside. At night, they come out, hunt frogs, small insects, or creatures, consume their prey, and return to rest comfortably in the burrow. Now, suppose a saint discovers that venomous snakes live there and pours boiling acid into the burrow. As soon as the acid touches the snakes, they hiss and slither out. Will they stay in the burrow? No, they’ll all rush out. Similarly, when the acid of God’s name enters the cave of your heart, all the desires and impurities within you, those venomous snakes - come hissing out. But remember, they are coming out from within you, not entering from outside. In this way, the name of God purifies you from within.” There are many reasons why it happens so. Today’s talk was for those who are truly walking this path, who are facing this struggle. I offer countless salutations at their feet, because if they are going through this path today, I can imagine how beautiful their future will be. So, I offer countless salutations at their feet. Kabir Ji says on this matter: 'Durjan ki karuna buri, Bhalo Sai ko traas,' 'Suraj jab garmi kare, Tab barsan ki aas.' If Sai, our Sadguru, tests us in this way, if He burns us like the sun does, remember that this heat lifts the salty water of the ocean, turns it into clouds, and transforms it into sweet water, compelling it to rain down. So, if a devotee is going through such trials today, their future will be filled with joy, purity, and an ocean of bliss. This is equally true. I hope today’s topic touches your heart. And the question that arises in many minds: “Why is this happening?” has many reasons, as explained. According to Baba, in Chapters 13 and 33, and the depth of 'Disrobing the Gopikas' leela, which I’ve shared with you, there are many reasons why this happens. But whatever Baba does is for our good, for our welfare, for our progress, and to lead us to the ultimate goal. Ganesh Utsav Ganesh Chaturthi I wish to speak a few words on this subject today, That is why this shoot is taking place. We call Lord Ganesh the bestower of intellect. We consider Ganeshji to be the master of the wisdom within us. And because of this, Ganeshji holds a very deep place in our lives. In Ganesh Utsav, three core processes stand out before us. The first is the invocation of Ganesh. With so much of celebration and enthusiasm we welcome Ganeshji, Bringing Him into our homes, into our hearts that is the first step: the invocation, the arrival of Ganeshji. The second is the worship of Ganeshji. Some people keep Ganeshji at home for one and a half days, then immerse Him. Some keep Him for 5 days, some for 7, and some for 11. Throughout that time, they keep the sacred lamp burning continuously - an uninterrupted flame before the deity. They perform aarti morning and evening, Offer food items as bhog, And with great sincerity, they perform His worship. Finally, based on one’s feeling - whether after 1.5, 5, or 11 days Ganeshji is taken for immersion in water (Visarjan). Now the question is - what are these processes? The arrival of Ganeshji, His worship, His immersion these aren’t mere rituals. There is a profound principle behind them. The invocation of Ganeshji means, The arrival of true intellect in our lives. The arrival of 'Sadbuddhi'. Not just intellect - I will say, the arrival of sadbuddhi - righteous wisdom. If our intellect lacks discrimination, dispassion, Lacks the illumination of holy scriptures, Lacks the company of saints and the presence of satsang, That intellect is a perverse intellect. If we fill our intellect with discrimination: What is right, what is wrong, What is honesty, what is dishonesty, What is dharma, what is adharma, What is righteous conduct, what is unrighteousness So, this whole process to fill the intellect with such discrimination is the true arrival of Ganeshji, the real invocation. That from today onwards, we will live our lives guided by inner light. Or else, even if this life slips from our hands, it won’t matter If our longing for dispassion grows this intensely, And if our intellect becomes filled with such clarity, Then know this: Ganeshji has entered our heart, our intellect. That is His true arrival. That is His true invocation. If we fill our intellect with radiant wisdom, With dispassion, With the study of scriptures, With the principles of dharma, ethics, devotion, and patience, Then know for sure - Ganeshji has arrived. His invocation is complete. Now, the second process To physically bring Ganeshji, worship Him outwardly, offer our vows and prayers, and then take Him for immersion, That alone cannot be called true Ganesh Puja. That alone does not complete Ganesh Utsav. There is a deeper meaning. So the first process is: Ganeshji’s invocation, which means the arrival of vivek (discrimination) in our intellect. the arrival of dispassion in our intellect, the arrival of devotion toward saints and holy men, in our intellect. The ability to recognize and follow their guidance - that is true invocation of Ganeshji. To know His will is to invoke Him. This is the original invocation. This outer idol worship should lead us to this inner transformation. Otherwise, if we remain confined to idol worship alone, We cannot reap its full benefit our bhakti will remain incomplete. This doesn’t mean I’m saying - don’t bring Ganeshji home, don’t worship Him. No, I’m not saying that. But how is our devotion? Normally, it is śakam bhakti - desire-driven. Because Ganeshji is known to fulfill wishes and vows, Every household brings Him during Ganesh Utsav. It's not bad, nor wrong. But it’s incomplete. That’s what I wish to say. So, the first process is done, 'What is the invocation of Ganeshji?' Now, what is Ganeshji’s Pujan? The same intellect where we’ve welcomed discrimination, Where we’ve studied sacred texts, Where we’ve listened to the words of the Sadguru, Where we’ve come to understand His will And now align our lives according to that will - That is true worship. Whatever we have heard, Whatever we have studied from scriptures, Whatever we’ve absorbed from saints If we can mould our mind, senses, and body accordingly, If we can live in alignment with that wisdom Then that is real Ganesh Puja. So, this is the second process. First, fill the intellect with wisdom - that is Ganeshji's invocation. Then, to put that enlightened intellect into practice - that is Ganesh Puja. This is the original worship. If you are following this inner process of invocation and worship, Then honestly, even if you’ve never brought Ganeshji home, Even if you’ve never performed the outer rituals, but Ganeshji resides in your heart every moment. In the physical process, you have to immerse the idol, but here, Lord Ganesh ,whom you have invoked in your heart never leaves. His worship continues ceaselessly within. That is the real Ganesh Puja. The more you fill your intellect with light/ wisdom, knowing His wisdom, command, and will, if you align your life accordingly. and change yourself according to it. Even if it means going against your own desires, if you can uphold the Sadguru’s will, the scriptures’ truth, Even by subduing your mind- Then living moment by moment in that spirit. Is the real Ganesh Puja. And finally, Ganeshji's immersion Now many people ask: We invite Ganeshji with such devotion, We worship Him with so much love for 5, 7, 11, or some people for 1.5 days, Then why do we go and immerse Him in water? That is because: The intellect you have filled with discrimination, Through which you have performed noble actions, And shaped your life by His will, and walked your life according to His will, Unknowingly, A sāttvic ego begins to form. And in reality, the final immersion, is letting go of that sāttvic ego So, at the end we immerse Ganeshji in the water. The sattvic ego which gets built within us, after doing good deeds, We have to immerse that sattvic ego. So we may become egoless. And until we become egoless, The Nirākār Parmātmā - the formless God - will not be attained. That is why the sattvic ego is to be immersed at the end. That is real immersion (Visarjan). But if you haven’t done any noble actions, Then how will sāttvic ego even arise? What will you immerse? So first: Filling the intellect with discrimination is the arrival of Ganeshji. Then, practical implementation of that intellect filled with discrimination, and living accordingly, is Ganeshji's worship And finally, Because of living such a life, due to the noble actions, subtle ego gets formed, knowningly or unknowingly. And immersion of this subtle ego is the true Ganesh Visarjan. Until this depth enters our lives, Even if we bring Ganeshji year after year for hundreds of births, install his idol, worship Him, and immerse Him It will hold no real meaning. Until this depth enters our lives. And until that depth is experienced, Know that the real Ganesh Utsav has not yet begun in your life. This may sound harsh, But it is the bitter truth. Many times I’ve been invited to people’s homes for Ganesh Chaturthi, They call me with love, and I go. But with a heavy heart, I must say, The aarti that they sing every morning and evening, They don’t even know its true meaning. This is not how Ganesh Puja should be done. Please forgive me if these words hurt, But unless we rise above empty rituals and grasp the depth within, These customs will continue meaninglessly for centuries. But if the clarity you've gained today stays with you, And if you invoke Ganeshji with that clarity Then that is the true Ganesh Utsav in your life. I truly hope that this video that you are watching, on the occasion of Ganesh Utsav, Shakes your heart from within. This is the original Ganesh Utsav. May this Ganesh Utsav take place in your life. You have been asking for worldly desires from him until now, and I have fulfilled some of your desires. But now, enough. Now, ask for me from me ask for Sai from Sai. He is the one who has solved everyone's problems So, if you ask for Baba from Baba, then you have entered the light of knowledge. Don't want anything but Baba from Baba What we do is we make Baba a means to fulfill our desires. We go to Baba with a list, trying to fulfill our worldly desires by placing them on Baba's shoulders.\" Baba is not our destination, Baba is a ginie for us, through whom we want to enjoy some petty desires of the world, but Baba is saying that by keeping your feet on the shoulders of worldly desires you should reach me because I am your destination, you will have to do the opposite, what have we done till today, we have used Baba like a ladder by climbing on Baba's shoulders we kept trying to reach some petty desires of the world, we have made Baba a ladder, whereas Baba should become the destination, \"by trampling the desires of the world under your feet, reach me,\" is what Baba is saying, this is light of knowledge. If by trampling the desires of the world under your feet, you reach me, then you are under the light of knowledge Open your eyes a little in the light of knowledge, Keep faith in the protector of the whole world, Sai is your protector, Sai is the truth, Sai wealth is your true earnings. so Sai's wealth is his form - Sat (truth), chit (awareness) and bliss (anand). Truth means that which never fades away,that soul entity Chit means when the knowledge of entier creation enters that truth, then it is called a Chit and the third is Anand. Anand will become my form, so that is the wealth of Sai, to earn that wealth, you should keep trying from today onwards, you have spent your life in struggle having it so this was the first stanza, open your eyes a little in the light of knowledge, have faith in the whole world's protector, Sai, your protector, Sai is the truth, Sai's wealth is your real earning. In the 32nd chapter, Baba says that the treasure of spirituality he possesses is so abundant that you should come with a cart to take it away. Baba is waiting for someone to come and take this treasure away completely. want to be robbed, He's saying,\"I am eager to be robbed and I am sitting with thousands of eyes in search of one person who will come and rob me completely\" but Baba says that no mother's son has been born yet who will rob me completely, I tell everyone to come and take, take away, and everyone comes and says give me, what am I want to give and what are you asking for? I am talking about pouring out the spiritual treasure and you, being engrossed in worldly desires, are saying give it to me, give it to me, what do I want to give, what are you asking for, well, if Baba fulfills any of my desires, assume that I wanted a child and he gave me a child, but after two years the child falls ill, or after 15-20 years turns out to have poor character and is scorned by society, will my child act as per my wish? If he acts then you will get caught in attachment and if he doesn't then you'll get caught in disappointment if he goes according to your wish, then you will be trapped in his attachments, and if he goes against you, then you will be trapped in sadness for him, so in both the cases You are impoverished Such are the relationships and achievements of the world. ask only for what is appropriate or beneficial but But fulfill your duties and maintain good relationships with your family. All these relationships are linked to you because of karmic bonds. Some have come as your mother, some as your father, some as your sister, some as your brother, some as your wife, some as your child. Because of these karmic bonds you are in relation with them. The only way to be free from these bonds is not to expect anything from them, just keep giving, giving, giving. By doing so, you will free yourself from their debts. Give them love, respect, and comfort. If you can give these three things, you will quickly be freed from your karmic debts. Spirituality does not mean that you should leave the world, family and run away, rather while living in the world and among the family, one has to live and die for their happiness by being detached and selfless because one has to get free from their debt, hence hand over the body to the family for their happiness and comfort and engage the mind in Baba, this is the only way to come into His light, running away from the world or family cannot be called Paramartha (the supreme goal), it cannot be said at all, Now, second stanza You'll wander from door to door, and your sorrow will increase. But if you hold onto one door, you'll experience a divine intoxication. This has been explained many times—everything other than Sai leads to difficulties. These are powerful lines. But what does wandering from door to door mean? You'll wander from door to door, and your sorrow will increase. People have list of desires and with that list, people first go to one god. For four months, they praise that god— by offering blades of grass to Ganapati, Bel leaves to Shiva. If you pour milk on the Shiva Lingam, all your desires will be fulfilled. But if after four months of offering milk to Shiva, desires are not fulfilled, you think, \"Nothing has happened, let's try Ganesh Ji since Ganesh Chaturthi is coming.\" Then you worship Ganesh Ji, hoping that things might work out there. If Ganesh Ji doesn't fulfill your wishes, then you think, \"No problem, Navratri is coming. I've heard the Goddess is more powerful, especially during Navratri when she becomes stronger.\" When Ganesh Chaturthi arrives, Ganesh Ji becomes very great. When Shivaratri comes, Shiva becomes very great. People start wandering from deity to deity because of their desires. This is what is meant by wandering from door to door, increasing your sorrow. But if you hold onto one door, You will get intoxicated if you're a devotee of Shiva, remain a steadfast devotee of Shiva. If you worship Ganesh Ji, then become a firm devotee of Ganesh. Don't look left or right after that. Then, don’t turn to Sai Baba with a wavering heart. Have such devotion that whether your desires are fulfilled or not, you will not leave your master's feet. This is called unwavering devotion. When our devotion becomes firm towards one, gradually, slowly, that divine intoxication begins to take hold. But those who are fickle-minded change gods every week. Saint Dnyaneshwar Maharaj called this \"wavered devotion\" (vebichari bhakti). Vebhichari bhakti is like a prostitute's love, where a prostitute changes customers daily to earn money. Similarly, a person changes gods for their desires. So, should we not worship other gods and goddesses? We absolutely should. If we are devotees of Sai Baba, we must worship Ganapati on Ganesh Chaturthi and worship Shiva on Shivaratri. But whenever we worship other gods and goddesses, we should do it with full devotion. We should worship as the rest of the world does, but when asking for something in return, ask for only one thing: \"O Master, O Goddess, O Deity, I bow at your feet. If you are truly pleased with my service, increase my devotion towards my Sadguru infinitely.\" If you make this prayer to that deity or god. They would dance Shivaji will dance in joy, finding that in millions, there's one person who has come before him with such depth He served me with all his heart, just as the whole world does, but when it comes to asking, he asks for devotion to his Guru. This is what is called unwavering devotion. I always say, even if you gain heaven from some other door, some other deity, I don't want to set foot there. And from your door, even if I receive hell, I will not leave your embrace. This is unwavering devotion. If such unwavering devotion arises towards a Sadguru, then you have entered the light. The eternal grace of Baba has showered upon you. How many times has this been explained that everything apart from Sai is alien. If you turn towards any other deity besides Sai, it is all foreign. And remember, one soul, one Supreme Being, has taken on so many forms. What Sai cannot do, no one else can. What Shiva cannot do, no one else can, because one Supreme Being has taken on all these forms. They are not different. Your understanding is not mature enough yet, so Shiva appears different, Rama appears different, Sai Baba appears different, Christ appear different, and Muhammad the Prophet appears different. Because that sharpness hasn't yet come to you. Otherwise, the essence is one; we are calling the one Supreme Being by so many names. Just as you can call a book a scripture, a text, a book, or a volume—no matter how many names you use, the object remains one. Similarly, the Supreme Being is one. We are calling that one Supreme Entity by different names If this clarity comes, then you will realize that what my Baba cannot give, no one else can give. so wandering will stop even if the devotion is desire driven then at least be devoted to one God, keep asking for that, do not change the gods and goddesses, in fact, doing devotion by having desires is wrong, okay, if the desires are not falling, then at least be devoted to one, keep asking for that only, whether you get it or not, but as soon as you start changing the gods and goddesses, you shift to promiscuous devotion You will wander from door to door, and your sorrow will increase. Apart from Sai, everything else, every deity is secondary. If I find what I'm seeking, let it be at Your door, Baba; otherwise, I don't want it. Because if my desires are fulfilled elsewhere, my faith will be divided, and that's even more dangerous. Do you understand? If I achieve what I desire from another place, whether through the worship of Ganesh or Shiva, my desire may be fulfilled, but my faith will be divided. Baba, don't let my faith waver. Even if I stray to another doorstep, don't let my desires be fulfilled there, Baba, because my faith will be divided. I am a weak person, Baba; don't play such a deceptive game with me. I might weaken, but You must remain strong, Baba. If my desires are to be fulfilled, let them be fulfilled by You, or not at all. If there is such clarity, then you will understand the second verse: 'If you wander from door to door, your sorrow will increase. But if you hold on to one door, you will begin to feel the intoxication of devotion.' Even if obstacles and difficulties keep coming your way, if your faith remains unshaken, eventually, the intoxication of devotion will start to take over. This is the highest form of intoxication in the world, and Baba wants to lead us to that state. But for that, our faith must remain steadfast. This was the second verse. Now, the third: 'Look at Sai and transform your world. How simple and beautiful this love is, give it and make it yours. Whoever has truly looked to Sai with hope, Sai’s grace has fulfilled their hope. Look towards Sai and beautify your world, life. why are you looking toward the world, why are you looking toward desires? The more your desires go unfulfilled, the closer you will become to Baba. And the more your desires are fulfilled, the further you will drift away from Baba. So if Baba is the ultimate destination, then Baba, please don't let any of my desires be fulfilled, but let my devotion to you grow day by day. Automatically, this will curb my tendency to make more desires. But if, by mistake, you fulfill one of my desires, then I will bring a whole list next time. If you fulfill just one desire, I'll come back with ten more. Therefore, on one hand, do not fulfill my desires, and on the other hand, let my devotion to you grow stronger day by day. If you can manage both of these, Baba, then I will never stray. But if my devotion doesn't grows and my desires start being fulfilled, I will easily stray from your path, Baba. This is the heartfelt plea of a true devotee, the prayer from the depths of a devotee's heart. Well, how to get love by giving love. Giving love does not mean that you run to Shirdi once a month and visit the Samadhi Mandir. Giving love doesn't mean one goes and offer shawl or sheet Love doesn't mean to observe Sai satya vrat every full moon day No, This is not said to be love. Giving love means to give devotion and get it back multiple times Now How to give devotion? I'll select some verses that describe how to offer devotion at Baba's feet we feel whatever we are doing is devotion. No, but let's understand devotion from Baba's perspective. If we worship Baba with such devotion then that devotion is returned to us a thousandfold. Which devotion is it? Let's explore it through the Sai Satcharitra. chapter 10 verse 126 let's hear in Baba's words - 'premchi nahi jaya thayi, aisa manav hone chi nahi, konache kahi konache kahi, adistan pahi aan aan' There cannot be a person in this world who does not have love in his heart. But someone's love is somewhere and someone's love is somewhere else. Everyone's place of love is different. But without love, existence of a human being is not possible. further He says - 'konache prem che jaga santati, - some people's love is in their progeny Some people's love is in earning respect and wealth. And some people's love is in earning worldly fame. Some people's love is in their family. And worldly fame means that my name gets fame in this. some people's love is that I should nurture the biggest and most mortal knowledge of this world. I should become a chartered accountant. I should become a big manager. So he is focused in attaining power. Some people's love is divided here. And he further says. He is answering. Here, in so many things, someone is stuck in children. Someone is stuck in wife, some are stuck in family and some are stuck in wealth and fame and some are stuck in acquiring knowledge. Then what's is solution 'prem je vishyi vat te' - wherever you are stuck 'te sarv jai ekvatte' - Wherever you are stuck. First, remove all the love from those places. Because your mind is attached there. Baba is saying that the body was meant to be involved, but you attached your mind, which was a mistake. You were supposed to engage your body in family, in progeny, in all the worldly activities, but you attached your mind instead. Since you made that mistake, now remove your mind from there. Remove it from progeny, from family, from wealth, from respect, from property, and turn it all into a mold. Do you know what a mold is? A liquid is poured into it, and after some time, when you take it out, it takes on a specific shape. That is called a mold. So, gather all that love from wherever it is stuck and pour it into that mold. the mold in the form of the feet of Hari. It means that wherever your love was scattered in the perishable world, gather it and pour it into the mold of the feet of Hari, or into the mold of the feet of the Guru. Only then will the feet manifest as devotion. This is the definition of devotion. What we do beyond this is all peripheral, superficial devotion. If we give love to Baba in this way, then in return, that love or devotion will be returned to us multiplied a thousand times. Do you understand what devotion means? Wherever my mind is entangled, I first withdraw my mind from there, and then I gather it and place it at Baba’s feet. That is devotion. Indirectly, Baba is saying that you want to perform devotion to me, but you do not want to let go of your attachment to the world. That cannot happen. I always say that every devotee goes through three stages. The first stage is when the devotee comes to the court of God or the Guru only for worldly desires. But as their wisdom develops (He) says that no, no, along with the world, God is also needed. But here it is being said that this is not devotion either. The day when all worldly desires fall away and only the desire for devotion remains, that is true devotion, So, if we give such love, such devotion to the Guru, it is returned to us a thousand times over. look at Sai and fix your world, how cheap is this deal, give love and take love.' And if you give such devotion to the Guru by controlling your mind, wherever your mind is stuck, you have to remove it from there. Not just remove it, but wherever your mind is trapped in attachment, you must extract it, gather it, and concentrate it, then place that mind at the feet of the Guru. If you can do this, then that is true devotion. If you cannot do this, then our devotion is divided, it is incomplete devotion, divided love. (You say) 'I want the world, and I want you too, Baba.' Fine, it is better than wanting the world. But as you progress a little further, the world falls away, and only God remains. That is where it reaches, and that is what is called true devotion. If someone has truly set their hope on gaining such devotion in Baba's court, Baba says that one day, through my deeds, that hope will be fulfilled, and they will attain that unparalleled devotion because their tendency is prepared for it. I only observe the growing thirst, and as soon as the thirst increases, I am standing there ready with water. I am eager to quench that thirst, standing on one leg. Just let your tendency be ready, let that thirst for unparalleled devotion arise in you, standing on one leg. Bind the bonds of devotion with a strong thread, storms will blow fiercely on this journey. It's been made clear that this path is not easy. Not trying to scare you, but rather to warn you, to make you aware. Because I will create situations that will shake your faith. I'll create intentionally and i will send big storms on your path of devotion and that too of immense strength to waver your devotion and faith But even if you reach a point where you say, \"I may be destroyed, Baba, but my faith will not be shaken,\" then you will succeed. If you can bring yourself to this state, you will overcome even the greatest challenges. Baba sends these challenges so that you can prepare yourself. When you say, \"I may be destroyed, Baba, but my faith will not be shaken,\" If Baba doesn't send these challenges on our path, how will you experience the sweetness of being 'destroyed'? Without these challenges, there would be no preparation. Just as two swords cannot coexist in one scabbard, similarly, in the court of the Guru, two things cannot coexist: one is the ego, and the other is pure devotion. If you want to keep pure devotion alive, the ego must die When the ego dies, only then can pure devotion survive. When the individual soul is ready to die, it transforms into the Supreme Soul. This is what is meant by the sweetness of being 'destroyed.' Now, you might ask why I keep talking about being 'destroyed'? Because the essence of spirituality is to be 'destroyed,' not to 'become.' I speak plainly. True spirituality means to be 'destroyed,' to experience the sweetness of destruction. Now you may ask, \"What will remain after I am destroyed? If I am destroyed, what will be left?\" The answer is simple: to be 'destroyed' means to 'become.' For instance, consider milk. Can milk turn into curd without losing its original form? Once it becomes curd, means the milk is gone Now, can curd turn into buttermilk without losing its original form? No, it cannot. Can buttermilk turn into butter without being 'destroyed'? And can butter turn into ghee without losing its form? The journey starts from milk and ends with ghee. Similarly, when the individual soul dies, it becomes the Supreme Soul. This is what is called the sweetness of being 'destroyed.' This is the sweetness of being 'destroyed.' And if a small existence surrenders, or dies, in the face of a greater existence, what harm is there? So, when I speak of being 'destroyed,' I mean becoming something greater.",
