    "Transcript": "last week we tried to understand what is heaven as per Baba's words, what does Sai Satcharitra say about heaven, we did deep contemplation and study on that, today the topic that I have brought in front of you Sai baba's words : How to achieve non-doership Because in spirituality till the doership or the ego of doership does not fall, the sadhana (spiritual practice) is not said to be ripe. till the feeling of I created it, I am doing it, does not fall, spirituality neither bears fruit nor flourishes. So we all know that there should not be doership. Whenever someone praises us, we say that I am not worthy of it, Baba is doing all this. 24 by 7 in our mind and brain, the feeling should remain awakened that I am not the doer, Baba is the doer. But does just saying this, just understanding this mean we have attained non-doership? That's the question. What does Baba say about doership and non-doership? What does the Sai Satcharitra say? Let's see. chapter 19 verse 74 - 'n lage sadhan sampanata, n lage shatshastra chaturyata, ek vishwas asava purta, karta harta guru aisa\" How clearly it is stated that there is no need of any resource or tools, nor six scriptures no need of Vedas, there should only be faith that my Sadguru is the doer and redeemer. I am just giving one example, but there are hundreds of such examples in the Sai Satcharitra where it is mentioned how dangerous doership is and the importance of non-doership. and let us see what Kabir ji has to say on this - 'sain se sab hot hai, bande se kachu nahu rai te parvat kare, parvat rai mahi' everything happens by the grace of Master and nothing by His devotees Until Master shows His compassion and grace, we cannot advance even an inch in our spiritual practice. Nothing happens by individuals He can turn a mustard seed into a mountain, or can turn a mountain into a mustard seed. If He wishes, He can elevate us to the heavens, and if He wishes, He can plummet us from heavens to earth There is no place for ego of doership here because, in reality, we are not the doers. We will understand this in time. and further Kabir Ji says in a couplet - 'jo kuch kiya, so tum kiya, mai kiya kachu nahi, kahu kahi jo mai kiya, tum hi the mujh mahi' Kabir Ji is saying that whatever was done, it was done by you. I did nothing. Even if I claim in ego that I did something, it was you who were working through me. Whether I am aware of this or not, Owing to ignorance, I may not feel that You are present in me and You are operating me. I may not be conscious of this but in reality You are awaken within me 24 by 7 you control my senses, my mind, my intellect, and even my life force. I am alive only because of your grace, and it is through your power that all my actions are carried out. So Kabirji has also clarified that the doer is the Lord; nothing happens through individuals or devotees. There is a beautiful story about non-doership in the Sai Satcharitra. First, I will recount the story, and then we will try to understand it in more depth. In Chapter 51 of the Sai Satcharitra, there is the story of Bhakt Pundalik Rao. This story is well-known among those who read the Sai Satcharitra. Vasudevanand Saraswati, a contemporary of Baba during that time, once visited Rajamundry in Andhra. Pundalik rao, who was a lawyer by profession, was traveling from Manmad to Rajamundry for some reason and takes Darshan of Vasudevanand saraswati During their conversation, when Pundalik rao mentions that he has come from Manmad, Vasudevanand Saraswati feels, as shirdi is very near to Manmad, that you came from my dear friend's place. I am very pleased. so when you will visit Shirdi to take darshan of Sai Baba, offer this coconut at His holy feet That saint in Rajamundry, who is also known as Tembe swami, gave Pundalik rao a coconut with a sacred intention and asked him to take it to his friend in Shirdi. He instructed Pandali Karav to tell Baba that He has sent the coconut for Him Pundalik Rao takes the coconut and comes back to manmad. A while goes by and he heads to shirdi with the coconunt and some of his friends During their journey, they needed a place to rest and eat. They had some food, a type of fried snack called ‘Chivda in Marathi which is made from gram flour and can be quite spicy. When they found the Chivda too spicy, one of their friends suggested breaking the coconut into the Chivda to reduce the spiciness. with that intention they break the coconut that was given by tembe swami they become completely unaware that it is someone's trust and that they have no right to break and eat it but they broke the coconut and mixed it into the Chivda to reduce the spiciness. After doing so, they continued their journey and eventually reached Shirdi. Upon arriving in Shirdi, Baba knows everything Baba asks about the item that His friend had sent, and Pandalik Rao realizes that they have used the coconut by mixing it into the Chivda. He apologies Baba for his mistake and says,\"If you want, I can go to the market and buy another coconut for you.’ Baba explained that no matter how many coconuts you bring, none can compare to the one sent by a saint. This is because when a saint gives something to another saint, it is not merely an object but the essence of their inner feelings and devotion that comes with it. Such purity and devotion cannot be bought from any market. even if one were to bring hundreds of coconuts, none could match the sanctity and value of the one sent by Vasudevanand Saraswati. Then Pundalik Rao feels a lot of regret. when Baba sees his disappointment he says,'why are you inflicting yourself with the doership? You didn't eat or break it deliberately. It was the requirement of time \"So, it's okay. I was the coconut, I was also the sender, and the one who received it was not me,\" says Baba, reflecting on such deep thoughts. \"so don't inflict yourself with the ego of doership for no reason\" There are some verses related to this, which will make it clearer. In Chapter 51, Verse 175, Look How beautiful the verse which explains that no coconut can be compared with the one sent by vasudevanada saraswati in marathi is! \"baba mhanale tya falachi yogyata, yeina itar kitihi deta, - the coconut that He had sent for Me cannot be interchanged or compared with million such coconuts \"ghadavayache ghadle ata, vyart duschitta kimarth\" - What was meant to happen has happened. Now, why feel sad for it, needlessly? verse 176 - \"swamini tuj didla naral, tohi mhajaj sankalp keval, majyach sankalpe futle te phaal abhimaan nishfal ka dharisi\" the coconut which Swami Ji had given to you for me, it was my resolution that feeling should arise in his mind and the coconut should be given to you, in the moment of my resolution, Vasudevan Saraswati Ji had given you that coconut, and with my resolution it was broken and mixed into chivada so why you harbour egoistic attitude without any reason? And further He says, \"ahakaara chi dharisi buddhi, tene aapana manisi aparadhi, - because of egoistic attitude you regard yourself as offender \"avdhe nirhankartutva sadhi, avaghi upadhi chukel\" - just adopt the attitude of non doer and all the troubles can be avoided this crying, remorse, sorrow, all these titles will automatically dropped, just hold on to that egolessness, \"punyacha chi kai abhimaan, papacha ka nahi abhimaan\" - and it is the nature of man that when he does good deeds, then ego of that good deed comes along with it, so Baba says, where you will be proud of virtue, there will definitely be the shame and regret of sins also. If after doing any good deed, if you do not take the credit of doing it on your head, God forbid if you commit a small mistake, at that moment you will not take the credit of it as well because if you inculcate a habit not taking the credit for any good deed you give it's credit to God saying a lowly like me cannot execute such task if you do every good deed with this feeling, surrendering it to the Lord, considering Him to be the doer, if you keep yourself humble, then God forbid, if you commit any mistake, even a small one, then the feeling of non-doership that you keep while doing good deeds, the same feeling will give you the power of saying that Baba does it, it will come automatically, then Baba says, and if you are proud of your good deeds, then the pain, remorse, troubles of sins will definitely come, you will have to bear that as well If you nurture the pride of good deeds, then the pain of evil deeds will not let it live, therefore if you drop the pride virtue, then the pride of even small sins too shall drop on its own, and remember virtue is dangerous, and sin is also dangerous, beyond both is the soul, and beyond both is to attain that soul entity, therefore drop the pride of being a doer and become selfless, this is what Baba says to Pundalik Rao, It's a wonderful Leela, and Baba has highlighted every mystery of spirituality in Sai satcharitra through some Leela in very impeccable way Hence Sai satcharitra cannot be compared. I always say that several books were written on Baba when He was living and even today after 100 years of His Samadhi, innumerable books have being written. So, Baba knew it very well that people will wander in information The original spiritual treasure has to be given in their hands. These Leeels are just an excuse. Now non-doer ship is a spiritual aspect and to incorporate that non-doership into our life, He(Baba) crafted such an excellent divine leela of Pundalik rao So Sai satcharitra is a complete truth. And one thing should always be remembered, when Baba was alive, when he was in Shirdi, then those people who were very good devotees, when they used to go for Baba's darshan, Baba used to make them sit in the wada and used to set rules for them that you will read Gyaneshwari daily and after that you come for my darshan. Baba used to ask people to read Bhavarth Ramayana, Gyaneshwri, Eknathi Bhagwad and Ram vijay and there was a very strict warning that first you will complete reading and only after that you will come to DwarkaMai for my darshan, it means that how much importance those Grants had in Baba's mind is clearly visible from this If any devotee went directly to see Baba without completing the daily chapter, Baba would send them back, telling them to complete the chapter first and then come for his darshan. Baba gave so much importance to those scriptures because Baba knew that the original spiritual treasure is hidden in those scriptures You cannot connect to directly as your soul have not traveled to where I am. Therefore, first understand the depth in those scriptures let every sheath of it open up in your life and and then after that if you sit in front of me directly, then without me saying anything I will be able to put that entire light in you so it was clear to Baba that is why Baba always used to ask to read those Grants and today, when Baba felt that people will collect information about Me. There are people who give information and there are people who take information. Baba knew about this danger So, Baba poured all the important verses from Eknathi Bhagwad and Gyaneshwari in Sai satcharitra Sai satcharitra is crafted in this way hence there is no need of reading those scriptures mentioned earlier if Sai satcharitra is in hands as it is enough So, to explain the concept of Non-doership, Baba crafted this Leela that you have the ego of good deeds. That is why, when you commit a misdeed, you get pained, you get into trouble, you get filled with remorse, your mind becomes sad. So, Baba clarified that, while doing Pund (good deeds), if you dedicate those deeds to Sadguru, if you do not bring the ego of doing good deeds in your life, then, God forbid, if you do minor mistakes, then at such time, the power of saying that Baba is the doer of it will increase Now see, the biggest question is that 'I am not the doer, I am non-doer, on which devotee does this statement apply? Because the devotee who is in the primary stage, who is just living spirituality, if he takes this statement in his life, then he will get trapped. Because the ignorance is to be burnt to ashes, the impurity is to be burnt to ashes, right now wrong deeds are also being done by hands, and at such a time if it is said that i am not the doer, it is God who does it, it is written in the scriptures, then it means that my every sin, every deed is being done by my Sadguru, if the devotee who is in the initial state, takes it upon himself, then he will be destroyed, he will be completely ruined. So that is why the need of doership in the beginning is absolutely necessary. Yes I am the doer, in the beginning of spiritual practice, because there one has to work hard on one's vices, on one's desires, on the impurities of one's mind.     "Transcript": "The name of the topic is how to avoid or get rid of desire of objects of senses. Under this topic I will take a leela. Chana(chickpeas) Leela Once upon a time, One sunday Hemad Pant, there used to be a weekly market in Shirdi on Sundays when Baba was there, came from the market wearing a shirt and a coat with folds. He came to attend the noon Aarti of Baba and sat near Baba. A devotee noticed that there were chickpeas stuck in the folds of the his coat. He was surprised. Baba then asked him to open the folds. As soon as he did, 20-25 chickpeas fell out from the folds. The first wonder was that there were 20-25 chickpeas stuck in the folds. Baba used to play such divinity to give teachings. Now this is miracle and His every miracle has some secret, some wisdom. They were not done without any reason. in a fold of sleeve one or two chickpeas can stay but 20-25 chickpeas is unreal And if 24-25 chickpeas are stuck, imagine the discomfort! Hemad Pant should have noticed this discomfort much earlier and cleaned it up. But Baba, in his divine play, made sure that 25 chickpeas were stuffed in those folds, and Hemad Pant didn’t even realize it. This is the divine play. Some people mock Hemad Pant, thinking he has a habit of eating alone. So, after coming from the market, he must have been chewing chickpeas, which got stuck in the folds of his coat. Hemad Pant said, 'No, I haven’t done anything like that. I really didn’t come here eating chickpeas; I don’t understand how so many chickpeas ended up in my folds. When someone is in front of me, I always offer them first, and only if something is left do I eat it myself. These are my values. then Baba says, \"Hemad pant, it is true that as long as there is someone in front of you, you do not eat without offering it to them, I also know this, but if there is no one in front of you, even then am I not in front of you, do you offer it to me first, before eating.\" there Himarpand remains completely stunned, \"yes Baba, you are in front of me 24 hours a day, you are there everywhere, all the time, really i have never offered or remembered You Baba says, \"Hemad pant, always remember one thing in life, these five subjects, word, touch, form, taste and smell, these are very dangerous, whenever you start enjoying these five, then first of all remember me,\" do not taste them directly, word, touch, form, taste and smell.\" Words means, if you feel like listening to good music, Suppose you felt an intense desire to listen to a newly released movies songs and you bought cassette or CD for fulfilling the purpose and listened, but did not remember Baba, so that is a sin in Baba's eyes, if I talk about this chapter, then Baba warns before listening to introspect, \"if my senses are running towards this subject of my senses, then I have to remember Baba first, Baba has said that I do not have to consume that subject of senses directly\" first I have to remember Baba, ok why did Baba say so, Because when someone is eager to enjoy something and if you have to remember or chant in the middle of it, then its intensity is diminished and it is Baba's wholesome purpose No guru in the world could have provided this insight on overcoming the senses to their disciples. that do not cherish the objects of senses without remembering me First And always remember, whenever the urge to indulge in any sense experience arises, for example if a sexual desire arises between husband and wife which is natural—don't directly engage in the act. Baba says to first chant his name eighteen times calmly and with devotion. Only then should you engage in the act. make this a habit For instance, if delicious food is in front of you, don’t just grab it and eat it immediately. Baba advises to first chant his name eighteen times with a peaceful and loving mind before indulging. This applies to any sensory experience: after chanting Baba's name, you can eat the food, indulge in the desire, listen to music, or use perfume. Smell is attracting as of to mask the odor of sweat in summers do use it but after remembering Baba's name for 18 time peacefully and calmly so that if your mind engages in the chant for 18 times then automatically the intensity of desire for objects of senses will decrease If you feel attracted to something, don’t directly indulge in it. Remember Baba’s name first. Although Baba did not specify eighteen times in his teachings, I am adding this from my own perspective. Even after chanting Baba’s name eighteen times with complete attention, you may indulge in it but with time the intensity of the desire will decrease, you will be able to detach from the sensory experience. Baba warns that while this may seem like a minor element, it is crucial for overcoming desire. especially Rasana(taste). Without defeating taste one cannot enter the spiritual world impossible! Do you know the difference between a householder and ascetic? If a householder works on controlling his lust and taste, he ultimately becomes like an ascetic. If a householder controls his/her desires and taste, then he/she is essentially living as a renunciant, even while remaining in household life. And if you want to reduce the intensity of that tendency, then first remember me and then indulge in that object. And if you remember me then in reality you are not only remembering, but you are dedicating the intensity of that tendency to me. This is what He is saying. And it is impossible for the senses to remain without sensual desires. If there are eyes, they will see, if there is nose, it will smell, if there is skin, the feeling of sexual desire will arise, if there is tongue, it will pull towards taste, so it is not so easy to get rid of this. If the senses remain devoid of sensual desires, It is not possible until the end of the cosmic cycle. And if that sensual object is surrendered at the feet of the Guru, then the intensity of attachment will decrease. And how is that surrender to be done? By remembering Him. To remember Him is to surrender to Him, remember this. Its intensity has to be ended, its impulse has to be ended. And going further he says, - 'kaam tari madvishaich kamave, and even if any desire arises, then at that time too, with the same force, surrender to me, turn the speed of that lust towards me, and even if anger arises, then surrender to me before getting angry, take my name eighteen times, after that be angry, develop this habit, then the tendency will automatically start reducing, this is a wonderful idea given by Baba, and this has been given to us by a Samarth Sadguru, do not take it lightly, no guru in the world would have explained these things in such a wonderful way, no guru in the world, 'kaam tari madvishayich kamave, kop aalya majvarich kopave, abhimaan duragrah samrpave, bhakti vahave madmadi' and in this way, if you are indulging in lust, also remember me, and even while experiencing the vices, lust, anger, greed, attachment, greed, pride, when these six vices attack you, then go into their impulse directly, first reduce their intensity by praying to Baba, and even then if they do not stop, then it is okay, Baba says, 'I will handle them' but i will see whether you have remembered me 18 times and even if you indulge in ti after that then in my view it's not a sin' It is a very significant matter and a very profound one. The full depth of this song is that when you involve yourself in Archaan bhakti, anoint God, wipe with a clean cloth, apply sandalwood paste, dress with clothes and ornaments, adorn with flower garlands, and place a crown. Afterwards, you offer incense, lamp, and Naivedya (food offering). All these together constitute 'archan bhakti' Many people practice this 'archan bhakti' in their homes. Everyone has a prayer room in their homes. There are idols of Baba in their homes, and this 'archan bhakti' is performed by everyone with their own feelings and devotion. But how should the Archan bhakti be, this song tells us. If you are engaged in the worship of Baba with your body. This body is bathing Baba, dressing Baba with clothes and ornaments, adorning Baba with flower garlands. But if your mind is preoccupied with worldly thoughts. It means it is merely a physical exercise. You are doing it just because you do it daily. But if your mind is not in it, then it is not true devotion. So, while the rosary moves in the hand, and the mouth chants 'Om Sairam, Om Sairam, Om Sairam,' But if the mind is wandering across the entire universe, Kabir Ji says, this is not true remembrance. Similarly, if you are performing Baba's archan devotion but your mind is not focused, then that archan devotion is not true devotion; it is not true worship. I even say, and some people might feel bad, that if I am in the Samadhi Mandir, even if I am the priest of the Samadhi Mandir, I am fortunate to bathe Baba every day, but if my emotional state is not as elevated as it should be during the service, then even while being in the Samadhi Mandir, I am very far away. The one from Nagpur replied, 'No, I have been here for 15 days and will stay for another month because, in those days, people stayed for months. There is a show in Kopargaon, a woman's dance, and I am going to see it. I will come back later for Baba's darshan. I am going to stay here for another month.' The person does not understand what Baba meant by 'He is here, and you are there.' In the evening, they meet again, and they start talking. The person asks, 'How was the show?' If you have that courage then we are true devotees of Baba So this song 'jab subah ki aarati khatam hui' highlights what true archan devotion (archan bhakti) is. Serving and worshiping with just the body is not enough. Therefore, when body, mind, and wealth are completely dedicated, it takes the form of supreme devotion. When the body is engaged in Baba's service, the mind is focused on Baba, and wealth is also used in Baba's service, it is called supreme devotion. I would even say that if needed, the devotion of that devotee from Nagpur who was watching the show but still thinking about Baba is superior because his mind was focused on Baba, and it is more important for the mind to be focused than the body. Let me tell you an incident. There was a religious teacher who invited Jesus to his house for a meal. Many disciples of the religious teacher were present, and some of Jesus' disciples were also there. While they were having the meal, a prostitute found out that Jesus was at the religious teacher's house, so she ran to see him and fell at his feet. She started kissing his feet and washing them with her tears, then anointing them with perfume. The religious teacher sitting nearby had a thought: people call Jesus divine, but does he not know that the woman clinging to his feet is a prostitute? Why doesn't he rebuke her? This thought arose in the religious teacher's mind, and Jesus knew about it. Jesus then told the religious teacher a parable. He said that two people had debts: one owed fifty rupees, and the other owed five hundred rupees. Both debts were forgiven. Jesus asked the religious teacher, who would love the creditor more? The religious teacher thought and replied that the one with the debt of five hundred rupees would love more because his larger debt was forgiven. Jesus then said, 'Similarly, the sins in your heart are equal to the sins of this prostitute, but you are not repentant of your sins, whereas this prostitute is repentant and clings to my feet asking for forgiveness. Both have committed sins worth five hundred rupees, but this prostitute sees her sins as worth five million rupees, and that's why she is crying and repenting.' whereas your sins are of same worth as that of her's but your mind doesn't display the tears of repent. So here Jesus is indirectly saying to him that in His view she is a religious teacher and he is a prostitute This scene teaches us that how close we appear to Baba externally, how much worship we show the world, does not satisfy Baba. Baba looks at the pain we feel for our ignorance, the repentance in our heart, our tears, our crying, and our growing surrender to Him is what Baba considers nor our external actions. If we sit in front of Baba's idol for twenty-four hours but our mind is preoccupied with worldly thoughts, that is not true devotion. Therefore, Kabir Ji says, if you want to learn the art of begging and fakirism, learn it from the water carrier. Dedicate your mind, heart, and soul to Baba's contemplation, and let your body be engaged in the world. If you do this, see how Baba showers His grace upon you. This is a simple way to attain supreme devotion: engage your body in worldly duties and your mind in God. But do you know what we do? We do the exact opposite. Have you ever thought about it? We engage our body in God's worship, performing rituals, adorning idols, and doing all kinds of physical activities, but our mind is preoccupied with worldly thoughts. While performing worship, our mind is busy thinking about the tasks left to do after going to work, but our hands are engaged in adorning the idol, Baba asks us to do the opposite: dedicate your body to the world and keep Me in your mind. He confined Himself to a stone idol and is sitting before us so that we can worship Him, and through this process, we can focus our minds.\" When the morning aarti ended and Baba took His bath, the person reflecting said, 'Baba, in reality, what need do You have for a bath? Who in the entire universe is as pure and conscious as You are? Your character, Your purity—no one in the entire universe matches that. Baba, You do not need a bath. However, I have made an idol of You and am performing the bath ritual so that my sins may be washed away. I am doing this worship, this auspicious bath for my own benefit, not because You need it. You are ever-pure, and it is the whole world that borrows purity from You. So why would You need an auspicious bath? Yet, as I perform this ritual, my focus on You increases, and my sins are being washed away. That is why I am performing this auspicious bath. What kind of deal is this do you know? If I were to tell you to go to a grocery store, give them a five hundred rupee note, nd ask for just ten grams of cumin seeds, would you do it? No one would. But Baba is making this deal with us. Baba is saying that I accept this very humble form of service from you. Through this service, you are offering me pebbles and stones—performing my bath, adorning me, dressing me, and decorating me with garlands. I do not need any of these things. You are giving me pebbles and stones in the form of service, and in return, I will grant you the jewel of self-knowledge. See how unprofitable the deal is? will a person give jewels in return for pebbles and stones. But the Sadguru gives us the jewel of wisdom, irrespective of our services. Whether we perform the bath or not, His character remains ever-pure. We dress Him in clothes, but what clothes can we offer to someone whose consciousness is as vast as the sky? Even then, we have created a form for Him, and we are dressing that form in clothes. Yet, He accepts this service, meaning He takes these pebbles and stones from us and, in return, gives us His completeness. He bestows upon us the jewels of wisdom. Who could be a greater trader than this in the world? Do you understand what I am saying? Our ordinary services—performing rituals, bathing, adorning with clothes, putting on garlands, offering incense, lamps, and food—are seen by Baba as insignificant services. He is ever satisfied. He is the eternal complete being. What can we dress or bathe such an all-encompassing consciousness like the sky? He is chidambar but he has showered His compassion over us by descending from His real form and spending 80 years with us in Shirdi, and then appearing in the form of a statue after leaving His physical body. This allows us to serve and worship Him, and thus engage our minds in devotion. He has made it convenient for us, but all our services are like pebbles and stones to Him, and He, in return, gives us His true form. So, while we might not ask for ten grams of cumin seeds for five hundred rupees, the Sadguru accepts our pebbles and stones and gives us precious jewels. Who could be a greater trader than this? Thus, while performing the ritual bath for His form, Baba does not need it, but through this ritual, my inner impurities are cleansed, my sins are washed away, and my mind is purified. I was adorned with these layers, wanting the world to give me respect and honor. By placing a single cloth on Your Samadhi, all my layers fell away. One by one, You removed the masks from my face. This is Your grace. By serving You, I am not doing You a favor; rather, You gave me the opportunity to serve, and in return, You have worn my layers. When in the early morning, a new cloth was spread over Sai, I discarded all my old garments and donned Sai robe. All the other layers of worldly pride and pretense have fallen away. Now, only one layer remains—the layer of Your true exclusive devotion all the contrary clothes or facade masks i had on i dropped all of it. All veils i had are set aside by me. Now, no veil covers my self There is only one attire, and it is that of your exclusive devotion. In the next stanza, it is said: When in the early morning, the priest placed the crown on Sai, I eradicated my own pride and became liberated within As soon as the jewel-encrusted crown was placed on You, Baba, the right to wear such a crown belongs only to You in the entire universe. As you have defeated Maya. Because you have conquered illusion (Maya), the crown rightfully belongs to you. However, as soon as the priest placed the jewel-encrusted crown upon you, I erased all the pride and honor of my life. I became internally liberated. My ego, pride, arrogance, and grandeur those false garments—I discarded. Now, my mind is immersed in renunciation (fakiri). Even though you wore the crown, the benefit is mine, Baba, because all my false pride, arrogance, and ego have vanished. I placed the crown on you, and I am grateful, Baba, that despite being the universal consciousness, you manifested in a physical form and have graced me with your presence in my home. I am fortunate to have received this opportunity for service, Baba. In the last stanza: As flowers began to shower upon Baba from all sides, For some reason, tears started pouring from my eyes, and I was amazed Sai, at how you blessed me so abundantly. I came with so many requests, but I received so much without even asking. devotees started the flower shower after the Mantrapushpanjali, I became overwhelmed with emotion, Baba. As countless flowers were showered upon you, tears of devotion flowed from my eyes. Perhaps as many tears flowed from my eyes as the flowers that were showered upon you. With each flower that showered upon you, my desires, wishes, and vices began to wash away. When I first came to you, before stepping into this court, I came with a list, Baba, intending to ask for many things. But witnessing your Aarti and the Mantrapushpanjali, and seeing the heartfelt devotion of the people as they showered flowers upon you, my desires began to diminish. Tears of devotion welled up in my eyes, I had come with a long list of requests, but seeing the devotional atmosphere, no desire could emerge from my mouth.",

    "Transcript": "This not an ordinary book but an enlighten heritage, His biography in His own words. Om Sairam, Millions of salutations to all Sai devotees. Last time on the occasion of Guruparnima, we learnt in detail about the seven gurus mentioned in Guru Gita. The topic of today's satsang is, As per Baba's saying, what is heaven. Because we have many beliefs about heaven and hell, many things have been said in the scriptures. But we try to know what Baba himself says about heaven and hell. Generally, the belief is that if our deeds are bad, then we are put in hell. We have to bear the tortures of the world in hell and if our deeds are pure, holy, prescribed, those deeds which have been called very holy in the scriptures, if we do those deeds, then we become entitled to heaven and in that heaven we do not have any kind of trouble and even death cannot touch us, such is the belief, that is why the whole world keeps on saying heaven is heaven but how much of that belief is true and how much is false, let us try to know through the words of Baba himself, through the Sai Satcharitra 37 Chapter Verse 10-15 'kiti ek swargsaukhya zagadati, vaniti atyantya swarga chi mahati, te bhuloka tuch maniti, marnachi bhiti mhanti ithe' How many people are there who fight for the happiness of heaven, work hard day and night and describe the greatness of heaven and those people who describe the greatness of heaven say that this earth in comparison to that heaven is worthless and it is said that here the fear of death always haunts man, so this is incomplete, and futher says 'pari avyaktatuni akara yeti, tiyeschi mhanti vyakt sthiti, pudhe tich praveshta avyakti, mrutyu mhanti tiyes' Baba has told a very deep thing here. You say there is fear of death, What in reality in death ? When the soul was not poured in the body, when it was in the unmanifested state, at that time it became manifest from the unmanifested state and came in front of the world in the body, but before taking the body it was in the unmanifested state. Understand with an example, when we go to sleep every night, when we are in deep sleep, where we do not even have the sense of being, that is called unmanifested deep sleep, which is called sushupti, so that stepping in unmanifested is a sort of temporary death but as soon as we become awake in the morning, we again come back to this body, in the consciousness, in the senses, everything becomes alert and sits up, so in the same way Baba is saying that this is also death, even if the body dies, one goes into the unmanifested state and back according to your own karmas, according to your own desires, you again take a new body and are again put in a womb. And after enduring this womb torments, after nine months, you again come to this world and start enjoying the world. So, just like every night in deep sleep, you attain death and then after dawn, you are alive again, similar is the state of death. You leave this body when you attain death, enter the unmanifest and take a new birth again according to your own desires. So, that is why Baba is telling that there is no such thing as death and if the body that has come from the unmanifested, after enjoying its pleasures, when its enjoyment is over completely, then it again attains death, 'adharm, agyan, raag, dvesha, itydi he mrityu pash and this death which defeats a human being in every birth, what is the reason for that? Why does that death dominate us? Why do we become prey to death? Why do we become morsel of death? There is unrighteousness within us, there is ignorance within us, there is attachment within us, there is hatred within us and all these are the noose of death and these become the noose of death around our neck and drag us into the mouth of death. 'yanche ulanghan kari jo ashesh, tyasich pravesh swarloki' Those who defeat these four things, conquer these four things, only those people enter the heaven. Well also these four which have been said, unrighteousness, ignorance, attachment and hatred, attachment and hatred were called by Baba Teli Tamboli. I have told this many times Attachment means to worship Baba while having attachment to the world, Baba used to call them (teli) clingy devotees. I am not dear to them. They want something from me. That is why they chant BABA BABA, and if Baba scolded someone by showing their ignorance, then those who hated Baba, Baba used to call them Tambuli and that is hatred, so all these things, this attachment and hatred do not fall, until unrighteousness does not fall, until ignorance does not fall, we will not get freedom from the fear of death, then the fear of death will always hover over our head, 'Swarg swarg toh kai anik, vairaj tochi swarg lok, virat atma swarup dekh, manasdukh vivarjit' so Baba is giving the definition of heaven here now, he says that heaven which you call, in reality, if detachment takes birth inside a human being, that detachment or dispassion in nothing but Heaven according to Baba where the attachment to the world falls, where the body consciousness falls, all the hopes, desires, wishes are completely abandoned and remember The fear which torments a man, torments him only because of desires. If there are no desires left in a man, then fear of death will be diminished so, more the desires more will be the fear of death the more ones desires, attachments, longings, cravings will reduce, more the fear of death will vanish from his life. So Baba says, moment the feeling of detachment awakens in you, you are in heaven. He is clarifying further that what is actually called heaven and goes on to say,'virat atma swaroop dekh, manas dukhvivarjit' this vastness of the whole universe is me, this whole cosmic expansion of my soul is me, I have covered this whole universe in the form of soul, one who has realized it and one who is free from mental sorrows and one who has attained the supreme soul, I am the soul of this whole universe, I am residing in every particle, one who has attained such state of knowledge, only that is heaven, as per Baba means Baba is clearly calling the knowledge of the soul as heaven here, and if a person has attained the supreme renunciation, Only he has known the real heaven, because without renunciation, the knowledge of the supreme soul is not possible, so Detachment is the basic need of a human being for self knowledge, so adoption of detachment in heart, unfolds the knowledge of self 'jethe nahi rog adi nimit, nahi chinta vyadhi dukh' - Once you know yourself then there is no cause for disease, no worry, no sorrow, no diseases as well, as sorrow is for the body, not for the soul. So where someone's body consciousness has died, if i am body this feeling has been destroyed, then all these things which are telling about disease, worry, illness, sorrow, cannot touch the soul, and where neither hunger is felt, nor thirst arises, neither there is a need to eat food, nor to drink water, because it has nothing to do with anything being made up of the five elements, because hunger and thirst have been destroyed forever and the person who is enjoying the eternal contentment, which is called permanent contentment, which is called permanent bliss, the person who is enjoying that bliss, is not troubled by this ordinary hunger and thirst, he will never get old, meaning all these symptoms of the body is hell Disease, sorrow, humiliation, pain, accidents, death, all these are related to the body and every moment one is getting old. All this is related to the body. It has no connection with the soul. Therefore, this body consciousness itself is the ultimate hell. because this body consciousness itself creates all these things. It first makes one do work that is worth not doing, and then as a result, it forces one to suffer the consequences of those deeds. The same is called body intellect, Maya, Avyakt. 'jethe nahi mrityu bhay, nahi vidhi nished dvay' - The fear of death ends forever after entering the soul form, because I am a soul that will not perish is experienced. The soul can never die. and where the matter of prescribed and non prescribed deeds is ended is the experience of Self realization Therefore, one has gone beyond both, has risen above the web of prescribed and unprescribed deeds, pure deeds and impure deeds, 'nahi vidhi nished dvaya, deh vavre atyant nirbhay' - as body conciousness has died, Vidhi - Nishid has fallen, he has risen above birth, illness and diseases, therefore by becoming fearless, as long as he is in the body, he has attained fearlessness and when the body perishes, even then he attains the supreme fearless state, and He says that that is the divine state of heaven, so they have told what heaven is, they have also told what hell is, but they are stressing too much on renunciation, if you attain renunciation, only then will you be able to experience heaven, without attaining renunciation you cannot even imagine heaven, today whatever imagination of heaven that you have in your mind, is just a figment of your imagination Baba has clarified this in these five verses and further back in this chapter again from verse number 21, he tells about heaven, 'keval vishay bhoga che stan, n lage amha te swarg bhavan, jethe n govid namasmaran, kai karan tayache' a place where only subject of senses or sensual pleasures are enjoyed we don't want such heaven and where one doesn't experiences the joy of chanting the name of Govind we don't want such inferior heaven 'keval vishay bhoga che stan' is said now we try to understand heaven by coming to the ground level, heaven is not some geographical state that after death there is such a world of heaven where we get entry and then we become residents of that place, this imagination, please drop it. And there is no such thing as hell, if there is heaven, it is here, if there is hell, it is here because as soon as a good thought comes to my mind, a pure thought, a selfless thought, a mere thought, I am not talking about actions right now, just by having a thought, our heart, our mind, our entire consciousness blossoms with a good thought, a selfless thought is heaven and if a bad thought comes in our mind or we commit a wrong deed then after committing that wrong deed the state of our mind becomes so gloomy, fear, restlessness, anxiety of every kind because that bad deed has been committed by us, we fear someone may see it, we fear someone may know about it, then that mental state in reality is hell, if we understand these things very minutely then here is the heaven, here is the hell, a good thought makes us experience the state of heaven and a bad thought, a bad deed fills our consciousness with the experience of what is hell, at that very moment we experience hell and heaven we just need that much awareness that we can feel that heaven and that hell. One good thought and action takes you momentarily to heaven one evil thought takes you to hell This is one aspect of heaven and hell. And now see the other aspect, how heaven exists in this universe, in this very world. For example, who are the role models in front of us today? Film stars, very big politicians, very big sports persons, and nowadays, I will add one more name, that is, the famous storytellers, who have amassed wealth worth crores, live a very luxurious life, live a very comfortable life, live a very high class life, their property, their bungalow, their car. If they believe in God even a little bit, then it's just for the world or heaven of theirs should sustain and flourish, that is why we take refuge in God, take refuge in Guru, but they are not living or dying to attain Guru, in spite of having everything they are destitute we get very affected, get influenced by seeing them, but those people are really living a heavenly life in a way, but still it is a poor life. Now see, the earth has been declared greater than heaven. Now let us try to understand this thing properly. Now understand that you have worked very hard to enjoy this world, for the success of this mortal world and you have achieved that as well. Now you are enjoying it. When you are enjoying that thing, there is no place for the devotion of God, there is no hope there because you are so engrossed in sensual pleasures that it is impossible for you to turn towards exclusive devotion. So that is why heaven is dangerous and in the same way hell is also dangerous. Well hell means what if you do some deed that you should not do and the body has become so disabled due to big diseases. caught in a trap, went bankrupt, caught in all kinds of troubles, every moment being with the fear of death, all this is haunting, so even such a hell is dangerous because even there, remembering God, meditating on God, worshipping God, exclusive devotion to God is not possible, which means when you enjoy the worldly pleasures at a very higher level in a very wonderful way in the world, even there exclusive devotion to God is not possible, and if due to some reason you have to suffer extreme pain, have to be bedridden, have to go through a lot of trouble, that is hell, then even at that time exclusive devotion to God, worship of God, remembering God is not possible, hence both these sides heaven as well as hell are dangerous, hence it is said here that the place of the earth is useful and earth means the place where lord has kept me neither you have given me the prosperity nor you have kept in intense agony and it's your immense compassion lord that you have kept me grounded That is why I am able to think about you, I am able to remember you, my inclination is increasing towards your exclusive devotion, so O Lord, never show me that heaven, nor show me that hell, just give me a little peace and a little pain, but while enduring both of them I should be able to reach your real form, so don't put me in so much pain that I stop remembering you, and fill me with so much in happiness that I get confused and get entangled in its attractions and forget you. It means that there is a high possibility of extreme happiness to trap a person in attachments and extreme pain and suffering disturbs you so much that you are not able to remember God, so that is why here in this verse, he has said that do not give me complete heaven there, nor keep me trapped in complete hell, master, keep me always on earth so that I can always think about you, chant your name, meditate, worship, selfless service, power, knowledge, detachment and i can live your or merge myself in your blissful and universal form always keep me on earth, do not show me heaven, do not show me hell, keep me on earth, it is a very good verse, but it has to be understood properly in this perspective, that is why, every moment, thank Baba a million times that master, you have not given me any disease. It is your mercy, you have not placed me to higher pedestal, it is your mercy, and both the things that you have done to me, that is why I am able to worship you today, if you had given me unlimited happiness, even then I would have gone astray, and if you had given me unlimited pain, even then I would have gone astray, O Lord, you have kept me on this earth, keep me like this till my last breath, so that after worshipping you, I can merge in you. So this is what the verse is saying. Further, in verse number 29 Baba says, 'Kaaya Vachha Mane Karun, Kara Panch Praan Samarpan, Nishchayatmak Buddhi Hi Lean, Ho Vo Gurudhin Sarvaswi' this verse is repeated again, the same verse is mentioned in chapter 16 in which Baba asks Marwari for five rupees, so these are the five things, Kaaya(body), Vachha(speech), Mann(Mind), Panch Praan(five vital airs) and Buddhi(intellect). we will be able to give these five rupees only if He keeps us on the earth, neither by keeping us in heaven will we be able to offer these to Him, nor in hell because the pain there is so much that remembering God is impossible there. Therefore, thank you again and again that the Lord has placed us on earth/situation where it is easy to worship Him, extreme state of happiness as well as extreme state of sorrow is also dangerous, Brahmagyan in just five rupees on this topic is video on our channel in detail. You can watch it there. It has been explained in great detail in that, If one takes refuge in God by offering five rupees to Him, then how will one be afraid of the fears of this world, how will one be worried about the meaningless world of Maya as it never stands tall after offering five rupees to Sadguru After destroying all your ignorance, Sadguru will take you to refuge. However, for that to happen, a person's residence should be on earth, as stated in verse 28. and it's Baba's infinite compassion that He has kept us grounded or else you wouldn't have any desire to listen to this talk If you have been given immense happiness by the Lord, then you must have been trapped in illusion. And you would be deprived of this wisdom on the other hand if He has given you immense pain then too this wisdom wouldn't have impacted your Heart So, it's His compassion that He has kept us grounded and we could worship Him exclusively To explain this heaven and hell, I will take a story and it will become more clear, there was a king and a city he ruled. He had two sons the Kulguru of the empire was such a guru who had attained great spiritual progress, the Kulguru gives education to both the children, gives training in spirituality, ruling is an inheritance from the father. So those kids will rule sooner or later but the Kulguru feels that they should also be given spiritual knowledge, so both of them are filled with deep spiritual knowledge but one of the boys, the elder one, is not inclined towards spirituality. He stays connected with him only with the feeling of taking care of the royal throne and the younger one listens to his words with full attention and he lives each and every word, and those experiences start coming in his life, so one day without telling anyone, that younger boy leaves the house, and starts doing penance for years, yearns to seek refuge in gurus, great gurus come in his life, and achieves enlightenment from them following the spiritual path and the elder becomes king after the death of his father and achieves a big empire to rule one day it is known in the royal court that a yogi has come and is sitting on the outskirts of a village, on the banks of a river, and whatever he says, it gets accomplished, then this news reaches the king as well, and then the king feels that if such a great yogi has come to our kingdom then we should definitely bring him to honor so the ministers go and try to welcome the Yogi to the royal court but the yogi denies saying i am fine here and close discussion the ministers recognize that the yogi is none but the younger prince so they go and tell the elder one about the yogis as his younger brother. He feel sorry for desolate condition of his younger brother So with some ministers he on his chariot goes to bring his brother back so, he says to his younger brother, \"You came and sat here like this, came to their own kingdom, don't feel like coming?\" The younger replied,\" No, I can see you for 24 hours\" Where am I far from you that I can see you? I see you every moment. They say, whatever it is, let's go with us to the kingdom. I won't come to the kingdom. Then there is a bit of an argument between the two of them about what state you have gotten yourself into. Why are you in such a wretched condition here? Now that I have found out today, I can't leave you here. I will take you with me. What state have you brought yourself into? What have you achieved? Look, I have become a king here. Today, people follow me wherever I go My name and fame are widespread. What do you have? What have you gained? What state have you brought yourself into? He say that all these people run after you. If I ask someone to give up their life for me, they will do it. The big brother says this. The little brother was weaving a blanket and has a needle. so he throws the needle into the sea and he says, tell your people to search and bring back the needle. What's the big deal about that? Then the big brother says, He orders his people togo and jump into the river. One by one the divers dive but they can't find the needle. Finally, the big brother also jumps into the water and searches for the needle but doesn't find it. He feels defeated and asks the younger one to bring it? So, the little brother says that it will come. \"How can it come? Go and jump into the river for it\" asks the elder. 'No i don't have to jump it will come at your feet' says the yonger. So, the little brother sits with closed eyes, focusing intently. A fish comes out of the water holding the needle in its mouth and drops it in front of them before jumping back into the river. The big brother is astonished, thinking that your influence is everywhere. Today I have realized that your life is very high and the life I considered high has been proven hollow today. Saying this, he bows before him. The purpose of telling this story is that the big brother was experiencing heaven, while the little brother, by remaining on the ground, has reached such a high state through his spiritual practice that he has conquered the entire universe. Whatever he desires, the nature or the universe becomes his servant. As soon as he speaks or even thinks of something, nature has to fulfill it. The little brother has reached this state, becoming the hero of the universe, the yogi. The big brother, on the other hand, is like Indra in Nandanvana, enjoying heavenly pleasures compared to donkey who experiences it in grabage heap.He realizes that the happiness he is experiencing today is nothing in comparison to his brother's accomplishments. If this topic has come up, let's take another topic related to Islam. If you have been active on social media, you might have seen the ongoing debate about the mention of paradise (Jannah) and 72 virgins (hūr) in the Quran. It is said that if a man has faith in God, worships Him with full dedication, and devotes himself entirely to God, he will be granted paradise, where he will receive 72 virgins. This topic has stirred quite a controversy, which many of you might have noticed. Since this is related to heaven, I thought we should shed some light on this topic today. Especially, women often ask, \"Does this mean that only men will attain paradise and receive 72 virgins? What about women?\" They wonder if the Quran mentions anything for women, or if it is only for men. Many questions have been raised, sometimes in a very negative way, and have been presented incorrectly. The answers given by people are also available, but today, since this topic is related to heaven, and we have discussed it extensively, let’s look at what the Quran says first. According to the Quran, one must follow the footsteps of Prophet Muhammad. The guidance he has given must be followed completely. By doing so, the heart will be purified, all wrong desires of the self will be eliminated, and the self will become pure. First and foremost, one must follow the footsteps of the Prophet, This will lead to the purification of the mind And if the self (nafs) is purified, then paradise will be granted, and there he will receive 72 virgins (hūr), normally this is the perception. let's assume that we adhered the advice of prophet muhammad, acted accordingly and mind is purified and if had a vision of God So I ask a question: Is paradise greater than seeing God (Allah) and the Prophet Muhammad? I want to ask this first. If it is greater than both of these, then indeed, paradise will be granted, and 72 virgins will come. But someone who believes that if I receive even the dust from the feet of my guide, the Prophet Muhammad, then my life will be purified, such a person will not think about paradise or the 72 virgins. The truth is, once a person follows their advice and sees God, will the desire for paradise and 72 virgins even remain? we don't live with such common sense that how can a desire for paradise or virgins would remain after having the vision of God It was perhaps kept there so that initially, people would be drawn towards faith. Maybe that temptation was shown for that reason, but there is nothing greater than that. the problem is that our thinking doesn't goes above paradise and virgins towards Prophet and God Their status is much higher than paradise and the 72 virgins because once one attains God, those desires will cease to exist. Neither the desire for paradise nor the desire for virgins will remain. These promises were perhaps made to initially attract people towards faith. There is nothing greater than this. As I mentioned, paradise and hell are within us. A good thought, a good action creates paradise within us, and a bad thought, a bad action creates hell within us at that moment. So, paradise and hell, heaven and hell, are within us, not outside. That’s all I will say. If we embark on the worship of God Living and dying for His worship then No matter how many difficulties come that person endures with great patience and does not stop until he sees Allah. In reality, moving forward while enduring those hardships is true heaven. and If there is no connection with the Prophet Muhammad or the desire to see Allah, and one is only indulging in the comforts of the world, then there is no greater hell than that. So, we must see heaven and hell from a very different perspective. If that clarity comes, then perhaps all these questions will not arise. Otherwise, as long as humanity remains on this earth, these questions will continue to trouble us. These are some of the things that Baba mentioned about heaven in Chapter 37 of the Sai Satcharitra. I have tried to open this up to you today. I hope it has touched your heart and brought some clarity about what heaven and hell truly are. So, I will conclude today's session here.     "Transcript": "so Baba through this leela wants to say that worth of company an ardent devotee Om Sai Ram. In Adhyay 22 of Sai Satcharitra is the story of Ahmednagar resident Shri Kaka Saheb Mirikar’s son Shri Balasaheb Mirikar’s serious danger to life. The story goes like this. Balasaheb Mirikar who was a Mamalatdar of Kopergaon, one day set out to Chitli on official government work. On the way he came to Shirdi to take Baba’s darshan. Whilst talking Baba asked Balasaheb if he was aware of Lambu Maharaja that is poisonous snake and the effects of its poison. Everyone present there started wondering why Baba asked this. But since it was getting late to reach Chitli, after taking darshan Balasaheb left from there without asking anything further. Baba asked Madhavrao to go with Mirikar. Mirikar asked Madhavrao what will you do by coming so far to Chitli. Unnecessarily you will be troubled. Madhavrao went to Baba and told him this. Baba said Okay, Allah’s wish. But Mirikar thought that Baba will not say anything without reason. So, he signaled to Madhavrao to go along with him. But Madhavrao again took Baba’s permission and went to Chitli with Mirikar. When they reached Chitli arrangement to stay was made in Hanuman Temple. So, they both went there. But the Government official they were to meet did not come and because it was very late in night, they both rested on the blanket there and Mirikar started reading the newspaper. Then there was sound of rustling of paper. The servant present there took his lantern and saw that there was a snake sitting on Mirikar’s waist. Seeing this he got scared and softly whispered “Snake, Snake.” Mirikar’s attention went there and he knew his life was in danger. In the meantime, the servants present there killed the snake with sticks and Mirikar’s life was saved. Friends, from this story we come to know that Baba always protected his devotees from impending calamities. But in this story Baba send Madhavrao with Mirikar but Madhavrao did nothing then why did Baba send Madhavrao with him. We will throw light on this in this episode. Om Sai Ram. In this Leela Bala Saheb Mirikar has been addressed as Kaka Saheb Mirikar and we apologize for that. The Leela in Adhyay 22, kaka Saheb Mirikar. All those who were connected to Baba in the village, there was a custom there that whenever anyone from the village went out then that person took permission. This custom was followed by everyone that before leaving Baba’s permission has to be taken. Go to Dwarakamai, touch Baba’s feet, take Baba’s permission and then leave. This had become a ritual But it was not that everyone followed this custom religiously and earnestly. Some people followed it like a custom or ritual. And some followed with complete faith. There is a difference. Kaka Saheb Mirikar also comes to Baba and says that I am going to Chitli permit me to go, takes darshan and sets out to go. Shama also has come with him. So, he calls Shama and tells him that you also go with him to Chitli. He goes and tells him that Baba has asked me to go with you. I am coming with you. He says why are you unnecessarily troubling yourself, there is no need for you to come. On hearing this Shama again goes to Baba and says that he is saying that there is no need of me to go and he has asked me not to go with him. Baba says it’s okay. There is a very important verse, what Baba says to Shama – Apan Chintave nitya heet, updeshava arth vihit, asel jaise jayache karmat, taisech nischit ghadel (Verse 65 Adhyay 22). This a very important verse. When I say something to someone, I think long term and I say for their good and if they do not want to listen then whatever is in their Karma, what Baba is saying here is that as per karma some adversity has to happen and I have said something so that it can be avoided and if you do not want to follow it then let whatever is written as per Karma will happen. What is the meaning endangerment to life? It means that some adversity which should happen has been written and when that is avoided then we say that endangerment to life has been avoided. So, there is some calamity waiting to happen which is not good for Kaka Saheb but this person has no idea about it and he says that there is no need of you even then Baba says that you go. When Mirikar refuses to take him then he comes to Baba and says that he says that there is no need of me there and has refused and then Baba makes that statement. This Baba’s statement, and Mirikar is standing there and listening and before that he has even given hint that do you know that long Baba and making his hand like a snake. Do you know that deadly snake and then remembers all these things and there is depth to this and if Baba is saying then I must take him with me. He gets scared and then he understands that if Baba is saying then I must take him. Then he takes Shama with him. And as the story goes and you narrated, his staying in Maruti Temple and he is engrossed in reading the newspaper and then the hissing sound of the snake and sighting it in the lantern’s light and then people coming and killing it, this is the story. Now the question is what is Shama’s, Madhavrao’s role in this which Baba has insisted upon and send him with him. And Madhavrao has only done this, if you see his contribution then from his mouth comes a statement which is very important which is Verse 84 from the same Adhyay – Shamrao hi chakit zale, mhanati Baba he kay kele, naste vighna kotuni dhadile, ata nirasaley pahije. This statement has lot of significance. Because the whole leela opens up because of this statement. When Shamaji was looking at that time at the snake and it is said that time is inauspicious at that time and it would take life, it is poisonous snake and if it bites then Mirikar will not survive. It is that snake which if it bites won’t be able to ask for even water. After seeing that the statement that comes from Shama is Shamrao hi chakit zale, mhanati Baba he kay kele, naste vighna kotuni dhadile, ata nirasaley pahije. It means that even Shamrao was surprised and he says that Baba what have you done? This unwanted calamity where did you bring it from? Now you please take us out from this. The wording ata nirasaley pahije are invaluable. Baba knew very well that Mirikar did not have that dedicated devotion towards Baba that even in such a delicate situation he will remember Baba. Kaka Saheb Mirikar devotion did not have such depth but Shama had. This story itself shows the depth of Shama’s devotion. Firstly, when Baba asked him to go, he immediately goes and sits in Tonga and when Mirikar says that there is need to come then he goes to Baba and tells him and Baba says Okay you need not go. But when again Mirikar tells Shama no you come with me that time also he does not go directly and sit in Tonga, he says that I will go to Baba and again take his permission. That depth of obedience, means Shama never used his intelligence when Baba was there. He was absolutely obedient. Using own intelligence was like poison. He had such deep faith in Baba. His ego was surrendered. He was egoless. He was totally liberated from doership and when a person reaches that state then anything that person says then Baba has no choice but to do that is what this leela says. Mi maziya bhaktacha bhukela, ahe pasich ubha thakala, premacha mi bhukela, haak hakela detase. It means that I am always under the control of my true devotees, I am with them every moment, I am always hungry for their love, to such devotee at their one call I present myself without any delay. That is why he has not done anything but the words that come from his mouth ata nirasaley pahije, that prayer, that which he asks for that is valuable. Baba through this Leela says that even we get the company of a dedicated devotee in our life then what its value is, is what this Leela tells. That one person who has that exclusive devotion towards his Guru, I am not that devoted but even if I get the company of such a devotee then only by being in such a company the worse adversity of my life can be avoided, such a company is of importance. It is said your color is as per the company you keep. So, this leela beautifully shows what is the importance of such a person. If in life I am not totally devoted to my Sadguru then at least such a person who has this dedicated devotion then I should ask from Baba company of such a person His company, his prayers, a single word from his mouth can avoid my calamity. And Baba has no choice but to pay heed to his words. It is there in his karma; this calamity was written in Kaka Saheb Mirikar’s fortune. Baba is all capable of avoiding the calamity even without Shama. But through this story it is trying to show the significance of a true devotee. This is more important is what I would say.
