'Where are you searching for me, O friend? I am right beside you.' Not in pilgrimage places, not in idols, Someone recently asked me a question that if one resides in a sacred place like Shirdi, and if they perform sadhana there, their merits multiply manifold. What is your opinion on this matter? I said, 'What opinion can I have? This fact has been confirmed in many major scriptures by prominent saints. If someone resides in a holy place, performs spiritual practices there, then the rewards multiply many times over.' But along with this, I would like to add one more thing here: it doesn't end here. By saying this much, you cannot escape your duties. Even if you perform 10% of virtuous deeds in such a sacred place, you receive rewards a hundredfold because the significance of that place is such that even if you do 10% of good deeds, 10% worship, 10% spiritual practice, God turns it into a hundred percent. This is true. But along with this, there is another truth: if you reside in such a sacred place and if you make mistakes, if you stray, if you perform misdeeds, then the consequences of that also multiply manifold. But nobody wants to grasp this aspect, nobody wants to talk about it. Humans are so selfish that they accept only what suits them, So if you perform 10% good deeds in holy places, they give back 100% rewards, sacred sites. But if you commit any wrongdoing or mistakes there, the punishment is also infinitely multiplied, this should not be forgotten either. You are only looking at one side of the coin, there is another side too. \"Na Teerath Mein, Na Moorat Mein\" I am neither in any pilgrimage nor in any idol, meaning here it is to say that I am not limited to just that extent, do not take it as he is not present there. It means I am not limited only to pilgrimage, I am not limited only to idols, I am beyond that. And if you only limit me to that extent, then you have confined my scope, you have confined me. If I am in your destination, then you have confined me, then you can never be limitless. \"Na Teerath Mein, Na Moorat Mein Na Ekant Niwas Mein\" I am not only in solitary retreat; I am also amidst the crowd. That's why it is said that there should be a spontaneous state of meditation, not just sitting in one place and meditating, that is just the initial stage. But spontaneous meditation is when one remains in a meditative state, 24 hours, behaving like everyone else but still not losing inner tranquility, that is called spontaneous meditation. And it is applicable only to great enlightened masters like Baba, even great scholars cannot attain it. \" Na Teerath Mein, Na Moorat Mein Na Ekant Niwas Mein Na Mandir Mein, Na Masjid Mein Na Kabe Kailas Mein\" I am not limited only to temples or mosques, I am not limited only to the Kaaba or Kailash. I am beyond that as well Don't just limit me to that extent. \" Na Main Jap Mein, Na Main Tap Mein Na mein vrat upwaas me\" Na Main Kiriya Karm Mein Rehta Nahin Jog Sanyas Mein\" I am not only in chanting, I am not only in penance, I am beyond that. The more you chant, the more you practice penance, you will realize that there is something beyond this. This does not mean that you should abandon all these practices. No, when Kabir Ji said, \"He is not in these,\" he was not saying it to everyone. He was addressing those who have exhausted themselves by engaging in all these practices and yet haven't touched the essence. It is an attempt to make them understand that, \"Brother, all that you have done was necessary, but just by doing these, you won't reach the ultimate truth.\" Otherwise, if you interpret it incorrectly, it could lead to a big problem, and then Kabir Ji might be misunderstood. \" Na Main Jap Mein, Na Main Tap Mein Na Mein Barat Upaas Mein Na Main Kiriya Karm Mein Rehta Nahin Jog Sanyas Mein\" And I do not dwell in rituals nor do I dwell in worldly actions; nor I reside in renunciation and yoga It's not just that I have taken renunciation; it's not like I have touched its essence. Those who renounce the world, they leave it behind, but the world doesn't leave them. The irony lies in the fact that the world leaves them, it's a different matter. You can leave the world behind in a moment, but the world doesn't leave you. So the day the world leaves you, that day you become renunciant. And the ability to free oneself from the world lies in the enlightened master; he liberates. \" Bande ko Banda Mila, chute kaun upaay, seva kar nirband ki, jo pal me lei chuday\" Serve the one who is free from bonds, who can liberate you in an instant. So the purpose of saying this is just that you should not limit Him only to temples, mosques, fasting, rituals, and worship; it is beyond that. But they are necessary; in the beginning, all these things are necessary, but as you progress, you will realize that it is not just about these. Eventually, you will understand that you need to lose yourself. If I show the strength to lose myself, then I will attain it. Even after doing so much, if the sweetness of diminishing ego has not yet awakened within you, then you are far from God. Despite fasting, practicing yoga, renouncing, you are the poorest of the poor because the sweetness of diminishing has not yet awakened within you Here, the moment you diminish your ego you attain oneness with God. But if you keep fearing death, then all these practices are fake, they didn't work, you didn't go in the right direction. All these practices prepare you to die, they give you the strength to die, they increase the sweetness of diminishing ego, you start enjoying it. There is a famous couplet by Kabir Ji: \" Jin khoja tin paiya, gehre paani paith, mein bapura budan Dara, raha kinare baith\" Whoever searched in the deep waters and found it by diving in, sitting on the shore, they never found God. And here, if you want to leap into the ocean, you need to be prepared to drown. Only those who dive with the readiness to drown emerge alive. And the one who sits on the shore fearing to die, they never attained anything, nor will they ever. So if the sweetness of diminishing hasn't awakened then your entire effort is in vain, your entire worship is in vain because all these practices, all this worship, if they couldn't generate that sweetness of diminishing within you, then you have missed the mark, you have lost your way somewhere. Then the destination is still far away, and the goal remains untouched. \"Khoji Hoye Turat Mil Jaoon Ik Pal Ki Talas Mein, Kahat Kabir Suno Bhai Sadho Mein To Hun Viswas Mein\" Here,”Khoji\"(searcher) refers to the awakening of the desire to dissolve, the awakening of the sweetness of dissolution. It means if the desire to dissolve arises within, meaning if He desires to dissolve and you are prepared to dissolve, only then will you reach the state where you can attain God. And the one displaying the strength to dissolve is actually showing the false 'self', the false 'ego'. The false 'ego' must die if you want to bring the true 'self' to life. While holding onto the false 'self', the true 'self' does not come within reach. So, this is the essence, that's why I always say that the sweetness of dissolution, the true spirituality, means the sweetness of dissolution. So all these practices, all these worships, all these fasting rituals, all these actions, all these renunciations, are to be done only for the purpose of dissolution The whole world shudders at the mention of death; it begins to tremble as soon as the name of death is spoken. Have you ever thought why it trembles? Everyone fears death because their desires and ambitions are so vast. The more desires and ambitions one harbors, the greater the fear of death they experience. And as many hopes, desires, attachments to home, to children, if while living, you cut the thread of attachment by worshiping God. Then the fear of death flies away from your mind while living, otherwise they say that Yamraj drags you away forcibly. You don't want to go, but they take you forcibly. They snatch you away from this world. So if you want to go willingly, then while living, by increasing devotion to God, by increasing worship, you have to break this tangle of attachment. Then the fear of death will end on its own, will end while living. You will go into the arms of God as a child runs and hides in his mother's lap, similarly in death, you will run into it. Because while living, all your desires, all attachments, all wishes have ended. Then death will seem very beautiful to you. But if all these things are there, attachment to the world, to family, to children, to home, to the body, then death will force you to shiver moment by moment, it will frighten you. So he is saying, \"Khoji Hoye Turat Mil Jaoon\" If one is a true seeker, seeker here doesn't mean someone searching externally, but someone who has the power to eliminate themselves. \"Turat Mil Jaoon, Ik Pal Ki Talas Mein\" If you showed readiness to dissolute, you became, here you disappear and there you become. \"Kahat Kabir Suno Bhai Sadho Mein To Hun Viswas Mein\" And one should have the belief that \"O Lord, I desire to dissolve by Your hands and only wish to dissolve through Your sacred hands; there is no desire left in me for anything else in this world.\" On the day you dissolve with such pure sentiment, you will become the supreme ruler of infinite universes. That's why there is a saying of Jesus, \"Whoever desires to live, is killed every time.\" Listen carefully, this is the essence of the entire Vedanta, in this one saying of Jesus. \"Whoever desires to live is killed every time, and whoever maintains the power to lose this life while living, attains eternal life.\" So, I conclude this discussion for today.",

There is a story of five rupees in the sixteenth chapter of Sai Satcharitra. The story is like this: One day there was a believer devotee who was always engrossed in accumulating wealth. Hearing Baba's fame, he set out to go to Shirdi with the desire to attain Brahma knowledge. When his friend came to know about this. So he scolded him and said that it is simply impossible for a greedy and stingy person like you to get the knowledge of Brahma. Despite that, that believer devotee, on the return bid, reached Shirdi with a hired horse and took darshan of Baba and said, Baba to grant him the attainment of knowledge of Bramha. Then Baba said, don't worry at all, I will give you the knowledge of Brahma because all the devotees associated with me demand only worldly and mortal things. Among the millions of devotees, someone like you comes to me with the desire of knowledge of Brahma. Saying this, Baba asked them to sit and talked about this and that called a small boy and asked him to go and borrow ₹5 from Nandu Marwari for me The boy went immediately, but Nandu was not at home. That child came to Baba and told him the whole truth. Then Baba sent him to Bala wani. This time too the child came empty handed because even bala was not at home. Then Baba sent the child to two or four more other places, but from nowhere he could get Rs. 5 At this, the seeker of Brahman started saying to Baba, \"Baba, I have hired a horse for the return journey, hence I cannot stay for long.\" Please give me spiritual knowledge as soon as possible. Then Baba started telling him that whatever I did for so long was only to get you Brahma but your greed for money is so much. That despite having 50 times the amount of ₹5 in your pocket, it wasn't possible for you to lend me just ₹5. So, for a money-minded person like you, attaining divine knowledge is also only impossible. Friends, in this story, Baba is asking for which ₹5, and how do we have to offer those ₹5? We will shed light on this in today's episode, Om Sai Ram This 16th chapter is like the heart of Sai Satcharitra Because this chapter brings us closer to purpose for which this scripture was created the knowledge Bramha First of all, If the details regarding the attainment of Bramha are not there in any book then that book cannot be Prasadhik. And this is a prasadik scripture. Its purpose is for every human to attain divine knowledge. So, in that sense, this chapter is the heart of the Sai satcharitra. And the seeker here, the person who is present in Baba's court with the curiosity of attaining divine knowledge, is none other but we, because having the curiosity of divine knowledge is one thing and having a true thirst for divine knowledge is another. So, there is a deep difference between such two individuals. Having curiosity about Brahman or not fully understanding its depth. This is one kind of person, and another person is the one who, understanding its full depth, reaches a court with the thirst for it. So, maybe that person didn't have the full depth and reached shirdi upon hearing that Baba is the divine manifestation who instantly grants the attainment of Brahman. This naturally comes to the forefront in this Leela. He was blinded by greed, and Baba exposed that there. That's apparent, \"but until you give me those ₹5, I cannot grant you the attainment of Brahman.\" What Baba is saying there is of great importance, there's a verse i'll take it maybe it will provide more clarity Verse number 73, Baba says,\"bramha lagi panch pran, panch panchendriya gyan, ahankar budhhi mann, lagti samrpan karavaya\" So, the ₹5 that Baba is asking for are these in implied sense meaning the five organs of action and the five organs of knowledge should be offered to Guru these contributes to one rupee and the second rupee is the five vital airs. And the mind: the third rupee, intellect: the fourth rupee, and ego: the fifth rupee. So, this adds up to ₹5. So until we don't give these ₹5, it's impossible for any SadGuru to grant us the attainment of divine knowledge. Now the question is how to give those ₹5? The five pranas are such that if I take out the five pranas from within me and keep them aside, then I won't survive. Firstly, how do I give them? And then giving away the five senses of knowledge means not taking out the eyes, not taking out the ears, which is natural, so how do we give? What he is asking for, he has just made it clear that you have come to ask for knowledge of Brahma not even self-knowledge, Brahma knowledge means ultimate. The elemental knowledge which is higher than self-knowledge is called Brahma knowledge. Meaning that you have come with the expectation of ultimate realization and you cannot give ₹5 and you do not have the ability to give these five things, nor can you give Panch Prana. You can neither give me Panch Panchendriya gyan nor can you give me mind, nor can you give intelligence, nor can you give me ego and unless you are capable of giving me this ₹5, then you cannot be entitled to Brahma Gyan, now the question is that how will we give the Panch Pran which is being talked about? When we are fighting with ourselves. We are fighting with our senses, we are fighting with our mind, when we are fighting with our sin, we are fighting with our mistake, when we see our mistakes and when we are working hard on it. then despite our best efforts, those mistakes keep happening again and again. So a kind of regret. A kind of suffocation: Whenever that mistake happens, a true person, a person with faith, feels suffocated. As if I am losing my life or I have made this mistake, I am trying my best but still I am making this mistake, so that suffocation of regret, where I feel like losing my breath, I would call it offering of five vital airs Because until such a deep thirst has awakened, until the level of remorse has not reached such an extent where you start suffocating where you start feeling that living this life with such felonies is not acceptable to me and until that feeling that Regret of a level where it starts suffocating. So that yearning, ache in the heart, has to be given to Him in the form of Panch Praan and any Sadguru, He will keep in his sight only such a person who has so much truth and sees his ignorance. Every human being is trapped in the attraction of these five senses. It's as if he/she is alive only to indulge in these five senses. And Baba is asking the offering of the same pleasure. Will you be able to sacrifice the power of those five subjects for my sake? Can you eliminate these five senses from your life? If you put effort into it, with complete honesty, then you have given me the second rupee. So, this is the second rupee. Pancha Panchendriya Gyan. and the third is the mind. Now, the senses were related to the enjoyment of objects, so it was about giving those objects. Therefore, the second rupee, which we call it, was given. The more success I achieve in it, the more my ego will inflate. Naturally, if the owner (God) has bestowed beauty upon me, I would want to capitalize on it. It is impossible. In the next verse 96 he says Prakash Swaroop je gyanbuddhi, and when will this intellect become like a light, when you fill it up with the light of the company of the wise one (Satsang), when you are in the company of saints and wise ones When you repeatedly hear the divine spiritual Sai Satcharitra which is the soul of Baba, then your mind will be like light. Manasi tethe lava samadhi and then one has to go in profound meditation in that intellect. Till such time there is no light in the intellect profound meditation of the mind is impossible. So first fill the intellect with so much wisdom and detachment that mind goes into profound meditation Prakash Swaroop je gyanbuddhi, manasi tethe lava samadhi manasaha sarvendriya samruddhi, , the prosperity of all the senses along with the mind, eka Swadhin buddhichya. Means this body is the grossest, senses are subtle than this eyes, ears, tongue, mouth, skin, speech all these senses are the Master of this gross body and the Master of the senses is the mind and the Master of the mind is the intellect. If you see like this, then who is the Master of this entire existence? Who is the Master of the whole Body. It is intellect. It is not the mind. It is the intellect. This is what this tells. Now I come to the leela. Baba said that in the entire body the head is the Chief. It means that it represents the intellect. You just sprinkle a little water on it then it will take care of the whole body. Do you understand this? Baba is saying why are you stuck in this outwards bathing, Megha? Let me tell you what real bathing is. Original bathing is that this intellect has to be filled by the Light, let it be filled by my will. Let it be filled with yearning for my heart. Fill it with wisdom and attachment. That is real bath. There is Kabirji’s doha Nahaey dhoye kya hua, you bathe daily. There are some people who take bath twice a day. There are some who scrub their body and take bath. It should be that way. You have to keep the body clean. I am not against it. But Kabirji says Nahaey dhoye kya hua, jo man mael na jaye, you may apply shampoo on the body, you may apply the world’s best soap, you scrub your body and bathe but Kabirji says Nahaey dhoye kya hua, jo man mael na jaye, Machli sada jal mei rahe, dhoye bas na jay. The fish is in water 24 hours but if you remove it out it stinks. If you do all sort of Baba ‘s pooja, do Baba’s aarti, you are praising Baba, doing bhajans, do padyatra, do parikrama but if you do not understand Baba’s heart then that intellect does not have the light. That intellect is not filled with light, so Baba tells Megha when I say just sprinkle some drops, so always the bath has to be taken of that of intellect. If you are able to bathe the intellect by giving the coming of the wise ones (Satsang), by giving light by knowing the will of the Sadguru, reading every Adhyay of Sai Satcharitra, if you can fill the intellect with light then it is bathing the actual existence. This is original bath. Then what bath you take, you just scrub your body hard. It is not the bath of the existence. You are keeping it clean at the gross level. You have no capability of keeping it clean at the subtle level. This is such a small Leela. Sprinkle little water on my head Megha. Baba wanted to tell that fill your intellect with wisdom, with my will, you fill it with yearning of my heart. Know what I expect from you, in this way you will be able to fill your intellect with my light and oh Megha that will be your real bath and the daily bath that you take that is not the actual bath. It is a small Leela but in that Leela we only see miracle. But through this Leela baba wanted to tell something really deep. Frankly speaking that this existence is been run by the intellect and if that intellect is false intellect, scheming intellect, it is foolishness and it will not stop without destroying this body. This human body is said to be most important amongst 84 lakhs species, that body you will make it worthless. It is not known whether next body will be that of human because you used it foolishly, you did not use it well. You have a cunning intellect. See, even Shakuni was intelligent but it was always filled with incorrect reasoning, no human was more cunning than Shakuni but it was in wrong direction. Same intelligence Krishna also has, even Krishna was intelligent but that intellect was as per Dharma, it was with justice, it was with principles. That is why Krishna is Krishna and Shakuni is Shakuni. Even today Krishna is worshiped but if we take even the name of Shakuni a kind of negativity enters within us and that is Shakuni. The reason is the damaging intellect, it is filled with wickedness, it is not honest intellect. It is not as per righteousness (dharma) If someone is saying something then how should I take it, if my intellect converts to wisdom then wherever piousness is seen, wherever honesty is seen there your ego will bow down. Then whosoever may be in front of you, you will bow down to such a person. So, your intellect is inspired by good sense. But if you do not have that capability then you will not be able to bow down to the truthfulness. And you never bow down to a person, remember this, you bow down to the piousness of that individual. You can never bow down to an individual, what is the importance of that body? but importance is of the intellect. With one small Leela Baba is saying just sprinkle some water on my head and the bath is done. This Leela is so very important, those who are listening to me please understand this carefully if we cannot fill one intellect with wisdom, if one intellect we cannot fill with light, we cannot make one intellect listen to the Ramayan story, if one intellect we cannot narrate the Mahabharata poetry to our coming generation then you cannot light up the intellect. If every verse of Sai Satcharitra does not touch your heart, it does not seep into your intellect then it is not enlightened intellect it is like that of Shakuni. It will not allow you take human birth in the next birth it will take you down to animal species which is filled with incorrect reasoning. From wherever you get light, from wherever you get goodness, from wherever you get purity, spread your bag and take it let not your ego come in between. It is a very small Leela of Megha, it is from Adhyay 28, it is a small Leela of Megha and it happened on Makar Sankrant. Baba is saying that if in this life you keep this one intellect properly then your entire existence will be taken care of. What you have to eat, what you should drink, when you should eat, how much to eat, what you should speak, where you should keep quiet, where you should open your mouth. I remember an incident from Mahabharat. Yudhistar’s Rajsuv yagna is completed and all the Kauravs and Pandavas meet at a place for participating in the yagna. But seeing that Yagna Duryodhana and Dushyasana are jealous, we gave them khandav prastha and they made Indraprashta out of it and on top of it he is doing Rajsuv yagna but out of jealousy, envy, all of them are assembled there but Duryodhana is not there inspite of being there but something is going on in his mind. Krishna is also there, Maharshi Vyas comes there and there is one uniqueness of Vyas, if you see the serial and even if you read the Mahabharata, he spoke very little but whatever he spoke it was very deep. Vyas says that seeing this I feel very happy that everyone has come together, Kauravas and the Pandavas, one never knows when we will see this auspicious day again. The meaning of this is, sage Vyas was farsighted and he knew that this was their last meeting. They will never come close after today. So Sage Vyasa speaks a word, cautioning Duryodhana O Duryodhana, one should never forget his place. The light of the lamp is of the lamp and the light of the sun is of the sun. Now this Vyasa Maharishi is telling to Duryodhana. He speaks this much and leaves from there, Dhritarashtra says that what has Vyas ji said that the light of the lamp is of the lamp, the light of the sun is of the sun, then Duryodhana interrupts, \"What is in this, Father? A lamp is a lamp and the sun is sun. Then Krishna says: Duryodhana, i did not understand what Vyasa Maharshi said. Then you will be able to explain, He repeats the same thing that a lamp is a lamp and the sun is sun. This is fallacious reasoning. There Vyasa Maharishi had to say, \" O Duryodhana, to become a king one should posses qualities of righteousness, being devoted to it, morality all those are in Yudhistir as a radiating sun and in you it is present as gleaming as that of a lamp But Yudhishthira is the shining sun, so his place is his, your place is yours. If you accept this truth, then one day you too will be able to become the sun, otherwise this lamp will also be extinguished. This slight flicker of lamp will also be extinguished. and that's how it happens. In the end, all the kavravs are killed, and lamp is extinguished. So, if in your intellect there is no light of faith, no light of conscience, no light of religion where to bow down. If someone who gives better knowledge than me stands in front, then there I should not delay even for a moment, I must bow down at the feet of that person and if this faith is not present then it will not take time to extinguish this lamp. So, that is the status of the intellect. There will be fewer mistakes in life. And if there are fewer mistakes, then there will be less sorrow, but if one cannot fill this intellect with light, then whenever you will be at the divergence You will choose the wrong path and you will continue to stumble after stumble, you will continue to suffer in sorrow. therefore Always keep the intellect strong. Keep it full of light that whenever you stand at the divergence you can easily think and get out by taking aid of what is right and can avoid misery moment by moment And as soon as this intellect turned into foolishness, pride and eccentricity came into it. And if one walks towards foolishness, nothing will be gained except sorrow. Through this small leela Baba said that megha you have been bathing body from births now i am telling another bath i.e to bathe your intellect be vigilant about it Every moment Fill the intellect with the light of the scriptures, with an epic like Ramayana and Mahabharata. fill it with every word every verse of Sai satcharitra then that light will never let you accept wrong path and by which you will be saved from forthcoming difficulties or else they will never your pursuit because your intellect has become vicious So, a complete effort has been made to explain this through leela now look there is another couplet of Kabir 'shabd vichari jo chale, gurumukh hoi nihaal' So, the words that emerge from the Sadguru's speech. Every verse that Sai Satcharitra tells is Baba's word so he is saying, ' shabd vichari jo chale gurumukh hoi nihaal ' and the one who listens to Guru not mind see Manmukhi means doing devotion according to my will. And Gurmukhi means devotion according the will of the Guru, the will of Sai, the difference of the land and sky. The mind-oriented devotion is very easy. There is no struggle and then added to we resort to what Baba has said ' jaya mani jaisa bhav taya taisa anubhava '. This is our Bramhastra (excuse) However, that mind-oriented devotion is not devotion of the intellect filled with wisdom, it is devotion of the mind. If you know Baba's will and do such devotion, then your intellect has been empowered and your intellect gives birth to a vast form. The devotion that takes place on the basis of the intellect is the devotion to the entirety and the devotion that is taking place on the strength of the mind individualized devotion I tell these two things over and over again. Please understand it very well . so ' shabad vichari jo chale gurumukh hoi nihaal ' Gurumukh means to know Guru's wish and walk accordingly and maanmukhi means to revere according to my will Who are you to tell me, do this, don't do this, such people ask me, yes brother, forgive me, I did not come to you. You came if you do not like it, then you keep going. They straight forwardly ask Who are you? Baba Himself says that 'jaya mani jaisa bhav taya taisa anubhav', there are a million words where His will opens, but you can't see that. Don't want to. You are Shakuni You are Shakuni. You don't even want to know Baba's will, If you consider only one vow' 'jaya mani jaisa bhav taya taisa anubhav' 'jaki rahi bhavana jaisi prabhu murat dekhi tin taisi' Only this much have been said by Goswami Tulsidas. On the contrary, want to suppress the truth. The problem is this. 'shabd vichari jo chale gurumuk hoe nihaal, kaam krodh vyape nahi kabhu na grase kaal' Those who follow the Guru's will for them He does not let the great enemies like lust and anger to enter in their hearts. His intellect is so clear, it is understandable. Lord Rama, after marrying Sita in Mithila, has reached Ayodhya. It's their first night together. Rama is about to enter Sita's chamber, it's night time. Kaikai calls him and says, 'Today is your first night, a very auspicious night.' She has a precious ring and tells Rama to make Sita wear it, saying it's a gift from him. Rama takes it in his hand, smiles, and says, 'Alright, I'll give it.' But as he enters in, he doesn't give the ring to Sita, he keeps it in his pocket. Then he says, 'When I was entering this chamber with Sita, my mother gave me a gem, a ring, as the first offering. On this auspicious moment of our wedding night, I'm not giving you a gift today. In our tradition, my father, my grandfather, and his father, they had multiple marriages, multiple queens. But I promise you, in the temple of my heart, there will never be anyone else besides you. This is Rama. This is wisdom. This is called true intelligence. So, our tradition continues. My father had three marriages and this tradition has been going on for a long time . I'm breaking it today, that's wrong. So I promise you, I promise you that from now on no one will have a place in my heart except you. So, this is the intellect Another example from Ram's life itself . What is good sense? One day prior, the announcement has been made that Rama will be crowned as the king in the morning. King Dasharatha announces, and the entire city gets decorated, for Rama is going to become a righteous king. The entire city is adorned with lights. But Manthara's mind gets corrupted. She goes and instigates Kaikai corrupting her mind as well. She goes to Dasharatha and asks for two wishes, the first wish. Bharat's the coronation, and second, Rama's 14 years of exile. And when Rama gets to know about this, that mother has asked father for these two wishes knowing about it, he shuns the parasol and other kingly servings to him, and he go to Mother Kaushalya's chamber. And Mother Kaushalya has been awake all night, thinking that tomorrow her son will be crowned as the king. So, she chants the name of Lord Vishnu 100,000 times with pouring water over the idol she says, 'I've blessed this water by chanting Vishnu's name all night because my son is going to be crowned as the king tomorrow. So, drink it.' Rama says,\" No mother I am not sitting on the throne.' So, the mother says, 'Why? as Mother Kaikeyi asked father two wishes so according to that i will have to leave for 14 years of exile and my younger brother will be coronated instead So, Mother Kaushalya gets dizzy and falls, and after a while, when she composes herself, she says, 'you said it as if it's something easy that I'm going to be exiled for 14 years. As if it's nothing' So, at that moment, Rama says to Mother Kaushalya, 'No, Mother, this is destined. This is written in my destiny.' I am not suspecting it as anyone's conspiracy. I do not consider mother Kaikeyi guilty in any way. First of all, let me make it clear that this is my destiny. And mother, you people are just seeing that I have been exiled for 14 years, but you are not seeing its other side. First of all, my father's promise to Kaikeyi, that has been fulfilled today, so that means I have fulfilled my father's promise, and second, it's Kaikeyi's wish that I go into exile for 14 years, so I have fulfilled my mother's wish. This is my second good deed. The first one, I could fulfill my father's promise. This is my first good deed. Moreover, keeping mother Kaikeyi's sentiments in mind, I am going into exile. This is my second virtue. And third, My brother like Bharata, is getting the coronation. I would happily grant that to him because he is of higher stature, of high dignity. If my brother is being crowned, then this is my third virtue. . And after going into exile, I will gain enlightenment from the sages and ascetics in those forests. This is my fourth virtue. Mother says, 'You've been blessed from all sides.' So, this is intelligence. But this intelligence must always be kept in the company of good people. If we turn these mere pages, our desires will be fulfilled. There are more people who read it with this intention. I’ll tell you a story based on this topic, please try to understand it well. Once upon a time, a hunter goes into a forest to trap birds, please pay attention as I tell this story. Taking a net and grains he goes into the jungle, to trap the birds. He spreads the net, and throws grains on the net to lure the birds for feeding. All the birds come and sit on the net to eat the grains. And he keeps himself hidden behind a tree, waiting for around 100-150 birds to gather Once he sees them all, he pulls the net and traps them. Then he sells them in the market. This is his business. So one day, a monk was passing through the jungle and he sees this net spread out with grains on it. He thinks that someone might be laying a trap here. So he follows the strings of the net and finds a man sitting behind the tree ready to pull the string soon after all the birds sit on it, and trap them to take them away. Then the monk actually sees that the hunter pulls the net, and all the birds start fluttering inside, the hunter then carries them to the market and sells them. Some people captivate the birds, some eat it, and then the condition of those birds worsen. Now compassion arises in the sage’s heart, that the birds should be awakened, they should be enlightened. So, the sage begins to converse with those birds. He was a realized soul who had arrived there, so he starts conversing with the birds, saying, “You should understand that whenever you see grains in a trap, you shouldn't sit there, because the hunter throws that trap and leaves grains in it and when you go to eat them, you get trapped. So from today onwards, whenever you see grains on the net, don't eat them, remember my words, ‘the hunter will come, he'll lay the trap, he'll put grains, don't get trapped’. I repeat, ‘the hunter will come, he'll lay the trap, he'll put grains, don't get trapped’ .\" Now, all the birds that were there in the forest heard this message. Alright. The sage left, and these birds started to learn this by heart, \"the hunter will come, he'll lay the trap, he'll put grains, don't get trapped. The hunter will come, he'll lay the trap, he'll put grains, don't get trapped.\" Now, all these birds started to memorize this message, and one day the hunter came again, he laid the trap again, he put grains again. And now he's hearing \"the hunter will come, he'll lay the trap, he'll put grains, don't get trapped,\" so he says, \"Oh my, what's this? All the birds in the entire forest are shouting. But who taught them this?\" He becomes a little surprised, he thinks, \"I should just give up now, my business is ruined.\" He feels completely dejected and starts to wonder who came and who taught them this. Now they can’t be trapped, and he keeps thinking and pondering, in the meanwhile he falls asleep. The birds voices are still echoing. As they keep repeating this they catch the sight of the grains.     "Description": "✨Adhyay 3 (Ovi 109-140, 148).✨\nAdhyay 3- The Gateway to Shri Sai Satcharitra, mentions a Leela which describes how Sai Baba stood in defence of the Rohila, despite complaints from the villagers who were disturbed by his loud recitation of Quranic verses at night. Baba not only ignored their objections but also said something even more intriguing—that the Rohila's wife was not of good character, and that she would secretly try to approach Baba, but whenever the Rohila began his recitations, she would grow fearful and retreat. This raises a deeper question: Why did Baba defend the Rohila so strongly, and what deeper truth was he pointing toward through this mysterious statement? \nIn this video Shri Krishnaji unfolds the deeper spiritual aspect of the Leela and answers various questions related to it:\n✨Who is the Rohila's wife, and what did Baba truly mean when He said she was troubling Him?\n✨What are the two greatest weaknesses of human beings, and how can one overcome them?\n✨Why do people commit sins?\n✨Why is it that out of thousands, only a few reach their ultimate destination and realize God in His true form?\n\nThrough this story, Baba shows us how divine remembrance is the key to master our lower tendencies.\n“Remembrance of God is to the heart as water is to a fish; see what happens to a fish when it is taken out of water.”\nWatch this video to explore the spiritual depth behind this Leela and understand Baba’s timeless wisdom in guiding souls beyond the snares of desire.\n🙏🏻Om Sai Ram🙏🏻\n-----------------\n0:00 Introduction\n0:51 Rohila's story\n6:28 Rohila's wife and Antaryami Baba\n10:54 Why do humans sin?\n12:28 Baba or Maya\n16:07 Gateway to Sai Satcharitra and 2 great weaknesses\n17:52 Inhin Logo Ne Le Lina Dupatta Mera: Song\n26:30 Kabir Ji's Doha: Kanak and Kamini\n28:21 Essence of the Leela\n-----------------\n\n✨अध्याय 3 (ओवी 109-140, 148)✨\nअध्याय 3 – श्री साईं सच्चरित्र का प्रवेश द्वार में एक लीला का वर्णन है, जिसमें बताया गया है कि कैसे साईं बाबा ने रोहिला का पक्ष लिया, जबकि गाँव वाले उसके रात में ज़ोर से कुरान की आयतें पढ़ने की शिकायत कर रहे थे। बाबा ने न केवल उनकी शिकायतों की उपेक्षा की, बल्कि उससे भी अधिक रहस्यमयी बात कही — कि रोहिला की पत्नी कोई अच्छी स्त्री नहीं है, वह छिपकर बाबा के पास आने की कोशिश करती है, लेकिन जब रोहिला कुरान का पाठ आरंभ करता है, तो वह डरकर वापस लौट जाती है।\nयह लीला एक गहन प्रश्न को जन्म देती है: आख़िर बाबा ने रोहिला का इतनी दृढ़ता से पक्ष क्यों लिया? और बाबा अपने इस रहस्यपूर्ण कथन के माध्यम से कौन-सी गहरी आध्यात्मिक सच्चाई उजागर कर रहे थे?\nइस वीडियो में श्री कृष्णाजी इस लीला के गहरे आध्यात्मिक पक्ष को उजागर करते हैं और इससे जुड़े कई महत्वपूर्ण प्रश्नों के उत्तर देते हैं:\n✨रोहिला की पत्नी वास्तव में कौन है, और जब बाबा कहते हैं कि वह उन्हें तंग करती है, तो उसका क्या गूढ़ अर्थ है?\n✨मनुष्य की दो सबसे बड़ी कमजोरियाँ कौन-सी हैं, और उनसे कैसे मुक्ति पाई जा सकती है?\n✨लोग पाप क्यों करते हैं?\n✨हज़ारों में से केवल कुछ ही लोग अपने परम लक्ष्य तक पहुँचकर ईश्वर को उनके वास्तविक स्वरूप में क्यों जान पाते हैं?\n\nइस कथा के माध्यम से बाबा यह दर्शाते हैं कि ईश्वर का स्मरण ही वह कुंजी है जिससे हम अपनी नीच प्रवृत्तियों पर विजय प्राप्त कर सकते हैं।\n“बस यही है साई की बंदगी, भूलू तो मौत स्मरु तो जिंदगी। “\nइस वीडियो को देखें और इस गूढ़ लीला के आध्यात्मिक गहराई में उतरें, तथा जानें कि कैसे साईं बाबा अपनी अमूल्य वाणी और कृपा से जीवों को काम-वासना जैसी ग्रंथियों से मुक्त कर मोक्ष की ओर ले जाते हैं।\n🙏🏻ॐ साई राम🙏🏻\n\n#saileelarahasya  #saibaba  #miraclesofsaibaba  #spiritualstories  #saileela  #spiritualism #krishnaji #divineremembrance  #kaamvasana #overcomingdesire #spiritualwisdom  #gurukripa  #krishnajionrohila #saisatcharitraleelas #jaisai #shirdisai #saiamritvachan #saiamritvani #corespirituality #trending #explore #saidarshan\n\n\nReference:\nInhin Logon Ne Lina Dupatta Mera - \n   • Inhin Logon Ne Lina Dupatta Mera | Pakeeza...   …...more\n...more\nShow less",

    "Transcript": "Without going through Patience (Saburi) Original Faith (Shraddha) cannot come in your life. If Baba has done something as per our wish and because of that we are doing Baba, Baba…and on that basis I am doing all the four aartis. I do pujas, I am offering food, I am doing this and that, whatever you are doing if behind that there is Duplicate Faith (Shraddha) then your actual journey has not even begun. Today’s topic is Faith (Shraddha) and Patience (Saburi). It is a very important topic because in this world there will be no such temple where these two words have not been written. Baba has what we say Spiritual treasure, he has put in these two words. Faith (Shraddha) and Patience (Saburi). These two words Baba has selected in such a way that it applies to every religion be it Christianity, Faith (Shraddha) and Patience (Saburi) are required. It may be Islam Faith (Shraddha) and Patience (Saburi) are required. It may be Sikhism, Jainism, whatever ‘ism’ it may be. It could be any religion in the world, without these two words no religion can breathe. In reality Baba has not given these two words Faith (Shraddha) and Patience (Saburi) to Hindu religion only. In fact, it is the life of all the religions of the world. It is the energy of all the religions. The spirituality of all the religions breathes because of these two words. If you remove these two words then there remains no religion. If you remove these two words from all the religions of the world, Faith (Shraddha) and Patience (Saburi), then no religion will thrive, will not survive. They will no longer exist. They are these two words. Today we will deeply decipher the importance of these two words, what Baba wanted to convey through these two words to the entire world and not only to the Hindus. What was he trying to tell all the religions of the world. One is Master of all is One (Sabka Malik Ek hai), this basic mantra of Baba is for the entire world Baba’s mantra Master of all is One (Sabka Malik Ek hai) is for the entire world, for all the religions similarly these words Faith (Shraddha) and Patience (Saburi) are the second basic mantra for all the religions. Firstly, we will talk about normal faith (Shraddha). What is normal faith (Shraddha)? It means having faith in God. How is faith in God? In a normal person’s life, towards Baba or any god or goddesses, if faith develops then how does it develop? That God, Goddess, Sadguru if they are in our life, as per our wish, if they fulfill our wish, , If Baba has performed some miracle in our life, if he has taken us out of some problem, if our wish has been fulfilled then we develop faith towards Baba. Then we start saying Baba, Baba… and we think that to be our faith. Earlier I did not have much faith on Baba but today If I am doing Baba, Baba… I sing Baba’s hymns, kirtans, attend all the venerations and so I am Baba’s devotee. We give ourselves a certificate that I am Sai’s devotee. Do you know that this faith which is born because of fulfillment of wish, because you have come out of your troubles it has arisen, is it original shraddha? If some day Baba does not fulfill your wish, if he does not give any solution to your problem, if because of your wishes you do Baba, Baba, if tomorrow your wishes are not fulfilled then the intoxication of the devotion also will go away. Isn’t it simple? If that trust, if that faith, that devotion is rising from fulfillment of wishes then it is obvious that if Baba does not fulfill your wishes, if Baba does not pull you out of your troubles, then your faith will tremble. This happens with 99.99% people. That is why I say that this is duplicate faith. This is not original faith. This is fake faith. How can you say that? I do all the 4 aartis. I go to Shirdi 10 times a year. I read Sai Satcharitra. I do Bhajans, I do kirtans and you say I have no faith? This is not fair Krishnaji. This is crime Krishnaji. No this is not faith. Going ahead I say that this is false faith. This is because this faith is borrowed. Baba has given this faith in alms. because He has fulfilled our wishes, He has taken us out from our troubles, He has taken us out of our problems that is why I have faith. If the reason of my faith are these three reasons, then that is duplicate faith. It is not original faith. First let us clarify this, what is duplicate faith and what is original faith. After my saying this ask yourself this question whether your faith is duplicate or original. You need not ask this to anyone. Your inner self will give you the answer. It may say yes that my faith is duplicate or those who actually love Baba may there be storm or cyclone or there may be series of problems, there may be years of struggles with troubles, even if faith in Baba does not reduce but keeps on increasing day by day that is true faith. If you see Adhyay 19 of Sai Satcharitra where there is description of Faith (Shraddha) and Patience (Saburi), Baba has very nicely said while describing Faith (Shraddha) and Patience (Saburi) has explained Patience (Saburi) first and then he comes to Faith (Shraddha). If you see the original Sai Satcharitra, I am not talking about Hindi one because the Hindi one is not even 40%, there are only leelas. The Vedantic things and the depth of the Shastras they have not included it in the Hindi Sai Satcharitra which is small. I am speaking about the original Marathi book. In this Adhyay 19 Baba first speaks about Patience (Saburi) and then comes to Faith (Shraddha). Why is it so? Because Baba knows that original Faith (Shraddha) takes birth from the womb of Patience (Saburi). Original faith after passing through Patience (Saburi) it takes birth within a person and that is original Faith (Shraddha) Patience is of two types. If I ask a question to the people sitting here what is the meaning of Patience (Saburi) then 99.99% will reply that whatever maybe the troubles our Faith (Shraddha) should not be shaken that is Patience (Saburi). They will give this answer. But there is one more thing higher than this. In problems, troubles, dilemma, issues that Faith which sustains, that Patience which you are able to sustain that is the original Patience (Saburi). But this Patience (Saburi) is not tested only in troubles and sorrows but when there is prosperity in life, when you are comfortable in every aspect of life, there are no health issues or mental troubles or financial troubles you are fulfilled in every aspect, in such times your Patience (Saburi) is tested. Rather I would say that the test Baba conducts in troubles and sorrows is more tough than the ones he conducts in comfortable times. Because when the luxuries and comforts come into your life much more than required then it compels the person to be off the ground. Your feet are no longer on the ground. He tests Patience (Saburi) this way by giving luxuries and comforts to see if the person is now flying high, full of ego, full of pride. This is one of the ways of testing, there also Patience (Saburi) is tested. We feel that only in sorrow and troubles Patience (Saburi) is tested, no, but even in comforts and luxuries also Patience is tested. Whether this person is able to digest success, how he is able to digest name and fame, whether he will lift himself off the ground after getting so much happiness and success and that is the biggest test. . It is even higher than problems and troubles. If after getting so much comfort, happiness, abundance you remain grounded, if your feet are still on the ground, if you have no ego, if you have no pride, if you are not a victim of pride, if your politeness remains then understand that you have original Patience (Saburi) in your life. I will repeat the sentence again if there is any road to reach the original Faith (Shraddha) from Duplicate Faith (Shraddha) then that is Patience Baba throws so many stones and pebbles in our life and test the one who was doing Baba, Baba for past so many years, when things were good now let us increase the troubles in this person’s life and in spite of this will he be able to embrace the troubles. In spite of this will his devotion remain pure. I will take some verses from Sai Satcharitra in Adhyay 29 which confirms this. I will take this is Marathi because the Hindi one may not have these verses. In Adhyay 29 Verses 125, 126, 127 I will read this in Marathi first and then I will translate it. Verse 125 – Chalu jata kathilya vatey, Arambhi Arambhi Goad Vate, Pude aise pasartil sarate, kathech kathe chohikade. What does this verse mean? When Baba shows the spiritual path, when we start walking the path, when our journey begins. When we start the journey, in the beginning we feel good, we feel nice and everything is going on perfectly, nothing is going wrong Chalu jata kathilya vatey, Arambhi Arambhi Goad Vate – so everything feels good initially. Pude aise pasartil sarate, kathech kathe chohikade – later on Baba weaves a net of thorns, then on all sides only thorns are seen, only stones are seen, then there remain no comforts in life and this Baba says himself, Sai Satcharitra means Baba. I have proved this many times. Aise pasartil sarate, kathech kathe chohikade – means wherever you see, you see only thorns. Verse 126 Mag tya nisthes phutatil phate, Sahaj mani sanshey date, Kimarth Sai ya Advate, Ani he vate manala. That faith that was there, that duplicate faith that was there because of some favor done by Baba, Baba obliged me in life due to which my faith deepened, that faith starts shaking and there are many outlets now. It does not remain steady it breaks out into many outlets, it starts shaking. Mag tya nisthes phutatil phate, Sahaj mani sanshey date – and then there is a doubt created in the mind that where is Baba taking me on this wrong path. Has Baba changed? Is he the same Baba whom I have been worshiping for years? Is it the same Baba? Sahaj mani sanshey date – and he further says Kimarth Sai ya Advate, Ani he vate manala – and then the mind feels where is Baba taking me on the wrong road. The meaning is simple. It means that when troubles in life increases Faith (Shraddha) starts shaking. Then further Baba gives answer to this also. When the state of mind is such what should one do? Whenever mind is suspicious and think where is Baba taking me on the wrong path, when such suspicion comes to mind, he says Pari he aise jethe vate, tetech Shraddha dhara nete – and he says at that time hold on to faith tightly. He further says Kasotich he pratyash sankate, tenech paithe drudh shraddha – and the thorns that I have spread they are test and by passing through these tests you will be able to reach original Faith (Shraddha). Further ahead he says in a verse that I was the one who laid the thorns of these troubles, it was not anyone else. Om Sai Ram. The evidence that these thorns are laid by Sai himself is given in the 129th verse of same 29th chapter. this is the objective of these thorns(difficulties), they too are laid by Sai himself only then true remembrance of Sai takes place and all difficulties are overcome And I laid these troubles so that your duplicate shraddha converts to original. These three verses you read carefully and you will understand that the original Faith (Shraddha) takes birth from the womb of Patience (Saburi). Without going through Patience (Saburi) Original Faith (Shraddha) cannot come in your life. If Baba has done something as per our wish and because of that we are doing Baba, Baba…and on that basis I am doing all the three aartis. I do pujas, I am offering food, I am doing this and that, whatever you are doing if behind that there is Duplicate Faith (Shraddha) then your actual journey has not even begun. I say bitter words and I am infamous for the same and not many can be with me. But those who are honest, even if he is sitting in Nigeria jungle, he may not be even knowing Baba, Baba will also bring him to his court and make him sit down but he only has to be honest. In Reality when prosperity comes in life, there is abundance, everything is fine in such times if you are able to sustain Faith (Shraddha) and Patience (Saburi) only then in your sorrow and pain will you be able to sustain Faith (Shraddha) and Patience (Saburi). The seed of that is in prosperity, if you did not pay any attention in comfort and convenience, that this is a phase and this is also not the truth, if this has come then this too will go so don’t give much importance to this. If you do not let it go to your head, you did not pay heed to it, if you do not become egoistic, it means that you endured it, if your legs are firmly on the ground then you have endured that phase and if you have endured that phase then you will also endure pain and sorrow phase. So, the seed of phase of sorrow and pain is hidden in comforts and luxuries. If the door is closed, if there is no hope of any air coming from outside then in that closed door you can keep the lamp lit nicely without it going out. This is duplicate Faith (Shraddha). But if in the stormy waters your lamp remains lit that is original Shraddha. But for that original Faith (Shraddha) you should have the strength to endure in stormy winds. You must have the strength to sustain that Faith in that time. In closed room you have kept your lamp lit then it is nothing great. This story is from Adhyay 23 of Kaka Saheb Dixit. This story says that Baba wanted to test Kaka Saheb because when Kaka Saheb Dixit was with Baba, first time when Nana Saheb Chandorker tells Kaka Saheb Dixit about Baba and says that you are now handicapped, my Guru is so powerful that if you take his Darshan once then this handicap of yours will be no more and I am confident about that. This is what Nana Saheb Chandorker says to Kaka Saheb Dixit. In turn see what Kaka Saheb Dixit answers. Kaka Saheb Dixit is such a person, he says that if your Guru can really heal a handicapped person then tell your Guru that the handicap of my leg does not disturb me, the disability of my mind troubles. If your Guru is truly capable then tell him to remove the disability of my mind. This is Kaka Saheb Dixit. That Kaka Saheb Dixit is such a person of integrity, this Kaka Saheb Dixit is now being tested. Baba at first tells Shama that today I want to slaughter a goat go and get a knife. If you are asking for a knife for this work, will you give it. This person had gone with a very innocent mind who know maybe like Kaka Saheb Dixit he would have innocently agreed. But as soon as Radhakrishna Mai takes the knife back from him even Madhavrao Deshpandes’s integrity was shaken. He is a Muslim fakir; it is a very common thing to slaughter. Baba tells Bade Baba you go and get the knife and slaughter. Bade Baba ask why cut it? See the wording. Born in a Brahmin family, non-violence is his religion, in his life he has never eaten flesh and meat or drunk any liquor. He got such a goat so even if take time to say stop then if such a goat is cut whose time to die is near… Baba takes so much precaution. Please understand this Leela carefully. There is no one in this world who is more for non-violence than Baba. If I take time to say stop and in the mean time the knife cuts the goat even then it would not matter because it was time for it to die. He chose so very minutely. So much precaution has to be taken before doing the Leela this Adhyay tells us that. The Goat was about to die, it was near its death and it died. When Baba is asking Kaka Saheb Dixit that did you not feel ashamed to kill a dumb animal. In Islam Bakri Id which is celebrated every year and crores of goats are slaughtered on that day unnecessarily, I will tell you the secret behind it. What is the deep meaning of Bakri Id. Why is Bakri Id celebrated? There was a Saint by the name of Ibrahim and he had forgotten himself in the worship of God. One day just as Kaka Saheb Dixit was tested similarly God felt that this person needs to be tested. One day God visits him in the dream and says today I want a sacrifice. So, he thought that Allah wants that he should slaughter the Camel. Give the sacrifice in the name of Allah. So next day he goes to the market to get a Camel. But at night again Allah visits him in dream and says Ibrahim did I tell you to get Camel for slaughtering. Then he asked what should I slaughter? God Says that I want sacrifice of your only child. See how big the test is. In this world the biggest center of attachment is our child. If required we will give up on our life but it is every parent’s wish that the child lives long. And a father is been told that your only child who is 8 years old should be sacrificed in my name. This is the sacrifice. The child is made to wear new dress, fragrance is applied after bath and he is taken to the place where the sacrifice is to be made. When he looks at the child, he has tears in his eyes and turning the face towards the Lord he says a prayer and say Lord there is a request. I will give the sacrifice but can I blindfold my eyes. Lord says okay do it there is no problem in that. Sacrifice is important whether you do it with open or closed eyes what does it matter. He closes his eyes and the child’s head is kept. He looks towards the Lord who says kill him, so he raises his weapon and hits. The body separates from the head. After this he keeps his weapon and unties the blindfold, he sees that it is not his child’s head which is cut but a goat has his body separated from the head. It means at the last moment Lords shifts place instead of child he puts the goat. So, what this Leela says. First, he saw Ibrahim’s faith, can he sacrifice anything in this world. Can he sacrifice that which is very close to him, that which he loves too much. Lord wanted to test this so he tested and Ibrahim passed with 100% marks. But see the Lord’s compassion and that is why he is called Rahim, Rehman, Karim. At the end moment he did not let his son die and he put a goat in its place and the goat was slaughtered. And today Islam with feeling that Allah loves sacrifice, this feeling of sacrifice should endlessly live in our life we will celebrate Bakri Id every year. Understand the story well.     "Title": "गुरु आज्ञा न मानने का दुष्परिणाम",

    "Transcript": "If you look at this deeply the vata disease has a very deep connection with the intellect of a person. It is said that only such a person suffers from Vata disease who has played games with his intellect. He has misused it. To know the wish of Guru and conduct according to it is real devotion of Guru Om Sai Ram. In Adhyay 22 of Sai Satcharitra there is a story of Amir Shakkar. Shri Amir Shakkar, a resident of Bandra had brokerage business due to which he was well off. But he had arthritis, joint pains. He took many treatments but it did not help him. Finally, he came to Saibaba’s feet and explained his agony to Baba. Baba advised him to stay in Chavadi and ordered him that henceforth he need not come to Dwarakamai for Darshan. As per Baba’s wish Shri Amir Shakkar started staying in Chavadi. But Chavadi’s state was so bad that even a healthy person would not stay for even a day. And Amirji was troubled with the joint pains. In that state it was difficult for him also to stay there. Even then he stayed there for a few months but the state that the Chavadi was in, even his patience reached its limits and he decided to go home before 9 months were over. One day he leaves Chavadi and on the way he spends a night in an inn. There was an old fakir who was gaping due to thirst. Out of compassion Amirji gave him water to drink. But at the very next moment the old fakir dies Seeing this Amir got scared. And he took the path to Shirdi. Then, here a question arises. It is a good deed to offer water to drink, then what leela did Baba do with Amirji and we will throw light on this aspect today. Om Sai Ram. Adhyay 22 – Amir Shakkar. Amir’s Shakkar’s Leela is a reverse leela. If we see the whole Adhyay 22, then it is known for avoiding devotee’s misfortune. The whole Adhyay has leelas describing this. But Amir Shakkar’s Leela is exact opposite of other leelas. This leela is about Sadguru’s words ‘Kartum, akartum, anyatha kartum. The doings of Sadguru are sometimes opposite. Every time every action will not bear same fruits. Sometimes it yields opposite results. This is one such leela anyatha kartum. Amir is suffering from arthritis. There are different types of arthritis. Medical science knows of this. There is one type of arthritis which is known as auto immune disease. Auto immune disease is when one part of the body starts fighting another part of our body. They clash against each other and in this way a person becomes weaker by the day because our own one part of the body starts fighting another part of the body. Due to this our immunity decreases and sometimes a person may die. This is auto immune disease. Amir Shakkar was suffering from this disease. Amir Shakkar was very rich and he stayed in Bandra and was slaughterer by profession and there was no dearth of money. Different treatments were done but there were zero results and he was not healed. He did not get well. At the end listening to Baba’s fame, he goes Shirdi to Baba. He goes to Shirdi and takes baba’s darshan. Baba gives him Darshan but he says that your cure is only one that you stay in Chavadi for 9 months. Till such time you will not come for my darshan also. This was Baba’s cure that for nine months stay at Chavadi. He does not give any medicines or any antidote, only he has to stay for 9 month and that is your medicine. First, he does not understand with such a small treatment how his work will be done? He has so much faith in Baba so he also has this faith and he goes and stays in Chavadi. The moment he goes there and starts staying there then he understands what Chavadi is. Chavadi has been so beautifully described in Sai Satcharitra in Adhyay 22 and every person should read it from the heart it is so beautifully expounded upon. It is said that Chavadi was not fit for even an animal to stay. And in that Chavadi a person is sent as though for life imprisonment. You have to stay there for 9 months. Describing the Chavadi Hemadpantji says. In that Chavadi there were snake, scorpion, frogs and it was house for them in a way and there were so many potholes and all the walls used to be moist, there was no roof. In a way it was a painful imprisonment and Amir Shakkar stay there for 9 months and that is your cure is what Baba said. In the beginning he makes up his mind and stays there and after some time his mind gets restless. He was asked to stay there for 9 months but after some time his mind becomes restless. What is there here? Already I am suffering at physical level. Because those who are suffering from vata dosha, the moisture on the wall, the dampness, all these things will increase the disease disease and the wetness of the floor and does anyone like that? And don’t know how many such things plays in the mind of Amir Shakkar and somewhere his courage and patience breaks. And before 9 months he makes up his mind now enough is enough I stayed here for as many months as I could, now I can’t do this anymore. So, without telling one night he leaves from there and after going to Kopargao I will take a train to Mumbai. With such thought he leaves in the night. He does not tell anyone. Since he was going to take the train in the morning in Kopergao then where to spend the night? Then so as there was no other alternative, he goes to an inn in Kopergao. That somehow, I will spend the night here then in the morning I will wake up and take the train and go to Bandra Mumbai. So, the inn to which he goes at night to stay, there is a Fakir there who is very thirsty. And he asks water from Amir Shakkar. Thinking that it is a pious deed he gives him a glass of water. The moment he drinks it, he dies. The moment he dies he goes haywire. What is this? I gave him water out of compassion. It is said that water is life but for him it became the reason for his death. He gets scared. What to do now? Tomorrow morning when the Sun rises and people will come and see this, they will think that I killed him. That I am a murderer. Then out of fear he makes up his mind and I have to leave from here as soon as possible. I should go back from where I came. He leaves from there quietly and reaches Chavadi before Sun rise. This is the Leela of Adhyay 22 of Amir Shakkar. The question is Baba made him stay in an extreme state in Chavadi and why did he ask him to stay in Chavadi for 9 months? If you look at this deeply the vata disease has a very deep connection with the intellect of a person. It is said that only such a person suffers from Vata disease who has played games with his intellect. He has misused it. Intelligence is not given to animals it is given only to humans by God so that he makes good use of it. So that he reaches newer heights. So that he touches the states which are beyond this body that is why intelligence is given. He makes good use of that intelligence. God has given intelligence to reach the soul and paramatma. But if the same intelligence is misused, but if we use it for our own benefit and play with other people’s life then vata disease knocks on the life of such people it is said. That is why it is called auto immune disease. Because you kept playing with the world on the strength of your intellect you had forgotten that the world is part of you so whatever wrongs you have done to them has come back to you and so one part of your own body is fighting with the other part and that is why you are suffering from vata disease. Till such time you do not spend 9 months in such extreme conditions, like how a child wriggles in a womb, he eats what the mother eats, sour, salty, everything the child endures for 9 months it is said. Similarly, you also in these extreme conditions. Definitely the environment is averse to your disease in Chavadi. The dampness, the chill will give you many types of troubles but inspite of this you have to spend 9 months here because your deeds are such. Because you have misused your intelligence that is why you have to spend 9 months here. If baba disciplined anybody, if he said something to somebody then there use to be lot of depth to it. He will not say without reason. His deeds were such and he was also a slaughterer. So, if he is a slaughterer and it is my work to chop goats but if I did it as my profession but I have not even a little bit of compassion for the goats, that they too have life and they also must be suffering. If there is not even a trace of such emotions then I am not worthy of being called a human. This story has many dimensions. That is why Baba is charging him heavily. That is why you will stay for 9 months here only. And that is your cure. He shows faith for some months the moment his faith waivers he leaves. The question you asked now that giving water to drink to a fakir is an act of merit but how the opposite happened? If you want to understand the answer deeply then Baba only wants to say here is if you disobey Guru’s orders, you can go to any part of the world and perform meritorious acts the results will be horrendous. This is the biggest lesson he gives us through this leela. Disobeying Guru’s order I can go anywhere in the world, I may do good deeds in the world the result will be opposite. But at the same time obeying the Guru’s order you commit bad crimes, the exact opposite comes in Adhyay 23, he is asking to cut the goat, he Leela of Kakasaheb Dixit, there he asks to commit a grave crime but there is no bigger pious act than this because these are Guru’s order. And disobeying Guru’s order you give life to a person then you will be the reason for death. This Leela is the best way to tell the importance of Guru’s orders. If Baba is telling him to stay in that terrible Chavadi than the reason behind it is also very deep. Because the karmas behind this is such. So, the cure is also so serious. And here after doing such a pious act he invites such a big trouble on his head, the reason behind this is only disobeying guru’s orders. There is Kabirji’s doha on this and if I don’t take it then this will be incomplete. So, I will take up that doha. He says Raja ki chori kare, rahe ranka ki oat. You have to understand this carefully. Raja ki chori kare, rahe ranka ki oat, Kahe Kabir kyu ubhare, kaal kathin ki chot. So here Kabirji says, here I will clear the meaning raja ki chori kare. Say there is a person and he steals a valuable from king’s house, rahe ranka ki oat and he goes and hides himself at a poor man’s place. He is in King’s city, he has stolen from King’s house and there is a person who is a beggar and takes shelter in his house saying save me because I have committed such a big theft, I have stolen a valuable thing, will he be saved? It is not possible. Because it is king’s city. Then Kabirji says Kahe Kabir kyu ubhare, kaal kathin ki chot. Such people how can they be saved the time is there to hit hard. The way it is present in the universe he is present there also wherever you go. Here theft in King’s house means if I turn my face away from Guru’s order, instead of facing the Guru I turn my face away from the Guru, if I have averted my eyes from him and even if I take shelter in a poor man’s house, I am not going to rise there then death will knock on the door. The point I make here is If I disobey Guru, I may go to any corner of the universe there is only doom and doom for me. So, Amir Shakkar’s leela is all about this. one which apprehends mind, overcomes bane and calamities, annihilates ignorance, bestows deliverance, the ultimate source of welfare, truth awareness and bliss giver mother of sai, direct form of sai, diadem of all scriptures, glory to shree sai satcharitra divine granth",
