    "Transcript": "We never talk about the ignorance in which we are trapped 24 hours, we are not even worried about it. But we are trapped in the imaginary words like soul, divine, universal bliss, knowledge of the universe, release, liberation. Om Sai Ram. Adhyay 39 of Sai Satcharitra is about Shloka 34 of Chapter 4 of Bhagwat Gita on Gyan, karma, Sanyas. Tat viddhi pranipātena paripraśhnena sevayā, upadekṣhyanti te jñānaṁ jñāninas tattva-darśhinaḥ. The story goes like this. One of Baba’s supreme devotee Shree Nanasaheb Chandorkar was pressing Baba’s feet in Masjid and was speaking something softly. So, Baba asked “Nana in such soft voice what are you speaking? Speak a little louder so that even I can listen. On Baba’s command he told the entire verse Tat viddhi pranipātena to Baba. Baba asked Nanasaheb the meaning of the Shloka. Nanasaheb humbly explained the meaning of the Shloka. If you ask a knowledgeable person humbly and respectfully any question, then they preach knowledge. In the beginning Baba accepted the meaning as told by Nanasaheb. But Baba said \"Nana, in the shloka where word knowledge is used, before that word there is a sigmoid and the word knowledge looks like ignorance (agyan) and if we use ignorance in its place then what will be the meaning. Listening to Baba, Nanasaheb was confused and thought why would a knowledgeable person preach ignorance. Friends we are living in the 21st century today where everyone is talking about knowledge and positive thinking. But through this Shloka Baba is preaching about ignorance. In this era also how this discourse is useful, we will throw light on this in this episode. Om Sai Ram. Adhyay 39 in a way is a revolutionary Adhyay of Sai Satcharitra. Because before writing this Adhyay or before Baba did this Leela, all the Saints before that, all those who have written commentaries everyone have applied the same meaning that they preach knowledge that too after surrendering with pure heart, after paying obeisance with pure heart, asking question with pure heart. Pure heart means without any pretence. Keeping in mind that the person in front of me is much better than me, surrendering yourself, out of curiosity and desire to know, keeping aside logic and argument, question which is asked with faith is pariprashna. To reach that Pariprashna you have to go through service. These are the conditions laid down. You have the right to ask question only if you do service. And after that Guru gives discourse on Knowledge is what the commentators, Saints, before Baba all those who have given commentary on the Shloka have said that they preach knowledge. And if you see it is the first time that Baba says there is a silent ‘A’ which is hidden. I have not created it. That sigmoid is there, those who know grammar well know that the sigmoid is hidden. If we accept that hidden ‘A’ then it will be preaching ignorance (Agyan). Baba says where is the harm in that. If we think that they give discourse on ignorance (agyan) then what is the harm in that. Baba Says that, in fact all the Shastras accept that soul is self-existent. It was always that, is and will be that. No one can create it nor destroy it. The soul is self-existent. It was there since time immemorial and will remain so till time immemorial. On the contrary the world is super imposed on it. It is the covering of the soul. The thing that was never made how will it be destroyed. It has always been there. Only that the world, this brahmand has been super imposed on it. Baba wanted to say that if you put the sigmoid and you remove the covering then knowledge is self-evident self-existent. In reality the ignorance has covered knowledge. Knowledge is not been created. Knowledge is not been invented. Soul cannot be invented. Nor can Brahma be created. And if is created then it will be destroyed also. That is why Baba wanted to say that there is covering of ignorance (agyan) on it. You just need to remove it. Knowledge (Gyan) is self-existent, self-illuminating. No one can stop that light. You just have to remove the covering. It has its own light; it cannot be created. Baba wanted to say this. The twinkling stars are infinite spreading light like fireflies, but there is only one Sun that pierces the darkness of the night and illuminates the whole world. Similarly, there are crores of people who indulge in and give the joy of discussion of knowledge, but there is only one such devotee who eradicates his own darkness, his own ignorance. But if you see minutely then this ignorance, first of all a true Sadguru is the one who can show the disciple his own ignorance, make him aware of his ignorance, not only show him but also is capable of awakening his yearning. If any Sadguru has these two qualities, who can make the disciple aware of his ignorance and secondly create such deep yearning about the ignorance such that he will not get peace till he comes out of this ignorance. If any Sadguru has these two capabilities, if anyone can do these two things then he is a true Sadguru. This is Baba’s perspective. Just as knowledge is self-existent, similarly ignorance is from time immemorial. It also has its tradition. Because we are always indulging in our wants and desires. We are engrossed in our vices 24 hours a day. There is not a moment where we are not covered with ignorance, we are not full with this ignorance. 24 hours we are trapped in our desires; 24 hours we are trapped in our vices. We never talk about the ignorance in which we are trapped 24 hours, we are not even worried about it. But we are trapped in the imaginary words like soul, divine, universal bliss, knowledge of the universe, release, liberation. For us presently all this is imaginary because we have no experience of it but we always discuss about it. But 24 hours the ignorance that is troubling us, the ignorance which we indulge in 24 hours, this ignorance has become like our breath, we never talk about it. But we talk a lot about the imaginary knowledge. So, Baba wanted to sneer at it. He wanted to tell that 24 hours that you indulge in the ignorance, let us talk about that. Why should we talk about imaginary knowledge. And it is the way of the world, the one who has more informative knowledge, is a bigger Guru. The one who has more information, the one who knows more, bigger is he as a Guru. World also sees them that way and they also feel that they have more information than others. Then I am bigger Guru than you. But we are unable to differentiate that informative knowledge is different and educative experience is different. A good person will never be worried about how much information he has. He will look within and see how ignorant he is and he will be agonized by it. I collected so much information, I know so much, read so many shastras, I read so many Vedas, I have become so knowledgeable, he will not take pride in it. If he is a good person he will see his ignorance, I am trapped in these things 24 hours, I am trapped in wants and desires, I am trapped in vices, trapped in ego, trapped in pride. Baba only wanted to say that the information you collect, ignorance will not be destroyed by that, on the contrary you will increase ignorance. It is very deep. Guru is the one who makes the disciple aware of his ignorance, create a yearning within and when he will be out of it. And a good disciple is one who will not take pride in informative knowledge but will worry about the ignorance within him. These are the two things. Otherwise, what will happen is we will fill ourselves with informative knowledge and the pride will increase. We can never be humble; we will never have the strength to look within. Because the garbage that we are collecting of information, we will take pride in that and again and again, say if someone gives some information you will say I have more information than him. Then we will always take pride in that. We will continue to increase ego. It is natural. It will further increase ignorance. Baba had really understood this. How the whole world is trapped in this knowledge. Then why not have that sigmoid, that silent ‘A’ which is already there and is not been created why not take help from that and Baba created such a big thing. That is why in this Adhyay when Baba tells all this to Nanasaheb Chandorkar, after listening to all this there is a prayer which comes from Nanasaheb Chandorkar which is so touching and has come from his heart and I will take up that prayer here. From the same Adhyay (Adhyay 39) Verse 101 to 104. He speaks about himself here and that is what is special about Nana Saheb Chandorkar. Satvikteche haus varivari, Vikalap date antari, Apman sohna shanbhari, agyan te tari kay duje. (Verse 101) Poti pratisthechi ujari, dhyanvirbhav davi kari, Kamkrodh dhumase bhitari, agyan te tari kay duje. (Verse 102) Atuni sakal karme nasht, baher mirvu brahmisht, Acharhin vicharbrasht, agyan spast kay duje. (Verse 103) Baba apan krupaghan, karoniya krupajalshinchan, kara ha agyandavanal shaman, hoin me dhanya itukeni. (Verse 104) Till such time a person does not live these lines, he does not experience it, when this prayer does not arise with tears in the eyes, till such time the fire of ignorance will not die, Baba will not shower his Grace. Ignorance cannot be eradicated with informative knowledge. If you look within attentively, we have this itch of spirituality, to be very honest. We enjoy talking about spirituality, we enjoy listening about spirituality, we love to read about spirituality and we love to discuss about spirituality with other people. But we do not enjoy looking at the ignorance, looking at and understanding one’s own ignorance, to shed tears for that and pray, we have no interest in doing that. But we really enjoy the spirituality itch. We enjoy that. Spirituality has become our favourite subject. We enjoy discussing it, we enjoy talking about it with each other, we enjoy reading, we enjoy listening but we do not have the strength to eradicate ignorance. Baba probably understood all this. It is not only in Adhyay 39, Baba felt that whatever he has spoken is less and he has spent one more Adhyay on this, Adhyay 50, only to show our ignorance. He felt that this is a very important subject and it should reach the heart of every person. That is why he has composed this and has spent 2 Adhyay on this only to tell us how deeply we are immersed in ignorance. And all these talks about knowledge that we do, with this the fire of ignorance will not die is what Baba says. Krishnaji, i had a question for you, if i look at my ignorance every time then will my stream of thoughts become negative? and what about the optimistic outlook that world talks about? This is a very good question. First of all, let us understand positive thinking and negative thinking. Positive thinking does not mean that you change the basic principle. For e.g. I keep poison in my hand and I think positively saying that this is nectar will it stop killing people. It will not change its basic properties. What is the meaning of positive thinking? If on an intellectual level there are differences and is moving towards negative thinking, unnecessarily we have taken on this negative thinking, definitely you have to think positively there. But if at the roots there is negativity, garbage, ignorance how can you eradicate that with positive thinking. That is impossible. What does Baba want to say here? I would like to clear it with an example. Say there are two ill persons, both have cancer. Both go to a doctor. Doctor makes a mistake. He forgets to tell a person that he has cancer and he gives some medicines. He tells him to take the medicines regularly every morning, afternoon and evening. To the other person he tells him that he has 2nd stage cancer. He tells him of his disease, tells him of his ignorance and then he prescribes the medicines asking him to take them in the morning, afternoon and evening, who will take the medicines more diligently, you tell me? The one who knows the disease or the one who does not know of his disease? The one who knows will take it more diligently. It is all about this. The one who becomes aware of his ignorance he will take the medicines of karma Yog, Bhakti Yog, these are the medicines. Dhyan Yog, Gyan Yog. All the yogs that are there he will take the medicine with lot of faith and will do all the yogs every moment with awareness. He will follow his purpose, he will do sadhanas, with lot of awareness and lot of passion. The one who is not aware of his disease he may or may not take medicines, we can’t say. If the Doctor scares him that if he does not take medicines then he will die then he will take it with so much faith. He makes him aware of his ignorance that he is in 2nd stage. We should understand it this way.     "Transcript": "The devotee who aspires for renunciation(detachment) in their life should repeatedly read this chapter, the fifth chapter, which leads to attainment of renunciation. Om Sairam! In the fifth chapter of Shri Sai Satcharitra, there is a wonderful leela where Baba daily took two raw clay pots from Vaman Tatyaji. He would fill these pots with water and irrigate the garden. At night, the pots were left under neem tree, and by morning, they would burst, transforming into clay that merged with the earth. This ritual continued for three years and Once Vaman Tatyaji questioned baba why he preferred raw pots when he(vaman tatya) had sturdy ones baked in fire. But Baba's response was, \"I prefer the raw pots only.\" Today, we'll uncover the mystery behind Baba's affection for these raw pots in this episode. There's extraordinary significance of the fifth chapter. the devotee with earnest desire for renunciation in their life should repeatedly read this chapter. As you've narrated the leela, Baba would daily take two raw clay pots from Vaman Tatyaji to blossom the garden by fetching water in it One meaning of it comes out for symbolizing that devotees coming to Him are like raw pots, imperfect and with all the desires. He takes them and nurtures them spiritually, like tending a garden or blossoming flowers. On a deeper level, the act of taking the pots without payment signifies selfless service. Vaman Tatyaji, perhaps not having given attention to selfless service in previous lifetimes, and perhaps the Lord exhausted from teaching him would take that service as His right in this birth As Baba was omnipotent, in this birth, decides to take his service without payment, emphasizing the value of selfless devotion. The second interpretation of the leela also addresses the discrepancy between hearing about selfless service and practicing it. The leela beautifully illustrates how Baba, the Sadguru, interacts with those who may not fully embody the principle of selfless service. After filling the raw clay pots with water, he would pour the water and then place it under the neem tree. These pots would burst because they weren't baked in the fire. The underlying message was Baba's attempt to make us understand that considering our lives permanent is like those unbaked pots, here today but maybe gone tomorrow. so to keep the notion of life's uncertain nature alive he would buy raw pots. That do not live with the sentiment of life as permanent Who knows when death may come. So, Baba wanted us to realize that we are not invincible. And His way to make us realize is very terrifying, i don't know if you have experienced it or not but Sometime without any reason the fear of death haunts us. so by permeating this fear again and again He makes us realize about this fleeting nature of life Baba used the metaphor of unbaked pots to convey this. It's a terrifying experience, and if you have experienced it, you can understand. On one side, he engages in selfless service, diminishing the ego, and on the other side, he instills the fear of death, making us realize that I am not the body, but the soul. All of this is part of the leela indirectly the ultimate goal behind this is the awakening our consciousness. This is the main purpose and if we dive deeper into this chapter, we'll see it's just not only one leela in this chapter. It's like the raw clay pot is the earth, and when water is poured into it, after a while, the clay will transform into soil, and the water will assimilate the clay, realizing that the dominance of water over clay. In this chapter, Baba continues with another leela, lighting lamps with water. Through this leela, he conveys that the importance of fire is greater than water; it is subtle yet powerful. Now Moving on to Chapter 37, Baba alternate day goes to stay in the Chavadi, and as he leaves Dwarkamai that night, he extinguishes the lamp by swatting his hand. This leela signifies that air is more powerful than fire. Exploring the dominance of one element over another among the five elements, so 5th chapter is very deep considering different aspects Chapter 44, Baba is portrayed as lying lifeless for three days, resembling a dead body. There is no movement in his body – no pulsation, no breath, and no heartbeat. This scenario illustrates the element of space. When there is no movement of breath, the element of space is present. Baba rises after three days, indicating the experience of chidakasha, the awareness of universal consciousness. so in this way He has tried to exposite tatva gyan in different chapters The journey begins with raw clay pots and reaches the realm of the sky(chidakash) It demonstrates that the leela is not limited but profound, and it journeys from clay to chidakasha. The leela holds extraordinary importance. The essence of this leela first lesson - that this manifest world is created from the five elements. In this leela, it is explained that water is more subtle than earth, is not only more powerful but also more pervasive. This is the unchanging secret of elemental knowledge: the more subtle something is, the more expansive and powerful it becomes. Water is more subtle than Earth. Fire is more subtle than water. Air is subtle than fire. And sky(space)is more subtle than air. The human body is designed for the exploration of the subtle from the gross physical body to the subtle senses, from the senses to the subtle mind, from the mind to the subtle intellect, and from the intellect to the subtle soul. The mystery of this leela lies in traversing the journey from the earth to the sky and from the gross body to the subtle soul. Now, the second and essential lesson from this divine play is Baba seemingly telling us that he has sent us into this world as a flute. This flute must undergo the divine fire of tapasya before it breaks and melts transforming into the subtlest air, merging with the infinite consciousness. Only then will you become the self-resounding Brahma This is when life becomes meaningful, and the raw clay pot, transforms into the permanent vessel , the soul.",

If there is no mediation in life then such a person is not spiritual, this is the perception of many people and there is lot of talk about meditation. Now a days the amount of stress a person undergoes, the amount of stress a person takes on his head, that there is some peace of mind this day, some control over mind so some meditation is also required. That is why today there are many institutes which talk about meditation techniques. This is our way of doing meditation, you have that way of doing meditation. We have been told to meditate in this way. Some other institute, some other Guru he says no we have been told this is the way of meditating. The question is what is true meditation? What is meditation? What does Baba say about meditation. What does Baba feel about meditation, for us that is more important. Today I will take 7/8 verses and what is meditation will open up. What does Baba say about meditation? What is the importance of meditation? First verse Adhyay 19 Verse 33 Gyanahunahi shresta dhyana, Arjunalagi kathi Bhagwan. Tutavaya bhaktbhavbandhan, Saihi sadhan he vade. Gyanahunahi shresta dhyana - Meditation is superior to knowledge. Arjunalagi kathi Bhagwan – Arjun, remember that mediation is crores times more important than knowledge because the attachments of the devotees drop. Baba is also confirming this. That mediation is better than knowledge. This is the first verse. Second Verse Adhyay 19 Verse 126 Mahatve gyana paris dhyana means the importance of meditation is many times more than knowledge. Tadarth lage yatarth gyana – but to do that meditation must have precise knowledge. The depth of that meditation has to be fully absorbed by my heart. The universal object soul, I am going to meditate upon, what is the nature of that soul, what is the actual nature of the brahman. It is Satchidananda. What is Sat, what is chitta and what is Ananda? So first, the thing I want to mediate upon I must have complete knowledge of that in my mind. Means first knowledge has to be there of the thing I will meditate upon only then I will be able to meditate upon it properly. Mahatve gyana paris dhyana, Tadarth lage yatarth gyana, Hota na vastuche sadyant akalan – here vastu means brahma vastu. Hota na vastuche sa adi anant akalan means my wisdom has to have the capability to grasp the universe. When I will have that capability to grasp fully then a picture will get clear in my intellect, through knowledge that picture will happen and I will, after taking the support of that knowledge be able to meditate on it. This is what Baba says about meditation. This was the second verse. So, first he has said that having knowledge of soul and Brahma is essential so that the form settles in your mind and then you can meditate on that. It means that for the family, there has to be love but no attachment. There is a big difference between love and attachment. If, there is attachment then you are trapped in the desire for progeny. This is one desire, Putreshna – desire for progeny. Vitteshna (desire for wealth) -There should be no greed for money, that my life will have happiness if I have lots of money. If this feeling is there that I will get happiness from money, then you are mistaken. You can never get happiness from money. I will give an example. Dhirubhai Ambani’s one side was paralyzed. And Dhirubhai Ambani ranked seventh in the list of the 10 wealthiest persons in the world. It means that Dhirubhai Ambani’s name was included in the list of all the wealthiest people in the world. So, to think that if I have a lot money then I will be happy, there can be no greater stupidity then this. So, this is Vitteshna (Desire for wealth). Putreshna (Desire for progeny), Vitteshna (desire for wealth) and third is Lokeshna (desire for popularity). Hunger for name and fame. If you have such feelings then you have disease named lokeshna (desire for popularity). So, these are Sarveshnas, the three desires. There should be no Putreshna (Desire for progeny), Vitteshna (desire for wealth) and lokeshna (desire for popularity). Mal means impurity of the mind, dirtiness, desires, anger, greed, attachment, ego, jealousy, word, form, smell, touch, pride, all type of ignorance is mal. Vikshep means fickleness of the mind and third is Avaran. When mal and Vikshep, both go away, purification of mind happens, then you are able to enter meditation. Baba is telling us how will we reach to meditation. Only on intellectual level you have heard something, felt something, someone pumped up a little and we sat for meditation, it is not possible. Through this Leela baba tells that Nishkam Karma Yog with all that weakness and someone’s fever has gone to head and that if I could bring it down than I have to take that much effort. I have to take that trouble and after that Radhakrishna Mai’s fever will come down, he saw that and he took that much risk and he accomplished that feat. Those who live such a life only they will reach to Dhyana, Dharana, Samadhi is what he wants to tell. This is true meditation. I hope that after this there will remain no questions on meditations and don’t get cheated by other people. Fulfill your swadharma sincerely. Now this word—shuddha swadharma—is very important. What is shuddha swadharma? Now this word—shuddha swadharma—is very important. What is shuddha swadharma? Take the example of a doctor. A doctor’s shuddha swadharma is not just to earn money. If needed, he should work day and night— but not a single patient under his care should leave untreated. He should pray, “O Lord, may I heal everyone who comes to me.” The one who works with that kind of passion and selflessness— that is called Shuddha swadharma. Similarly, take a lawyer — suppose some cases come to him. He says, “Even if I have to die trying, the innocent — the truly innocent — must not be punished. They must be saved at any cost. Even if I perish, let it never happen that someone innocent is punished because of me.” This is the Shuddha swadharma — the righteous duty — of a lawyer. For a teacher, Shuddha swadharma means that when I teach a lesson, I teach it with such clarity that it imprints on the minds and hearts of my students forever. I should never mislead them or show them the wrong path. That’s the duty of a true teacher. Now take a housewife. Her Shuddha swadharma is to manage the household with the mindset that it's Sai Baba’s home. Even if she cooks simple dal and rice, she should pour so much love and flavor into it that if a guest eats it, it should feel like elixir. If she cleans the house, she should do it with such devotion that Baba is watching upon her Karmas. If she even cleans the toilet, it should be so clean that her own face is reflected in it. That is the Shuddha swadharma of a housewife. Similarly, for a student, Shuddha swadharma means, \"I will dedicate myself day and night to my studies. Similarly, for a student, Shuddha swadharma means, \"I will dedicate myself day and night to my studies. The result is up to God. The effort of the entire year is mine, but those three hours of the exam— that’s not in my control.\" Because in the Bhagavad Gita, Lord Krishna says, “I am memory in all beings.” That means memory is also a divine gift. So, even if a student studies sincerely all year, but during the three-hour exam, if the Divine decides to erase that memory, then what’s the use? That’s why Krishna says, “I am memory in all beings.” So those three hours belong to God. But it is the student’s duty to do their part with complete sincerity throughout the year. Now, why is Nishkama Karma (selfless action) so important? Today, most people do any Karma only after asking: “What will I gain from this?” “Tell me the result first, then I’ll do the work.” But Krishna teaches the exact opposite— You must act without attachment to the fruits of your actions. And Baba, too, is teaching the same message through this very story. Now see what the story says: Four women hear that Baba is grinding wheat. They think that, \"Since Baba sustains himself through bhiksha (alms), he will surely distribute this among us.\" So they rush over and forcibly move Baba aside. They sit down themselves and begin grinding the wheat, while singing Baba’s praises. Baba sees their love and devotion and quietly steps aside. He doesn’t stop them—he lets them continue until the flour is completely ground. But once the flour is ready, the women begin to think, “We worked so hard, this flour now belongs to us.” So, each of them takes a portion, assuming ownership of it because of their effort. But just when they begin to leave with their share, Baba stops them. Notice—Baba didn’t stop them while they were working. He let them finish the task first—only then did he intervene. Baba already knew their intentions, that these women believed: “We did the work, so we’ve earned the right to the result.” They were acting with that sense of entitlement. In Chapter 35, there's a story of Balaji Patil Nivaskar which is in complete contrast to the Leela of the four women. Balaji Patil Nivaskar was a farmer. He toiled hard throughout the year, sweating under the sun and rain, working in the fields. After harvesting his grains, he would load them onto bullock carts and bring them to Shirdi. Similarly, that one rupee i.e. faith (Shraddha) and patience (Saburi) and if i get it then and if I get it, then if I worship it throughout my life, then I will get exclusive devotion to Baba. This good feeling was hidden in the mind of Captain Hatay unexpressed and Baba grasped his goodwill and returned the coin to him and Narvekar was watching it and Narvekar feels why he doesn't do this work staying in Shirdi. whereas a person from Gwalior has a wisdom to purify a coin from Baba's hand and keep it with himself. Why don't we Shirdikar have this much wisdom? why didn't we think of it staying close, let's do the same and give the coin. But what does he choose? On one hand, Ram Laxman and Sita, when seen from outside, it seems that there is no greater devotee than this great man Vamanrao Narvekar, but Baba knows the inner heart This Hatey leela is completely opposite to Wamanrao Narvekars leela. Chapter 29 Ovi no 177 'he jari mhanave nischit, tich paha dusri prachit' taking about narvekar 'ti to yahun viparit, jyache mnogat tya thave' So Narvekar's feeling was that if this coin gets purified from Baba's hand and comes into my hands, then there will be a lot of wealth in my house. And how can Baba increase our greed? So instead Baba did opposite. Okay, if you want this coin, give me twenty-five rupees. On the contrary, whatever greed he had within him, baba pulled it out in the form of twenty-five rupees. But that coin was not allowed to reach him. This is Baba. See, both leelas are same, both are giving coins, but one is getting returned with blessings and the other is negotiated for 25 rupees Flaunting how great devotees we are will not work in front of Baba. Baba is Omniscience .He is a true Sadguru. How can a lie work there? How will those false coins work? There is a couplet of Kabirji Man Maila Tan ujala 'mann maila tann ujala bagula kapto aangi' Have you seen the Heron? They are lovely white in colour. Do you know why people a simile of heron to devotee? Have you ever wondered why such simile to a devotee? One specialty of Bagula(Heron) is, if you pay attention, the heron stands calm in the water as if it is in a trance. It neither moves nor shakes. But what is the reason behind that samadhi (Trance)? Do you know he is looking for the fish under waters, his entire attention is on the fish. But as soon as the fish is seen, it immediately takes it in its mouth and hunts it. From the outside, it seems as if it is in a trance. So in the same way Narvekar Saheb found the coin with Ram Laxman Sita on one side and Hanumanji on the other side seems there is no greater devotee than him. But Baba is the omnipresent one. Knows everyone's feelings and intentions. There is a film called Laila Majnu. Majnu, who is completely crazy about his Laila, is wandering from place to place.He is going somewhere in the desert calling Laila Laila. And a person is in the desert and perhaps it is time for Namaz, he is offering Namaz. In worship of Allah (God). This Majnu, who has become crazy about Laila, is going that way and does not realize that someone is sitting in Namaz. He is so much absorbed in love of Laila that he is not able to know who is sitting and who is doing what, he is not paying any attention, he is just chanting Laila And suddenly as soon as he passes in front of the person offering Namaz, he shouts, Hey Kafir! kafir is the one who is an Atheist Don't you see that I am sitting here for namaz. So such prostration, such devotion, God does not want. Baba is omnipresent. Knows every layer of our soul. Know in detail. That's why the name of Leela I always say that Captain Hatay v/s Narvekar. I hope that this leela has been revealed to you. So, if our feelings are selfless, true and pure, then only we will be able to get closer to Baba's heart. The essence of this Leela: Through this Leela, it seems as if Baba is telling us that almost the whole world does my fruitful devotion only and I have no objection to it. Because every devotee starts with fruitful devotion. But that's just the beginning. If that fruitful devotion cannot be transformed into selfless devotion, then that devotion is worth a penny. It is fine in this world but it has no value in the spiritual world. Because selfless devotion is the first step in the spiritual journey. From there the spiritual journey begins. And through this Leela, He is also telling us that I do not see your external conduct, your show of sincerity, your devotional yoga, knowledge yoga and your meditation yoga. Rather, what the whole world cannot see, I can clearly see your intentions, your selfishness and your capabilities. Because if a desiring devotee continues to do all these yogas for millions of years even after taking millions of births, he will not be able to progress in the spiritual world. All these yogas are meant only to convert a eccentric devotee into a selfless devotee. Their efficiency increases the physical intelligence and their ineffectiveness reduces the physical intelligence And extinction of the body consciousness is pursuing me Or attaining enlightenment. Now the question is whether you want me or do you want something else from me. Narayan or Narayani Sena? Your desiring self worries me. Because even though you may not be aware of it, I know very well that it will one day prove fatal for you. Sadguru sai's truthful words, adhay 52 verse 171 This sai sathcharitra is not an ordinary scripture it is truly a kalpvrisksh (wish fulfilling tree), for those who have worldly desires to them it appears to be dry but to the seekers, it is deliverance, experience it for yourself in life when maturity ascends related to life then roads diverge in front of us one takes to shreya(ultimate good) and other takes to preya(pleasure) In this world 99.99% people choose the road leading to Preya (Pleasure). I again repeat in this world 99.99% people choose the road leading to Preya (Pleasure). 0.01% people choose Shreya. Now I am taking up a topic, Shreya (Ultimate good) and Preya (Pleasure), Adhyay 17 . Actually, in Saisatcharitra the topic in Adhyay 17 Shreya (Ultimate good) and Preya (Pleasure), and if you agree with me then I feel that this topic of should have been the in Adhyay 1 Shreya (Ultimate good) and Preya (Pleasure). Till such time you understand this topic it will not be clear to you that in life you always come across two paths and which path to choose. Whether you should choose Shreya (Ultimate good) or Preya (Pleasure). This important aspect of life Baba has kept it in Adhyay 17 and what is written about Shreya (Ultimate good) and Preya (Pleasure) is taken from Kathopanishad. Kathopanishad speaks at length about this Shreya (Ultimate good) and Preya (Pleasure). So, Adhyay 17 which is taken from Kathopanishad talks about Shreya (Ultimate good) and Preya (Pleasure). We take the verses one by one and they are all important verses. Please listen to each verse attentively. Shri Saisatcharitra, Adhyay 17 Shree Ganeshayana namah. Shree Saraswateha namah. Shree Gurubhyo namah. Shree Kuladevataya namah. Shree Sitaramachandrabhya namah. In the previous Adhyay it was said that in the next Adhyay that is Adhyay 17 they will speak on Shreya (Ultimate good) and Preya (Pleasure) so now listen to it with respect and from your heart. Prakash ani Andkhar, jaise annoyavrutakar, Bhinaroop te paraspar, Shreya-Preya taya pari. It is said that light and dark, jaise annoyavrutakar, they move one after the other in circle. Bhinaroop te paraspar – both are different, light is different and darkness is different. As after day there is night and after night there is day, it is moving in a circle, similarly Shreya and Preya are moving continuously in a circle in our life. Bhinaroop te paraspar, Shreya-Preya taya pari. Verse 3 Preyarth jayache man dhave, Swarthapasav toh bhransh pave, One whose mind runs towards the Preya (Pleasure). Preyarth jayache man dhave, Swarthapasav toh bhransh pave. Because there is selfishness Preya (Pleasure), walking on the path of Preya (Pleasure) he will only stumble. He will only meet deception. Preya is that. Shreya te vivekroop ahe, Shreya (Ultimate Good) is about discrimination and Preya roop is indiscrimination. What is the difference between Shreya and Preya. Whenever we start understanding life then always two roads open up for us. One leads to Shreya and the other leads to Preya. In this world 99.99% people choose the road leading to Preya (Pleasure). I again repeat in this world 99.99% people choose the road leading to Preya (Pleasure). 0.01% people choose Shreya. Shreya is filled with prudence and detachment. Preya is filled with suffering and debauchery. Every person wants to enjoy and do not want to do penance and that is why every person is attracted towards Preya. Preya is liked and only Preya is thought about. We do not have the time to think about Shreya (Ultimate good). Mind loves Preya (Pleasure). This is because it is very easy to walk on the path of Preya (Pleasure). Preya is like waterfall from the mountain. If the water is falling down from the mountain, then is there any struggle, you tell me. The earth’s gravity pulls it downwards very easily towards the Earth. But if you have to take the same water up to the mountains then you need a motor, energy, electricity. Similar is Shreya (Ultimate good) and Preya (Pleasure). Preya is the feeling of enjoying life and those who see danger in this enjoyment, self-destruction in enjoyment, the one who gets the clarity that this Preya (Pleasure) will lead to destruction only such a person will think of Shreya. Only that one person will think about Shreya (Ultimate good). The rest 99.99% like Preya (Pleasure). They love Preya. Shreyacha visay kevalvidya, preyacha toh nikhal avidya – Subject of Shreya is knowledge. It does not look for momentary happiness. It thinks a lot about eternal bliss. Because momentary pleasure is momentary only. You enjoy momentarily and then it is time for punishment. This happiness is fatal for humans in two ways. If you get some happiness then the mind wants some more happiness. This is the two sidedness of the mind. If I do not get the happiness that I want then I go into depression and anxiety, my mood is off and the mind is scattered. If the wish is fulfilled then it gives birth to a even bigger desire. These are the signs of Preya. If one desire is fulfilled then there is a bigger desire. If that is also fulfilled then there is bigger desire. This seriality does not stop. The hunger increases. The thirst increases. If one wish is fulfilled then a bigger wish takes birth. If for some reason that wish is not fulfilled then that person gets depressed, stressed, anxious. This is Preya. That is why it is said that if a person gets freedom from his desires, he becomes God. This is an easy way to become God. Desires fall down. The one whose desires fall, the next moment he becomes God. Who has tied us to the level of Human? Desires, material enjoyments, luxuries and to experience these sufferings and luxuries money is needed and to earn that money lots of hard work is required. Take lots of efforts, earn crores of rupees and live a life indulgence. . 99.99% people come in this category. This is called Preya and .01% people think of Shreya. In our Satsang we will think about Shreya. We will not even think of Preya even in our dreams. There is whole life for Preya. So, this is the difference.99.99% people move towards Preya. Even if parents awaken the children forcefully in the morning, they do not wake him up saying that you have to complete Saisatcharitra study but to study and get good marks so that he passes with good marks, earn lots of money and then enjoy. Very nice…Thank you…So those who feel that their child should not make the same mistake that they did, my child should not spend their earning money like me, I who has been dying for the perishable my child should not die for it. My child should move towards the eternal. I have drowned, my story is over but let me take care of my child. My child should go towards Shreya (ultimate Good), my child should not go towards Preya (pleasure). This does not mean that he should leave studies. Don’t misunderstand. I only want to say that Shreya is much higher than Preya. Studies are important, job is important but God forbid if it clashes with Preya but it does not even take a moment to drop into Preya. Shreyacha visay kevalvidya, preyacha toh nikhal avidya Preya kadhi na bhulavi sudnya – The one who is awakened to Shreya, Preya can never lead him astray. Preya can never trap him in its greed, if he is awakened. Preya kadhi na bhulavi sudnya, Shreya agnya navade – Shreya does not like ignorance. Shreya does not like to turn towards ignorance. In life those who are greatly attracted to wealth and lust, that is their purpose of life, earn lot of money, indulge and spend entire life in sex. These 14 verses of Shreya and Preya are very important verses. Those who are listening for the first time I hope that the subject is clear. If there is a child in the house and he is insisting on something, there has to be so much clarity that what he is insisting upon if given to him will push him towards the path of Shreya or Preya. The father and mother will have to think about this first and after that decide whether to give or not. This is so because they think that attachment is love and because the attachment to the son is so much, they do not think about Shreya and Preya. They keep on giving whatever is asked because of the attachment and there were no restrictions. They did not put the habit to the child of listening to a ‘no’. This is very dangerous for the child. The day he has to listen to ‘no’ that child will either commit suicide or he will fight with you and leave the house. In both the cases you would have destroyed the child because you did not put him the habit of listening to ‘no’. You did not say ‘no means no’. There are no brakes in the car. Tell me what will happen to that car? You kept giving him whatever he asked because you are attached to the child. You earned a lot; you have lots of money and you kept on giving whatever the child asked. Now he is habituated to getting whatever he has asked for. It is in your hands and you get it and give him that, you have spoiled him. Let’s say this boy loves a girl and he is after the girl and is crazy about her and hopes that she will say ‘yes’ to him. Because he is habituated to listen to ‘yes’. He has no habit of listening to a ‘no’. And the girl says I am not concerned with you and cares two hoots about him. Such children then go into depression and commit suicide. This is because we have never thought them to listen to a ‘no’. We have not put any brakes for the child. We gave him a car without brakes to drive so there will be nothing other than an accident. This is Shreya and Preya. In the 14 verses it is clarified it. It is an important part of Kathopanishad. That is why in Adhyay 53 verse 161 Baba says Vedantvishay ati gahan Vedant is very deep knowledge and that Baba has simplified it and put it in verses. Vedantvishay ati gahan, virakti-bhakti-gyan jod deun, Aisa granth karan nirman, gurukrupevin durgad These 14 verses have been taken from Kathopanishad and Kathopanishad is part of Vedant. Shreya and Preya. Think of your life as a tree. Earn money, whatever you are destined to enjoy, enjoy it, there is nothing wrong in it. But if the roots do not have spirituality, then that tree will not survive for long. Do you know when the tree is lush green and gives lots of flowers and fruits? When the roots are very deep. So, when in a person’s life the roots of spirituality are deep, if the roots are deep then its branches, leaves, fruits and flowers will grow in this world because the spirituality in the roots is alive and that is why that person will not get stuck. How much ever success he gets he will not be misled, will not go astray. But the roots which have no spirituality, no Shreya if such a person succeeds how much ever the tree is lush green because the roots are not strong it will not survive for long, it will collapse and fall. That is why in very person’s life compulsorily the roots of Shreya have to be strong then God can give him anything in the name of Preya it does not matter and even if he does not give that too does not matter. Because he has in his hands the original thing. He has in his hand higher things. Who and why anyone will see what he did not get anything of lower level. The one who has nectar why will he look towards the poison. Why does a person get stuck at lower level of happiness? This is because he has not touched the higher thing. And if has touched the higher thing and he is enjoying it and drinking the delight of unique devotion, why will he get stuck in these object indulgence. There is reason for that. But today object indulgence feels like happiness because there is something higher than this is not known. Th other day I gave this example today also I will give the same example. There are two children in one house. One child enjoys dining table and loves to eat and drink. Whatever the child asks it is given to him. If he wants non vegetarian food all 7 days then it is given. Mother gives him whatever he asks for. In the same house there is another child and he is insisted upon to eat but he is unable to eat, he does not relish it much, he does not enjoy it. Because he has touched something more subtle than this. He is interested in art, music, poetry, song. His enjoyment and indulgences have transformed from gross to subtle. He has gone beyond that. When he listens to some song, he likes it so much that the food is tasteless in front of that. He does not enjoy it. This is because he has touched something subtle. He has touched something better than gross which is pure. When he listens to some song then he gets lost in its lyrics. I showed you a film and your heart was filled with joy. If someone is looking at a song, music so very minutely, will such a person get stuck in gross desires. Will he like it? Master has taken him to such a high level that even if he is hit and made to eat even then he will not eat it I will give you, my example. In childhood I loved to see movies now it has reduced a lot. But I used to see a lot of movies. At that age in 4th, 5th standard in our colony it was a crime to see movies. My mother and father believed that it was a sin. Because my age children did not see any movies. But I was very fond of watching movies. So, if mother gave 10 paise or 25 paise in those times we got that much only. Today the children may not even know 25 paise or 50 paise. They give Rs 100 note saying take child. But in those times 25 paise, 50 paise was a lot. They used to give so that I go and buy something and eat. Other children with me enjoyed eating. They used to go and eat chocolates etc. but I was never interested in those things so I used to collect money up to 40 paise and save. And once 40 paise were collected there was theatre near our house called Vandana theatre and one could see a movie in 40 paise and I used to save money and sit in the theatre and watch movie without telling anyone. By God’s grace my health is fine now but, in those days, I was very thin. Being a child, my mother felt I should eat well, she used to bring fruits, cook meat and she used to try to feed me well. But I was not interested in eating. Because God had given something higher than food in the hand at the age of four. I used to go and watch and if in the film if I liked some scene which touched my heart, some song I liked and it touched my heart, why I am saying this is, one whose awareness has awakened and can see the subtle and understand it such a person cannot be interested in the gross. My mother used to serve fish fry, mutton and used to insist that I eat or I would be spanked. So many times, I have been beaten because I did not eat and if she went to the kitchen for a while I used to throw the mutton pieces out of gallery and say I have eaten. This was my childhood. But I was fond of movies. Because of this mother and father felt that I was getting spoilt. But they never understood what I saw in it. Later on, when I started doing the Satsang and mother understood that she has beaten him a lot in his childhood for movies. One day she fell at my feet and apologized and said that I never understood what you wanted to see, what you saw. I thought that watching movies was bad and you will get spoiled that is why I have beaten you so much. I have starved for 3 days for having seen the movie. Even then I did not give up on that habit. Why I am telling you all this is because one who gets touch of the subtle, he touches something better than he will not enjoy the gross. You can guess he who has acquired exclusive devotion will such a person get stuck in such gross desires? Psychologically after coming to better position the lowly things feel inferior. Music, poetry, good direction, good story if such things please the heart, then the heart is so happy then that day don’t feel like eating or drinking. The one who touches God’s devotion how will such a person get stuck in these desires. It is not possible. I said the other day also a person who is into music, poetry, painting and is busy in any such art have you ever seen such a person commit a crime. Have you seen such a person holding someone’s collar and fighting in the middle of the road. He cannot fight. It is not in his genes. He has risen above all these things. So, Shreya and Preya are this only. The subtler you get the gross keeps dropping. This Preya will keep dropping. But if you are not inclined towards subtlety then your life will begin at dining table and end in the bedroom. Then as Baba says in Adhyay 44 jivah and upast in these two things they will get stuck and die. They will eat good food, lust will arise and take them to bedroom and then it is food and bedroom, Jivah upast, in that life ends. They will not be able to rise beyond this. They will not be able to see the world beyond this. Life will end in these two things. Look carefully at life. Only these two things attract us. Why are you living? To eat. But there may be only one such sadhu, one such saint who eats to live. All of us live to eat. This is the difference. But till such time you get something higher in your hands these lowly things will not fall, will not drop. That is why if anyone shows any inclination towards art then please don’t stop the child. Instead give full support because he is moving from gross to subtle. Support as much as you can, be it music, poetry, shayari, painting. If he wants to enter the medium of arts then you give him full support as a parent, as a father, as a mother. Because subtle is many times better than gross as spirituality is closer from there. If the attraction of the world increases towards arts, music then the highest truth is closer from there. But from the gross world highest truth is very far. From the dining table divine is very far. Get up in the morning, breakfast is kept, it is afternoon what is afternoon meal, worry is only about that. This has become so routine and at night what will you have at night is this life? Don’t want to rise above this. Baba has by speaking on Shreya and Preya directed the world’s flow and world’s inclination at every turning point, at every step these two paths will unfold and every time Preya has to be dropped and Shreya has to be chosen. I am going to narrate a story so things will be clearer. It is said that the entire world that you see in the gross form this temple, Baba, this stage, that dense form which we are enjoying but Vedanta says that it is the shadow of the Divine. And Paramatma is the body. reversed. That Divine which you cannot see is the body and this world that we see is merely shadow of the Divine. Do you believe this. If you stand in sunlight, this body is my physique and my reflection is my shadow. Because I am dense that is why it is my shadow. But here it is reversed. The Divine that you cannot see is the body and that which you see is the world is only shadow. That is why it is said that as much as you may try to catch this shadow it you will never be able to touch it. When you leave this and turn your mind inwards, meditatively and search within then you will find the entire universe. I will tell a story which will clear this more. One day a father who is a potter is making a pot in his courtyard. There is a small child of 4/5 years. The morning sun is in its full glory. The child is playing in the courtyard. And the child’s shadow is in front of him. The child tries to touch the shadow. The more he moves forwards, the shadow moves further. The child gets worried. The more he moves forward, he still cannot touch the shadow. He wants to touch the head of the shadow. He tells his father that I see my head in the shadow I want to touch that. But I am not able to that. The father is working. He is a potter. He says Son no one has been able to touch the shadow you are unnecessarily trying to that. Leave it. You won’t be able to touch it. The more you move towards it, the shadow will go further ahead. But the child says no father the long head that I see in the shadow I want to touch that. At that moment a Fakir was passing by. Fakir listened to the conversation between the father and son Fakir was saying that this child was saying the right thing. Let me satisfy his curiosity. Fakir keeps his luggage outside and enters the courtyard. He asks the child do you want to reach the head in the shadow. The child asks will I be able to reach it. The fakir says yes. I do that work only. He lifted the child’s hand and put it on the child’s head and in the shadow, he was able to reach his head. Do you understand? He lifted the child hand and kept it on his head and it was so easy. He said the world is like this only. If you wander and try to take on the world, you will not get it in your hand. When you leave the world and dive within then this world will be yours. The one who runs behind the shadow is path of Preya and the one who dives within is the path of Shreya. That is completeness. There is a movie scene, I will play it so it will be clearer. I will tell a little about the scene so that you will be able to understand it better. . The name of the film is DDLJ, Dilwale Dulhaniya le jayenge. How many of you have seen it….many have seen it. I will tell a scene from the movie. There is a hero and he is love with a girl in London. But he does not express his love. Heroine comes to India, there is love but does not express it. After some days the girl gets engaged, there is marriage scheduled and the hero comes to India from London. Somehow, he manages to pose as a guest and enters the house. He meets the girl and the girl says my father has got me engaged to someone else, my father will never give my hand in marriage to you. You take me away from here. The heroine says to the hero that my father will never agree to our marriage you take me away from here to London. Later even the heroine’s mother comes to know that her daughter loves this boy. . She gives all the jewelry in hero’s hands and says that you elope with my daughter. You don’t know my husband; he will never agree to this marriage. When the heroine’s mother tells this to the hero, see the scene to know his answer. You will understand very well what Shreya and Preya is. Mother is telling the boy to elope with her daughter and gives all her jewelry in his hand, she hands over her entire life’s savings to him. He says that my mother always used to say that at every stage of life there will be two roads, one right and the other wrong. The wrong way will be very easy, in beginning you will get great happiness, you will enjoy a lot but at the end you will lose. But the right path, the path of Shreya in that probably at every step there will be difficulties, will have to face obstacles and hindrances but in the end you will win. Shreya and Preya are similar to this. If you chose Preya then there will be no struggle, no troubles, no obstacles, you will just blow away your life by enjoying it and at the end leave this world. If you embrace Shreya, live life of honor then you may face troubles at every step but in the end, there will be victory, you will shine in the world as a hero. Whoever has heard this Satsang, I believe that this topic has touched everyone’s heart. We will have to choose. We need to be aware very moment, where the senses are running, from where to bring them back, what is the mind thinking, you need to bring back the mind from there. This struggle is not of a moment, it is a moment-to-moment struggle Every time the mind will go towards the Preya, every such time you will have to pull it towards Shreya. This struggle is not of a second, an hour or a day, it is a struggle of entire lifetime. I had this Satsang and you heard it for some time and then you sweep it out, this cannot happen. You have to imbibe this in your life. When it comes to Shreya and Preya, there is such subtlety even in Gods. Once the war between the Kauravas and Pandavas is inevitable There is no other option for Kauravas and Pandavas but to start a war. Duryodhana and Arjun meet Balram also, just as they met Krishna. Balaram tells you both are my cousins so I will not fight this war siding anyone. You both are close to me and I will not fight with anyone. And they both leave. Actually, Duryodhana loves Balaram a lot He does not love but in way he cheats, respects a lot and always agrees with him and Balaram gets trapped in that for lifetime. And Balaram always supports Duryodhana even if he is wrong. In the end when the war is getting over Balaram comes running when Duryodhana is killed and Balaram says that you have killed him wrongly and I will never forgive you , then Krishna says to Balaram, brother when there was war between righteousness and injustice and when they came to take help from you that time you did not have the courage to choose the righteousness, Shreya. You had run away from the battlefield. Krishna says this to Balaram. Actually, you should have stood up for righteousness, like how I stood up for the Pandavas, you too should have stood up with the Pandavas. When it is about righteousness and injustice you have to drop injustice and hold on to righteousness. But under the influence of attachment, you did not take that decision. In the end Krishna says that all life long you never saw their mistakes and when both of them come to you asking for help you did not pay attention to righteousness or injustice and being impartial you went for pilgrimage Krishna says that when there is a war waged between righteousness and injustice in the battlefield then there is only one holy place that remains and that is battlefield. And that too you have to be on the side of righteousness and fight the war. There remains only battlefield. You cannot be impartial. See this scene also. When it is about Shreya or Preya then you need to go straight towards Shreya. If it is about righteousness and injustice then you cannot be impartial. Being impartial is equally wrong and is like embracing Preya or injustice. This is what he says and there is such depth to this. Even in our life there comes such times where we want to save ourselves, we want to be impartial. Who will get in the mess, forget it. But Krishna says that those who live their life like that they cannot embrace righteousness, Shreya. So, when both of them came to me I stood up for righteousness but brother you made a mistake. You did not stand up for righteousness, you wanted to be impartial but remember that when it is about righteousness and injustice and if you want to be impartial even then it will be called injustice. When it is about Shreya and Preya, you have to select Shreya only at any cost. All this makes it very clear that Shreya and Preya are subtle topics but if in life it becomes clear What Shreya and Preya is and you have to see it with awareness every moment. You will face it every moment. If I say whether this will go towards Shreya or Preya, have to decide on that in house, office society. Wherever you go this Shreya and Preya have to come along. You have to face it. You cannot get rid of this. 24x7 this Shreya and Preya will stand before you but 99.99% people don’t even know what this Shreya and Preya is. They live life of Preya and they sink into the earth with all the afflictions of Preya. Then they again come into this world with Preya and again live with Preya. There is no trace of Shreya. This is the reality of the world. That is why I say that this Shreya and Preya which has come in Adhyay 17 should have come in Adhyay 1. one which apprehends mind, overcomes bane and calamities, annihilates ignorance, bestows deliverance, the ultimate source of welfare, truth awareness and bliss giver mother of sai, direct form of sai, diadem of all scriptures, glory to shree sai satcharitra divine granth",

    "Transcript": "Miracle Miracle is such a thing that every person has experienced it at some point of time in his/her life, at least in the initial days spiritual practice. If I say that one cannot become a devotee of Baba without miracles, it would not be an exaggeration.So that is the status of miracle, Before I say anything about miracles, let us make this clear that Baba's miracle is recorded in every person's life, whether he is a great saint or an ordinary atheist, he experiences it in every person's life. There is no doubt about it. Because Baba's miracle is the miracle which turns an atheist into a believer in the first place.As it is said in the Aarti (nastikana hi lavishi nijbhajani) so miracles turn an atheist into a devotee of baba Miracles are not bad in themselves and if Baba is doing miracles then Baba has a deep philosophy behind them. He knows very well why he does miracles. But the problem is that when the form and essence of a miracle, the feeling of a miracle, if its importance increases beyond limits in my life, then it can even lead my life astray. If I keep seeing only Baba's miracles and if I am not able to take the light that Baba is giving behind that miracle, then those miracles can even lead me astray. So these are the basic things that would be better if it is clear. Now see, the life of every human being passes through four stages First of all, no matter who a person is in this world, he is first of all an atheist. He does not have faith or devotion in God or Goddess, he is an atheist. Baba's miracles turn such atheists into believers. So the one who became a believer means that he has passed the first stage and reached the second stage. Now when he becomes a believer of Baba, he starts worshiping Baba, he gets some miracle in his life, Baba does such a thing in his life that he comes in the devotion of Baba, and he becomes a devotee of Baba. The purpose of Baba also remains the same that first one must have faith in Me, trust in Me must be established in one's heart and life, that is why Baba works on miracles. But as soon as Baba performs miracles like, if he rescues someone from the biggest trouble or fulfills someone's biggest wish, then this is the only thing that turns an atheist into a believer and makes him a devotee of Baba. And then after reaching the second stage, he starts worshiping Baba, he likes to hear about Baba, he likes to know about Baba's activities, he likes to talk about Baba, then automatically connection with the world to some extent gets cut off and he starts moving towards Baba. His inclination towards Baba starts increasing And then Baba takes advantage of that state at that time and Baba starts filling his heart with some light from His heart, some reality is being unfolded, importance of this world and body is delved and that atheist then believer then a devotee starts taking light from Baba, tries to understand baba's innermost being starts understanding Baba's heart, starts understanding Baba's will, then he becomes a good disciple from a good devotee. Meaning, from an atheist to a believer, from a good devotee to a good disciple disciple means he starts to understand that my will has no value, the will of the Sadhguru will of my baba i should first know and I should mould my life accordingly. And then for the sake of his wish (Baba's), even if I have to destroy the entire existence, then it should be destroyed but his will should remain alive. The day when the journey of an atheist reaches to be a good disciple and that disciple, when he reaches the stage of self offering of Nav vidha Bhakti then for the sake of the will of my Sadguru, even if the entire existence has to be destroyed even i'm ready to erase my existence After that disciple reaches this stage, the Sadguru does not take time to bless him. Then Sadhguru gives his full energy and power and takes him the same place as he himself is.He who is Parabrahma himself bestows the title of Parabrahma on his disciple also. If you ask me what is a true miracle then this is the biggest miracle. The journey started from an atheist and he himself became Sadhguru. He himself became the hero of the universe.(Brahmand Nayak) So if we look at it from Baba's point of view, what is the value of a miracle, then this is what. He sees when He looks at an atheist, Baba has seen the hidden hero of the universe (Brahmand Nayak) within him and then he is continously working on him and then guiding him one by one. Bringing him forward from the first step and making him like himself.Like it comes in the Third chapter (Sai Satcharitra) that when he sees any devotee, he says that when a devotee remembers a Sadguru, thinks about him, does his sadhana, meditates on him, then he becomes similar to Sadhguru. Further Baba says that even similar word indicate a difference between them. Even similar words do not please me. Guru and disciple becomes one, just as two lamps, when they meet, are called one lamp. Just as a river meets the ocean, it is called an Ocean. Similarly, when this good disciple merges with the sadguru then he is called sadguru. So I would say that this is the biggest miracle. It may take some years for some, some may take several births, but Sadhguru is behind that person and his aim is to take that person there, if seen from his point of view, then this is a miracle. we see that whether it is social media or books being written about Baba, hundreds of channels on youtube talk about Baba, that miraculous aspect of Baba is brought into more light and see, it is natural to happen. Because when a devotee is completely new and joins Baba, then Baba definitely performs miracles in his life. Such miracles are absolutely necessary for new devotees and Baba performs miracles in the lives of new devotees only. As the devotee's inner circle starts expanding, his mind starts getting purified, then miracles fall and then he starts coming face to face with Baba's light. Then there is no value left for a miracle in that person's life. Because in the beginning, that miracle is important and no one can deny it. But Baba says that my miracles are in the initial stage, but as he is filled with light, the interest for miracles gradually fades off, till a time comes when he shuns looking miracles. rather he looks at Baba's heart to see what His wish is, then he moulds his life by knowing Baba's heart and knowing His wish.So in the beginning that miracle is mandatory in the life of a good devotee. There is no doubt about it. But as the depth of sadhana increases, the person does not even realize when the miracle falls and he starts bathing in Baba's light, So this is another aspect. But what is the problem that today the social media, channels and books mostly highlight those aspects of Baba. That is a miracle! And in reality if seen from that perspective, those who have been worshiping Baba for years, who have matured, have been worshiping Baba for years or have spent a long time in His devotion, it is their responsibility to worship Baba and spread babas's light everytime to the society. Not a miracle because a miracle can only take them to Baba's court, can enable them to participate in Baba's court, but the spiritual journey ahead cannot be done on the basis of miracles alone. Its not the case that Every channel shows only the miracles of Baba, their are few good channels also. there are some people who tell about Baba, their feelings are clearly visible, with such pure intentions, there are few channels also. There are some good books, we are not against them, but if more such channels comes, to spread about Baba's light, Baba's heart, Baba's soul, if we can reach it to the coming generations, then perhaps we can be called true devotees of Baba. There are many people who have been worshiping Baba for a long time but are still stuck in miracles. For such people, only the miracles of God and the fruitful devotion of God are done. Example is given about them like a dog, Dog has great love for meat, if he puts a piece of meat in his mouth, He eats whatever meat is available first and eats it with great relish. But later, when the meat gets over, then in the desire to get the taste of meat from the piece of bone, it starts chewing the bone. While chewing bone, blood starts flowing from the jaw and it drinks the same blood thinking its a meat of the bone. Then such becomes condition of a good devotee. Baba cannot perform miracles always in one's life. It is impossible. Because if my hunger for miracles increases too much then I will never look towards the light/wisdom And the day I stop getting those miracles, I might go into depression or become an atheist again. Then there is every kind of danger. Because Baba cannot perform miracles as per my wish throughout my life. Just not possible. But still man does not lose hope. What am I saying that Baba cannot do miracles throughout life. This is the experience of all of us. We are all going through experiences. In the initial phase, it seems as if Baba spreads the carpet of flowers in front of us. And forces us to walk on it. It seems that everything is going as per our wish. Baba is doing as I want, in that stage there is the initial stage of spiritual practice of life, then Baba gives that carpet to the devotee, but after reaching baba says in Twenty-Ninth chapter (Sai Satcharitra) Ovi says chalu jata kathilya vate, arambhi arambhi god vate,mag jethe tethe pasarthil sarate, katech katech chohikade Baba openly says that even if I have done miracles in your life in the beginning, but in the future, if I have to test you, I will keep you on trial So when throns are seen Then the devotee wonders where Baba takes him to the wrong path. Further, Ovi also says that the faith of a person gets shaken. Then further Baba also says that I knowingly bring these troubles into your life and test them so that you can become gold, become Kundan and come out of that fire..I am the one who lays those thorns. The one who spread the flower carpet in the beginning is also Baba, later the one who spread the thorns is also Baba. Until we understand things. And that just a highlight, one aspect of life. He also does miracles by coming down to our level in the initial stage. Actually, he spreads a carpet of flowers in the initial days but he cannot spread flowers throughout his life. He cannot perform miracles as per my wish throughout life. Because his main aim is to make my mind free. His main objective is to make the soul within me the hero of the universe, Shiva. So if we look at it, miracles are necessary in the initial stages, but as the sadhana increases, that desire for miracles, it should leave the mind of the devotee, so that our love for Baba's light increases, and understand his will what he wants. I would say this personally, if the biggest miracle in the world I would say that knowing his will. First of all, it is His wish, what He wants from me and if I can mold my life accordingly, recognize the marks of His footsteps and could walk unto it, then no miracle can be greater than this. The reason for getting caught in miracles is fruitful desires. Why does a man give so much importance to miracles? Why does those miracles in his life matter so much? Because there is desire in life and we have selfish devotion towards Baba. So it is natural that our inclination towards miracles will never die. If you ask me maximum number of people in the whole world utilize Baba as a ladder to enjoy the world. Even if we worship Baba, we do so with desires for the world. We also worship Baba, we revere Baba with the want of world, we want the worldly pleasures, we want all the blessings of the world. We use Baba as a ladder. And the destination for us is the world. But Baba says in the entire Sai Satcharitra that you should make the whole world a ladder so that you can reach the destination i.e. SaiBaba. So I am your destination, so don't climb on my shoulders to touch the world with the desire of that world. Rather reach me by climbing on the shoulders of the world. If we can understand this philosophy and the pain of Baba's heart, then Saibaba is not only a miraculous saint but also a Sadguru. He does not just perform miracles, if we call him SamarthSadguru, His main objective is one thing that comes up in the Twenty-Seventh chapter.(Sai Satcharitra) Baba gives the example of a patient and says that when a patient goes to a doctor, first of all he asks for jaggery something sweet and unless you keep that sweet thing, he will not take the bitter medicine. So in the same way Baba also performs miracles in our lives, first but His purpose is to give us bitter herbs to drink later. On this I have remembered a couplet of Kabirji. (Mitha Mitha sab kahe mitha sab koi khay kadva neem na pivasi sabhi rog mit jaye) These are some of the subtle nuances if we understand them. We have understood the difference between miracle and light. Miracle is important but its aspect which is its role, Its a small role in the initial stage of starting, at that point that role ends, after that if anything is left then only light. We will have to accept the fact that there is no one who will do miracles with us throughout our life, this is the bitter truth. Because whether you accept this bitter truth or not, it is there. But if I accept then at least I will not be a victim of depression in the future due to my wishes not being fulfilled. These are some of the details, if we accept them then perhaps our life will be simple and meaningful .Very nice Krishnaji, very beautifully told. Jai Sairam The essence of this statement is clear that there is no Salutation (Namaskar) without a miracle.(Chamatkar) But without light, miracle is a sweet poison. There is as much difference between a miracle and a vision as there is between livelihood and light. If a miracle does not give a person the knowledge of faith then that miracle is not a miracle, it is just a magic. If a Sadguru cannot make a indulgent a Yogi, then that Sadguru is not a Sadguru, he is just a magician. When in the beginning everything happens as per our wish then that miracle is only an illusionary miracle. At the same time, when Sadhguru awakens in us the sweetness of extinction, that is actually the real encounter of the true Mayapati. And now in the end the importance of a miracle is only as much as the status of salt in food. There are many places beyond the threshold of God, do not stop at the threshold. Every miracle of Sadhguru is the mother of faith. Every miracle means light, not livelihood.",

It is not appropriate to cast lots for every little thing in life because God has gifted us with discernment, wisdom, and conscience. When we face two options—one right and one wrong—it is easy for us to decide, because our conscience guides us to recognize right and wrong. In such situations, casting lots is unnecessary.\n\nHowever, when life presents a dilemma or confusion where both options are good and lead to the path of virtue (shreyas), and we are unable to make a decision, then we may cast lots. At such times, casting lots becomes a spiritual tool that brings us under God’s refuge and grants peace to our minds.\n\nAn important example given in this satsang is: if someone finds a bundle of notes dropped from a neighbor’s pocket during a financial crisis, should they keep it or cast lots to decide? The wise thing is to return what belongs to others. This may disturb our mind, but if we trust the understanding and wisdom given by God, we need not wander astray.\n\nThe profound message is:\n\nUntil we progress in our spiritual practice, casting lots can be a helpful aid.\nAs our mind and soul become more devoted and united with God, our inner consciousness naturally empowers us to make correct decisions, and the need to cast lots ceases.\nIt is important to understand that casting lots should never become an excuse or a way to get our own desires fulfilled in God’s name, because God says, “I am not involved in this; I cannot be deceived.”\nTrue spiritual progress happens when we dissolve our ego, desires, and duality of the mind and attain complete oneness with the Supreme.\nThrough this satsang, we are also taught that the basis for decision-making in life should be the conscience and wisdom given by God—not doubt, confusion, or impatience. When the mind becomes clear and the soul calm, every decision naturally becomes right.\nLet us apply this teaching in our lives, reduce our ego, and take decisions with full faith and devotion towards God. Then we will find our lives become simple, powerful, and full of peace. …...more\n...more\nShow less",

Before coming to Aarti, I would like to clarify one thing, so that I can open up the depth of that Aarti easily. Every person in his lifetime goes through three stages. And some person may complete all the three stages in one lifetime or some may take many lifetimes. First stage is that I want this material world only, I want the comforts and luxuries of this material world. This is the first stage. So even the devotion to God is done for the material things only. They do devotion but the devotion is for fulfilling desires. They want material world. That is the first stage. But doing this devotion for fulfilling desires, little bit of faith increases, gets clarity, the depth of life begins to open. Then the person reaches second stage. Here he says he wants God also. Means along with the material world he also wants God. He reaches the second stage. From Wanting only material world, wants God also. If the devotion continues and he goes deeper in devotion, after many stumbles, after opening up of more depths of life he reaches the third and the last stage, wants God only. That state is known as Mumuksha. Wants God only. Wants only exclusive devotion towards Sadguru. Wants nothing other than this. The Aarti that you mentioned Aarti Saibaba covers all these three stage That is why I thought I should make this clear first so that when I open it up it will become clearer. There are 7 verses and all the verses highlights all the three stages. It begins with wanting only the material world and ends with wanting God only. Madhavrao Adkarji wanted to say that direct devotion, understanding your heart, catching your emotions, your stature is so high that my awareness can never reach there. Even then in the right way, Baba wanted to instil humbleness in them.
