They don't understand the Guru's will. They are living according to their own will. So it's like wandering in a circle. Our situation is also the same. We are also worshipping Baba, but we are just like those four people who are wandering in a circle. So we are going to end up in the same place again. And all the effort we have made by walking this far will be wasted. So in the end, the nomad asks them, \"Oh, it's okay, gentlemen. Your ego has fallen now If you still don't want to tell me what you are looking for, don't tell me. But at least it's afternoon. Eat some bread, drink some water, and then leave\" At this, Baba's heart melts. Baba feels, \"What is this man's self-interest in this?\" If someone can have such selfless love in their heart, he cannot be an ordinary person. He is feeling my hunger. He is feeling my thirst. So I should listen to what this man says. So Baba stays there but the other three thinks \"where we are getting caught up in this\", infact they think that wherever we go this nomand is coming ,they take it with that perspective so they move forward and as per written in sai satcharitra the story continues as that the nomad offers Baba a piece of bread and Baba have that piece of bread and as they are drinking water, the Guru appears. It's like that, right? The question is, the Guru appears... does it mean that some Baba with a beard and mustache appeared? And the nomad disappeared? Or did the nomad stay there, and another man appeared as the Guru? Or did Baba already have a Guru? Because he didn't. The chapter says that all four of them, including Baba, went in search of the Supreme Soul's knowledge on their own. So what does the leela say? That as long as we were living according to our own will, he was just a simple nomad. But as soon as he said, \"Eat this bread and drink some water,\" as soon as his will was accepted, as soon as they listened to him, ate that bread, and drank water, that same nomad became the true Guru. So today, the statue of Baba in the Samadhi Mandir in Shirdi, is he a nomad for us, or is he the true Guru? Everyone should decide for themselves. As long as we don't understand his will and practice devotion according to our own will, we are just wandering in the forest. But now, if we start to understand his will, and the leelas start to unravel, we are getting closer to his heart, and we are changing ourselves then he is our true Guru. Otherwise, remember, he is no more than a nomad. It means our own faith will either make him an ordinary nomad or the leader of the universe, the true Guru. That is our faith only. If we live by his will, then he is sacchidanand sadguru sainath, then he is he leader of the universe And if we live according to our own will without knowing his will, and if we worship him according to our will, then that leader of universe is no motre than a nomad for you. Nobody Even though he is the leader of the universe, you have made him a simple nomad. So from today, we have to decide whether we want to keep him as a simple nomad or make him the leader of the universe and place him in our hearts and live by his will. We have to decide. So these leelas are not as simple as they seem. Every leela leaves some enlightenment and some depth. If we chant the slogan \"Sacchidananda Sadguru Sainath Maharaj Ki Jai,\" we have the right to do so only on the day we understand his will. When we are ready to live by his will, when we know and understand his will, and we have the courage to change ourselves accordingly, only then will he be our true Guru. Otherwise, we are just going on a pilgrimage to Shirdi, but we are only seeing a nomad. These are bitter words, but you have to listen. We have no other option. We have to decide whether we want to keep him as a simple nomad or make him the leader of the universe and place him in our hearts. From today, our thoughts will decide this.     "Description": "✨Shri Sai Satcharitra Adhyay 6✨\n\nWhy Did Sai Baba Celebrate Gopalkala Right After Ram Navami?\n\nIn this deeply reflective episode, Krishna ji unfolds the profound significance of a unique tradition started by Sai Baba in Shirdi — celebrating *Ram Navami and Urs on the same day, followed by \"Gopalkala\" the very next day.\n\nThis event, described in Chapter 6 of the Shri Sai Satcharitra, is not just about festivals. It carries timeless spiritual truths about unity, surrender, and the journey from discipline to divine joy.\n\nFirst, the Message of Oneness:\nBy choosing to celebrate a Hindu and a Muslim festival together, Sai Baba gave a powerful and living message of 'Sarva Dharma Sambhav' — that all paths lead to the same divine. For Baba, religion was not a barrier, but a bridge. This celebration reflected his teaching of unity beyond form, ritual, and name.\n\nThen, the Inner Journey:\nRam Navami symbolises the path of duty, control, and righteousness — the disciplined life of Lord Rama. But Baba didn’t stop there. The very next day, he had devotees celebrate Gopalkala — a symbol of the playful, blissful energy of Krishna.\n\nThis reveals a deeper truth. Only after walking the path of dharma and restraint like Rama can one be ready for the divine love, joy, and surrender that Krishna represents.\n\nFrom Adnaya Chakra to Sahastrahara — The Spiritual Ascent:\nKrishna ji explains how this journey is not only mythological but internal. From the Adnaya chakra, representing will and clarity, the soul travels to the Sahastrara — the final union with the divine, where Krishna consciousness awakens. A spiritual journey from lord Ram to lord Krishna \n\nSai Baba’s Silent Teaching:\nBaba didn’t give lectures. He lived his wisdom. Through these three days of celebration — Ram Navami, Urs, and Gopalkala — he gave a complete path to the seeker. From discipline to devotion, from control to surrender, from duality to oneness.\n\nThis episode is a must-watch for every spiritual seeker and Sai devotee who wishes to understand Baba’s deeper message.\n\n-------------------------\n0:00 - Introduction\n\n1:51 - Reason behind celebrating Ramnavmi and Urus on same day \n\n2:37 - Spiritual journey Ram to Krishna \n\n5:01 - Agya Chakra to Sahastra / Yog Sadhna \n\n7:18 - Essence of this Leela \n------------------------\n\n✨श्री साई सच्चरित्र – अध्याय 6✨\n\nश्री साई सच्चरित्र – अध्याय 6 में वर्णित यह प्रसंग केवल एक धार्मिक उत्सव नहीं, बल्कि एक साधक की संपूर्ण आत्मिक यात्रा का संकेत है। इस वीडियो में कृष्णा जी बहुत सरल लेकिन गूढ़ ढंग साईबाबा की इस लीला रहस्य इस विडीओ समझाते हैं ।\n\nसर्वधर्म समभाव का संदेश \nसाई बाबा ने शिरडी में रामनवमी (हिंदू पर्व) और उर्स (मुस्लिम उत्सव) एक ही दिन मनवाकर यह बताया कि धर्म अलग हो सकते हैं, लेकिन परमात्मा एक ही हैं। यह लीला कर के बाबाने दुनियाको सर्वधर्म समभाव की सीख दि है।\n\nगोपालकाला – उत्सव की पूर्ति नहीं, आत्मा की पूर्णता:\nरामनवमी के अगले दिन बाबा ने गोपालकाला मनवाया। क्यों की बाबा भक्तो को ये समझाना चाहते थे की 'राम का जीवन संयम , दुःख और मर्यादा का है,'\nजबकि कृष्ण का जीवन आनंद
